Title: Dream of joining Delhi Police crushed but not before 27-year-old saves three
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Amit Balyan

NEW DELHI: Amit Balyan , who was at the forefront of the firefighting operation at Peeragarhi, was one of the brightest men Delhi Fire Service (DFS) had inducted last year. Apart from basic training, the 27-year-old had also received search and rescue lessons. When the building came crashing down, Balyan stayed put to help a caretaker and two workers escape the blaze.

Fire officials said even after being trapped, Balyan kept relaying his location to his colleagues. However, he fell unconscious due to excessive bleeding and inhalation of smoke. His death has left his colleagues and family members in shock and despair.

The fireman’s father, Babu Ram, an assistant sub-inspector with Delhi Police posted at Anand Vihar police station, was inconsolable when informed about his son’s death. “He was my only working son. I can’t believe that he is gone at such a young age,” he said, with tears rolling down his cheeks.

Balyan was a huge support to his younger brother, who is still studying, and two married sisters. Family members said he had been trying to crack the Delhi Police exam. He had earlier cleared the Uttar Pradesh Police exam, but didn’t join the force as he wanted to be with his family in Delhi.

He had married Shivani, a UP Police constable posted in Ghaziabad, after a brief love affair in February last year. “We have told his wife that he has been admitted to the ICU. We are waiting for her to return from duty,” said a family member.

A resident of Meet Nagar in Loni, Balyan was inducted into DFS during a mass recruitment drive. He joined Kirti Nagar fire station as an operator last June. His family is originally from Shamli in Uttar Pradesh.

Harish, Balyan’s batchmate and friend, said, “We joined training on December 10, 2018. He was a jovial man and the life of our friends’ circle.”

Title: Bengaluru: Over 4 lakh visitors expected at Chitra Santhe on Sunday
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Students create a tea bag installation at CKP for upcoming Chitra Santhe in Bengaluru, on Thursday

BENGALURU: The 17th edition of Chitra Santhe — Art for All — will be held on January 5.

Organised by Karnataka Chitrakala Parishath , the santhe will be held on Kumara Krupa Road from 8am to 8pm. The organisers are expecting more than four lakh visitors this year, as against last year’s 3.5 lakh.

According to the parishath, this year’s event which will be dedicated to farmers, will showcase artists from across the country. Last year, the santhe theme was ‘Gandhiji’, commemorating his150th birth anniversary.

MJ Kamalakshi, general secretary, CKP told TOI 1,500 artists will participate in the mela. “We will also give four awards to artists from the state and one national-level award to a well-known artist from Chennai,” she said.

The national-level award, which has been named after Prof MS Nanjunda Rao, founder of CKP, will be presented to artist RB Bhaskaran from Chennai. He will be awarded a cash of Rs 1 lakh.

The four state-level awards have been named after different personalities and will be given to artists with a cash award of Rs 50,000.

Title: EFT Tapping: 5-step process to relieve anxiety, stress, lose weight and much more
Content: While ailments hurt, sometimes, it is the emotional pain and negative energies that burn us out and results in stress, which becomes the root cause of health problems like anxiety, nervous disorders, weight gain and also disrupt body functioning. Hence, it is absolutely important to attend to our emotional problems at the root level.EFT Tapping (Emotional Freedom Technique) is one such holistic healing therapy that can alternatively work in providing the solution to some of your problem.Also known as a form of 'psychological acupressure', this form of treatment relies on the power of tapping certain points on the body, create a power balance, to match all your energy levels, eliminate the negative energy points and pain as well.While the method is still under research, EFT has also been found to be rather helpful in treating mental health disorders like PTSD (Post Traumatic Stress Disorder) and depression as well.EFT is a form of acupuncture which lays emphasis on pressing some sensitive points (also referred to as the meridian points) located in different places to restore the balance of the body. According to Chinese medicine, these power points act as powerful pathways that restore energy flow, maintain health and prevent imbalances.While traditional acupuncture relies on the usage of traditional needles, EFT uses the power of fingertip tapping to channelize the body's energy circles and relieve any stress or chronic pain, disease or even sickness which might have been caused by a negative or traumatic experience.According to experts, this tapping technique, in a very sensitive way, gives you access to the body's energy levels at the root and connects you to the nerves in the brain which control stress. When you do this, you are in control of the stress and negative experiences and relatively, in a better way to restore body balance.Since this technique involves the use of no tools or prior knowledge, EFT can be learned in a few simple steps and help get rid of negative energies in an effective manner. Once memorized, each round of it can be performed in about 30 seconds.First and foremost, you need to get in sync with your body and know what is troubling you, or the fear you have, which will direct you to the connecting tapping point. Make a mental note and make sure you target one issue at a time to harness the most benefits. It can range from any embarrassing situation, a traumatic statement, physical pain, injury or even stress.Now that you know the issue in hand, assign a number (between 1-10) to it, depending on the intensity of pain it brings. Remember, your goal is to bring the number down to the minimum and see the improvement. To do this, follow this technique:-If the issue brings you distress and you feel a tugging pain, assign a number accordingly.-Physical pain and ailment can be assigned a number, depending on your threshold.-If the problem is not letting you perform, number it, depending on how close/far you are to achieving it.After the numbering, now begins the tapping. Before you do this, start by practicing a positive affirmation, which goes like:"Despite (what your problem is), I accept myself and I am trying to change.Next, start by tapping specific points on the body, which are below mentioned, in an ascending manner:Eyebrow-Side of the eye-Under the eye-Under the nose-Chin-Tip of the collarbone and under the arm- Top of the Head.Follow this tapping routine, according to the sequence and keep repeating the affirmation. This will help you stay focused on reaching the goal.Now that you have completed the tapping sequence, go back to your root issue and now number the pain intensity you feel, comparing it with the older one.If you feel a difference, EFT tapping has helped you. Ideally, you should regularly practice this till the time you reach 0.

Title: Four Panaji Congressmen support CAA, 3 join BJP
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

PANAJI: A day ahead of BJP’s mega rally in support of citizenship law to be addressed by party working president J P Nadda, four Congress’ functionaries of its Panaji unit came out in support of the citizenship amendment Act (CAA) with three of them joining the saffron party on Thursday.

Congress hurriedly dissolved its entire Panaji block and said a new committee would be constituted after discussing with the block members.

These Congressmen, who had participated in the anti-CAA agitation in Panaji last week, said they were quitting the party as it was misguiding people.

“We are resigning as we oppose the wrongful stand taken by the party on CAA and the National Register of Citizens (NRC),” Prasad Amonkar, who held the post of the Panaji block president, said.

The move comes nearly five months after 10 of the 15 Congress MLAs defected to BJP in July.

‘Workers were pressurised’

Amonkar along with North Goa general secretary Dinesh Kubbal, Shivraj Tarcar and Javed Sheikh also said they were fed up with the party’s style of functioning and described Congress as “haywire” and “directionless”.

Congress functionaries said BJP had pressurised its four members to quit to “demoralise the agitation against CAA”. One of the four said they had joined BJP because Congress had become “defunct” with just four-five individuals taking decisions for the party.

Amonkar made it clear that the move to the saffron camp was guided by Panaji legislator Atanasio Monserrate, who joined BJP after being elected on a Congress ticket.

“We support Monserrate, because he is pro-development and he is helping the people of Panaji,” Amonkar said.

The four rebel Congress members said that they would support BJP’s development agenda.

North Goa district Congress president Vijay Bhike said, “BJP hopes that our spirit and our agitation against NRC and CAA will die down. That is why after taking our legislators, they are touching our workers.”

Title: The Kalapani dispute: All you need to know
Content:
So what is the

Kalapani dispute

?

The MEA on Thursday clarified that India's political map released after reorganisation of J&K has in no manner revised the boundary with Nepal. The timing is significant, as it comes amid an unease with Nepal over territorial claims of the Kalapani trijuntion of India-Nepal-China. Nepal media has carried reports of a likely bilateral dialogue with India on Jan 15 over the issue.Kalapani is a 372-sq km area at the China-Nepal-India tri-junction. India claims Kalapani as a part of Uttarakhand while Nepal depicts the area in its map. The border dispute flared up again recently after India released its new political map, following the reorganisation of J&K, showing the area as its own.According to the Sugauli treaty signed between Nepal and British India in 1816, the Mahakali river that runs through the Kalapani area is the boundary between the two countries. However, British surveyors subsequently showed the origin of the river, which has many tributaries, at different places. While Nepal claims that the river west of the disputed territory is the main river and so Kalapani falls in its territory, India claims a different origin and includes the area in its territory.Strategically, Lipulekh Pass in Kalapani serves as an important vantage point for India to keep an eye on Chinese movements. Since 1962, Kalapani has been manned by the Indo-Tibetan Border Police.Nepal’s Supreme Court has this week sought the country’s original map exchanged with India during the signing of the Sugauli Treaty, the one exchanged while signing a boundary treaty with India in 1960, the map published by the East-India Company on February 1, 1827, and a separate map published by the British Government in 1847.Kalapani is such an emotive issue for Nepal and its citizens that India’s decision to expand trade with China through the Lipulekh Pass created a furore in Kathmandu with the Nepal Parliament seeking to know from the government if the India-China agreement undermined Nepal’s sovereignty.

Title: Leaking manhole gives nightmares to Begur residents
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

The entire locality stinks, but the authorities remain indifferent

BENGALURU: A manhole in Begur has been overflowing for 40 days now. With sewage flowing on neighbourhood roads, stench and fear of a disease outbreak pervade the air in the southeast Bengaluru locality.

With the civic agencies in charge of fixing the problem busy pointing fingers at each other, residents are clueless about where to go.

“We have written over a hundred emails to both the agencies — BWSSB and BBMP — to fix the sewage line and plug the manhole. But the agencies are paying no heed,” said Kiran N, a resident of Begur. With sewage all over the place, the entire locality stinks, but officials remain oblivious to the problem, he added.

Laxmikanth SR, a retired bank employee who lives in the same area, told TOI his grandson has been suffering from viral fever for one week and doctors are blaming it on the filthy water.

Narasimha K (name changed), a general physician who runs a clinic in Begur, said running sewage can cause many diseases, including viral flu, fever, cold and cough. “Sewage breeds certain bacteria and insects, which can lead to many health issues,” he added.

Ashwin Bhattar, an entomologist at district vectorborne disease control programme, Bengaluru Urban and other health workers visited Begur on Thursday and inspected the overflowing manhole.

“Residents need not fear the rise in incidence of dengue due to sewage overflow. Mosquitoes do not breed in dirty water ,” Bhatta said, adding: “But there are high chances of viral flu and common cold in the locality due to this issue.”

Bhattar said there is a high possibility of sewage increasing larvae breeding and this could be risky for residents. “We have sprayed certain chemicals which will kill the larvae and also prevent mosquito-breeding. Staff from the primary health centre and ASHA workers will do a survey of the locality to spread awareness about health issues arising out of a leaky drain,” Bhattar said.

A senior health official said they will write to BBMP and BWSSB to fix the problem immediately.

“The BBMP and BWSSB need to work in coordination and resolve the sewage issue,” the senior official said.

Title: Narendra Modi in Karnataka: Fast-track suburban rail in Bengaluru: Citizens to PM Modi
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Prime Minister Narendra Modi

BENGALURU: With Prime Minister Narendra Modi on a two-day visit to Karnataka , a few citizen groups and civic activists have launched a campaign on social media asking the government to speed up the suburban rail project.

The 37-year-old project is stuck as the special purpose vehicle, which is likely to be christened Bengaluru Rail Infrastructure Development Enterprises (B-RIDE), is yet to be set up though the extended railway board (ERB) gave its nod in November. As part of the #ChukuBukuCabinetClearanceBeku campaign, citizen groups have sought the PM’s intervention, saying the project has not gained momentum despite BJP-led governments at the Centre and state.

Sources say the draft cabinet note for the project is now before the finance ministry. “It was supposed to be approved by the Centre by now but has been delayed due to some reasons. We hope the approval will be granted by this month-end,” said an official. Sources say Karnataka Rail Infrastructure Development Enterprises (K-RIDE), which is supposed to execute the project, recently launched its website (www.kride.in) and a new office will be set up at Samparka Soudha in Rajajinagar .

Title: Two-day seminar on 'Make in India' organised in Bengaluru
Content: BENGALURU: A two-day national summit on 'Make in India' will be held in the city on January 10 and 11. Organised by Xavier Institute of Management and Entrepreneurship (XIME), Bengaluru at its campus in Electronic City, the National summit 2020 on 'Make in India' will have over 20 speakers sharing various ideas and perspectives on the topic.The seminar will be inaugurated by Nitin Gadkari, the Union Minister of Road, Transport and Highways. The guest of honour of the seminar will be Dr Jaimini Bhagwati, IFS (Retd.) & Former Indian High Commissioner to the UK, and author of "The Promise of India".Prof J. Philip Chairman, XIME & Former Director, IIM Bangalore said: "Through the two-day National Seminar, we want to encourage the entrepreneurial spirit among the youngsters and spread awareness about 'Make in India'."The two-day seminar will witness dignitaries from different industries such as automobiles, biotechnology, infrastructure, oil and gas etc. For details visit http://xime.org/makeinindia/.

Title: Bigg Boss 13: Mahira Sharma slaps Paras Chhabra; latter says 'I stay away from girls who slap guys'
Content: In the upcoming episode of Bigg Boss 13 , Mahira Sharma and Rashami Desai get into an argument and within no time they get into a war of words. Asim tells Shefali Bagga, Madhurima, Rashami and he will be eating rotis. Mahira tells them that she does not want food to get wasted. Rashami tells she will make rotis on her own and she does not want to eat the rotis made by Mahira as she is negative.Mahira gets angry with Paras Chhabra. He asks her why she is frustrated and is fighting with him. He goes to cover her mouth forcefully and she slaps him on his face. Paras loses his calm and yells at her. He tells Mahira that he stays away from girls who slap guys and for him, his self-respect comes first.Meanwhile, an astrologer enters the house and talks to housemates about their future. The astrologer talks about the future of Rashami, Madhurima Tuli , Arti Singh and other housemates.The astrologer can be seen telling Rashami that any kind of commitment right now can add troubles for her. He tells Madhurima that she does not want to settle down herself.She says her career didn’t take off because of her own mistakes. The astrologer tells Sidharth Shukla that he gets into trouble because of his emotions and trust. An astrologer tells Arti that she might get married soon and also gives a powerful advice to Shehnaz Gill. Stay tuned for more updates on Bigg Boss 13.

Title: Archers told to fend for themselves as Olympic trials begin
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Deepika Kumari. (Getty Images)

NEW DELHI: India’s top recurve archers are distraught after being told to arrange for their own boarding and lodging in Pune where they have assembled to compete in a selection trial for the Tokyo Olympics qualifiers .

The three-day trials have been directed by the Delhi High Court-appointed five-member transitory committee. The committee has members from the sports ministry, Sports Authority of India (SAI), Indian Olympic Association ( IOA ) and the two suspended factions of the Archery Association of India (AAI).

The trials for both men and women recurve archers, scheduled to be held at the Army Sports Institute (ASI) Pune from January 4 to 6 will be attended by Olympians Deepika Kumari, Bombayla Devi and Atanu Das among others. The archers are also upset about the fact that while they and accompanying coaches/officials have been asked to foot their own bills, the transitory committee has surprisingly cleared the trip of selection committee members at the government’s cost. “Travelling (to and fro economy class air fare), boarding and lodging would be provided as per norms,” read a recent circular issued by the committee.

TOI spoke to some of the archers, who said they have been finding it difficult to book an accommodation as most of the good hotels are situated far off from the ASI. “Imagine you have a trial coming up for the Olympic qualifier, but are told to arrange for your own boarding and lodging rather than focus on training. As per the norms, it’s the duty of the federation (in this case the SAI since the AAI is suspended) to arrange for boarding and lodging since it’s a trial connected to Olympic qualification. When a selection trial was conducted in Sonepat in August last year, the boarding and lodging was taken care of by SAI. So, what has happened this time?” asked an archer.

An ASI official, who deals with the residential wing, informed TOI that no booking order for stay of men’s recurve archers was received from the SAI till Friday. However, when TOI contacted a transitory committee member, he assured that the accommodation will be provided to the participating archers after the first day of trial, when the numbers of competing archers will drop following their elimination, and there will be a fewer archers to accommodate in ASI. Later, the same official added that the arrangements have been made for accommodation. The archers are yet to be notified about it. “No such information has reached us. We are still searching for hotels,” an archer said.

The ASI doesn’t have any residential facility for women athletes. It only allows male athletes which only raises a question: Where will the women stay if accommodation is arranged at ASI?

Title: FIR filed against 13 for cheating, forgery
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

PANAJI: An FIR has been registered against 13 individuals after office-bearers of the Serula comunidade complained that they had assumed the rights of a property in Socorro by impersonating its owner who died in 2005.

The complaint alleged that the accused had forged the signature of Arjun Mahadev Vazarkar for a mutation process that was completed in 2017. The property lies in survey number 404/1 and measures close to 8,000sqm, the FIR registered in Porvorim police station has stated.

Agnelo C Lobo, then attorney of the Serula comunidade, has also been named in the FIR for allegedly issuing an NOC to do the mutation sans verification. The accused succeeded in deleting Vazarkar’s name and adding theirs as owners in revenue records, the FIR has stated.

The complaint was filed three months ago by comunidade president Alex V A D’Souza and others. The accused face charges under IPC sections 419 (cheating), 465 (punishment for forgery), 467 (forgery of valuable document) 468 (forgery for purpose of cheating) and 471 (using as genuine forged document) read with Section 34.

Title: Tiger mauls tigress to death ‘for not being receptive’ in Udaipur
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Damini, the 13-year-old tigress, was one of the major attractions at the zoo ever since she was brought here f... Read More

UDAIPUR: A tigress was mauled to death by a tiger that barged into her enclosure at the Sajjangarh Zoological Park in Udaipur on Thursday afternoon .

Damini, the 13-year-old tigress, was one of the major attractions at the zoo ever since she was brought here from Pune. The male tiger, Kumar, had been brought later from Karnataka and both the big cats were kept in separate enclosures adjacently.

The male tiger that crept into Damini’s cage attacked her perhaps because she was not receptive of his approaches. The struggle between the big cats was witnessed by many visitors who were around the area at the moment.

Big cats introductions can be perilous even if they are kept in adjacent close enclosures where they can see, smell and react to each other, experts said.

“A male tiger is very powerful and it takes only minutes for it to maul the female if she isn’t in the oestrus cycle (the period in the sexual cycle of female mammals). Perhaps this would have been the case with Damini, which was killed by Kumar. This is the first case where any male animal has killed a female partner. Whether it is negligence on the part of the caretakers at the park or the substandard material of the fencing that the tiger found a way to enter Damini’s enclosure, would only be known after a detailed investigation,” Rahul Bhatnagar, retired CCF said.

None of the authorities from the forest department were available for a comment.

Title: 'It's exceptional': Liverpool sink Blades to make it a year unbeaten
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Liverpool, Jan 3 (AFP) Jurgen Klopp hailed "exceptional" Liverpool after they made it an entire calendar year without a Premier League defeat as the runaway leaders beat Sheffield United 2-0 on Thursday. Klopp's side moved 13 points clear of second placed Leicester thanks to goals from Egypt forward Mohamed Salah and Senegal winger Sadio Mane at Anfield. Liverpool's 19th win in 20 league games this season completed an incredible 12 months for a team at the peak of their powers. The Reds haven't lost in 37 league games since a defeat at Manchester City on January 3, 2019 and it looks certain they will win the English title for the first time since 1990. With a game in hand to further bolster their advantage, it would take an astonishing collapse to deprive Liverpool of their holy grail. "It says a lot of positive things. I have not enough words for it, it is exceptional," Klopp said. "I'm really happy and really proud of the boys. We should not take things like this for granted." Winners of their last 18 home league games, Liverpool are unbeaten in 51 top-flight matches at Anfield dating back to April 2017. As if it wasn't hard enough to beat Liverpool already, they are proving more impregnable than ever lately. This was their fifth consecutive top-flight clean-sheet -- the first time they have managed that since 2007 -- and they completed more passes than any team in one match in the Premier League era. "The way we controlled Sheffield United was exceptional. In possession we were incredible, we were calm but lively as well. The goals we scored were exceptional," Klopp said. "It's obviously good (to go unbeaten for a year) but the target was not to extend this, but to win the game. "We did not think about the one year (undefeated). We have season resolutions, not New Year resolutions!" After a golden 2019 saw Liverpool crowned European and Club World champions, the next target is ending Manchester City's two-year spell as champions after narrowly missing out last season. Their sights set on domestic bliss, the new year started just as the old one finished, with Liverpool setting standards of excellence that rival anything achieved by City's breath-taking team. Premier League immortality is within touching distance as Klopp's men are already over halfway towards an unbeaten league season that would replicate the incredible feat of Arsenal's 2003-04 Invincibles. Liverpool hadn't even kicked off when they suffered what could have been a distracting blow as Naby Keita was replaced by James Milner after being injured in the warm-up. But the Reds are far too polished to lose focus and they were in front within four minutes. - Flushed with success - ======================== Their win at Bramall Lane in September had come thanks to a mistake from United keeper Dean Henderson and once again Liverpool benefitted from a Blades blunder. When Virgil van Dijk played a long pass towards Andrew Robertson, it should have been easy for George Baldock to deal with. But Baldock lost his footing and fell over, allowing Robertson to advance and cross low to Salah, who got in front of Jack O'Connell to steer in a clinical close-range finish for his 14th goal of the season. Ahead of their first visit to Anfield for 13 year, Chris Wilder's down-to-earth side took the unusual decision to train alongside the public on Stanley Park in the shadow of the famous stadium. The session was interrupted when a dog decided to use one of the training cones as a toilet. That unpromising omen proved apt as the visitors' hopes of a shock result were flushed away. Liverpool's ability to press any opponent into submission and deliver the knockout blow with their lethal front three has made them virtually unplayable over the last 18 months. United were the latest victims as Mane wrapped up the points in the 64th minute. Running onto Robertson's pass, Mane broke into the area and took Salah's return pass before firing gleefully into the roof of the net after his initial shot was saved. (AFP) APA APA

Title: Moldova anthem gaffe kicks off ATP Cup in Australia
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Sydney, Jan 3 (AFP) Australian organisers for the new tennis team championship were left red-faced on Friday by playing the wrong national anthem for a player from Moldova, a small landlocked country in eastern Europe. The embarrassing gaffe occurred ahead of the opening singles tie in Sydney of the ATP Cup between Moldova's Alexander Cozbinov and Belgium's Steve Darcis. "At the start of the Moldova v Belgium match we mistakenly played the wrong national anthem for Moldova," the ATP admitted. "We are sincerely sorry and have apologised personally to Team Moldova." Tournament officials told AFP the Romanian anthem was played instead. Moldova, bordered by Romania and Ukraine, was one of the last countries to qualify for the inaugural team event being played in Sydney, Brisbane and Perth. They are spearheaded by world number 46 Radu Albot, who broke new ground in 2019 by becoming his country's first ATP Tour title winner at Delray Beach. He is joined by Cozbinov, ranked 818, Egor Matvievici and Dmitrii Baskov in a group that also features Britain, Belgium and Bulgaria. The ATP Cup has 24 nations split into six groups across the three cities, with eight teams emerging from the round-robin to compete in a knockout phase in Sydney until one country is left standing. (AFP) AT AT

Title: Photos: Cold winds sweep Uttarakhand; snowfall in higher reaches
Content:
Munsyari in Pithoragarh district and Auli in Chamoli in particular were covered in a white blanket leading to ... Read More

Photo: ANI

Photo: ANI

Photo: ANI

DEHRADUN: Mercury dipped in most parts of the Himalayan state as cold winds swept throughout the day on Thursday in Dehradun and other areas. While the plains witnessed rainfall, the higher reaches received a spell of snowfall. Munsyari in Pithoragarh district and Auli in Chamoli in particular were covered in a white blanket leading to tourists in these places rejoicing at experiencing the first snowfall of the year.Sucharita Dasgupta, a tourist from Kolkata, who had come with her family to Munsyari said, “Seeing the mountains getting covered in snow right in front of our eyes was a sight that we will never forget.”The Met department has predicted similar conditions for the next few days as well. According to weather experts, for the next one week, the day hours are expected to remain in the grip of cold wave with moderate rainfall expected on January 6, 7 and 8.Director of regional meteorological centre Bikram Singh told TOI, “There will be a further dip in temperature in the coming days. From January 6 onwards, the state is expected to witness moderate rainfall in most parts. Overcast conditions would also prevail. A respite from cold weather conditions is likely only from January 10 onwards.”

Title: UP Board scraps ‘no shoes inside’ rule for examinees
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

File photo used for representational purpose

LUCKNOW: Students appearing for class X and XII exams of UP Secondary Education Board ( UPSEB ) will not be forced to take out shoes and socks. Instead, checking would be done at the entrance of exam centres.

In 2019, in the absence of official order, there were complaints of invigilators compelling students to take out shoes in a bid to be extra cautious. The matter was also raised in the Assembly on February 14.

In a review meet, chief secretary RK Tiwari directed Board officials and all DIOS to ensure students are not put to discomfort by taking out their shoes while writing exams. Instead, they should be checked at the entrance of centre itself. He also instructed banning of loudspeakers near centres. Section 144 would also be promulgated near exam centres to ban assembly of people.

“The government has taken adequate measures like CCTV, webcasting, STF deployment, colour coding of answersheets to check copying so centre superintendents and invigilators need not take extreme steps unless directed. Last year, the students were put to discomfort by some centre superintendents,” said Shivlal, additional secretary, UPSEB after the Wednesday meet.

The centres in sensitive districts would be monitored by STF for the second consecutive year. Emphasis would be given to sensitive districts, including Aligarh, Rampur, Mathura, Muzaffarnagar, Ballia, Ghazipur, Pratapgarh, Mainpuri, Gonda, Balrampur, Hardoi, Kaushambi, Jaunpur, Hathras and Etah.

This year, 56.01 lakh students would be appearing in HS and Inter exams beginning simultaneously on February 18. They would end by March 6 and results are likely by April 25.

Title: Kyrgios to donate $140 for each ace to help bushfire relief
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Sydney, Jan 3 (AFP) Nick Kyrgios has pledged Aus$200 (US$140) for each ace he serves across the Australian summer of tennis to support victims of bushfires raging around the country, with the ATP Cup Friday also promising help. The temperamental Australian, a controversial figure in the sport with a bad boy reputation, has been at the forefront of rallying support among players to help. "I'm kicking off the support for those affected by the fires. I'll be donating $200 per ace that I hit across all the events I play this summer," tweeted the 24-year-old, who was handed a 16-week suspended ban in September after a series of outbursts. His Australian teammate at the inaugural ATP Cup Alex de Minaur went one better. "I like this, I will go $250 per ace, just because I don't think I'll be hitting as many aces as you mate," he replied. The blazes have claimed 18 lives and forced mass evacuations, with the country bracing for a weekend heatwave expected to fan the deadly infernos. Kyrgios, who will also play the Kooyong Classic and the Australian Open Grand Slam this month, on Thursday issued a call for fundraisers for victims of the fires, which prompted Australia's tennis chief Craig Tiley to get on board. "We want to help these communities in a meaningful way and will announce a number of fund raising and support initiatives that will be rolled out across the ATP Cup, Australian Open and our other events over the coming weeks," said Tiley. The fires have been a big talking point ahead of the 24-team ATP Cup, which gets underway Friday in Brisbane, Perth and Sydney with top names including Novak Djokovic and Rafael Nadal playing. Tournament director Tom Larner announced that each ace served at the 10-day event would deliver Aus$100 to bushfire relief. The initiative is forecast to raise around Aus$150,000, with more than 1,500 aces expected to sent down over the duration of the January 3-12 tournament. "Communities across the whole country have been devastated by the bushfire crisis and at this time of the year, with our events in full swing, tennis has a unique opportunity to support the relief and recovery efforts," he said. "Most of the players are already keen to score aces and win a quick point, and having the chance to raise money for the bushfire appeal will give them that extra bit of motivation." ATP Cup officials will be relying on on-site medical experts to monitor air quality in Sydney, where cricket and golf events have been affected by haze from the fires in recent weeks. However, players have said they were not worried about smoky conditions. (AFP) APA APA

Title: Premier League clubs set to splash out in January sales
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

London, Jan 3 (AFP) The Premier League's January sales are open for business as clubs rush to snap up new year bargains in the one-month transfer window. Liverpool are running away with the title race and have already signed Japanese star Takumi Minamino, so the Reds are likely to sit out the frenzy while the chasing pack try to make the additions that could help them close the gap. Here, AFP Sport looks at the key transfer issues to address for the teams hoping to hang onto Liverpool's coat-tails: Chelsea ======= Chelsea boss Frank Lampard is expected to make a big splash after being unable to sign players in the summer window due to the club's transfer ban. With that two-window suspension halved by the Court of Arbitration for Sport, Lampard needs several new recruits to help accelerate the development of his promising young team. Armed with a reported �150 million transfer war-chest, Lampard will look to improve at left-back, where Emerson and Marcos Alonso have been too inconsistent. The Blues have already been linked with Leicester's Ben Chilwell to fill that role, but Lampard might not be satisfied with only one signing. Having constantly bemoaned Chelsea's lack of cutting edge against defensive opponents, the Chelsea boss needs pace on the flanks, a clinical finisher to dove-tail with Tammy Abraham and, ideally, a creative midfielder. Crystal Palace forward Wilfried Zaha, Leipzig striker Timo Werner and Lyon forward Moussa Dembele are among Lampard's mooted targets. Manchester United ================= Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has revealed Manchester United are "looking at one or two" players after learning Paul Pogba will be absent for the next month. France midfielder Pogba has been advised to undergo surgery on his ankle and that is a problem for United manager Solskjaer, who is already without Scott McTominay due to a knee injury. "Of course it is playing on our decision making when we have two players out - Paul for a month and Scott for two," Solskjaer said. "If it's available and if it's possible we will do something, definitely." Solskjaer missed out on promising striker Erling Braut Haaland, who has signed for Borussia Dortmund from Red Bull Salzburg. Aston Villa midfielder Jack Grealish, Leicester duo Ricardo Pereira and James Maddison, as well as Dortmund's Jadon Sancho have all seen their names connected to Old Trafford. Arsenal ======= Mikel Arteta admits Arsenal could be more active than expected after Calum Chambers had surgery on a knee injury that will rule him out for a lengthy period. It leaves new Gunners boss Arteta short of options in defence and he will meet with technical director Edu and head of football Raul Sanllehi this week to mull over their plans. "We will try to be in the market to see options that can strengthen the team, that's for sure and our obligation and we will be working on that," Arteta said. "My obligation is to give my opinion on the things we can improve. Obviously we have a bad injury with Calum a few days ago that will change our plans at the back." Arteta, who must also focus on persuading Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang to extend a contract which expires at the end of next season, has been linked with bids for Leicester midfielder Wilfred Ndidi, Atletico Madrid winger Thomas Lemar and Leipzig defender Dayot Upamecano. Tottenham, Manchester City and Leicester could be cautious shoppers ===================================================== Manchester City are trailing 11 points behind Liverpool, so a January spree might not be worthwhile for the champions. Pep Guardiola insists City will not rush into the January market because the quality of player available is generally not as high as in the summer window. But City did sign Aymeric Laporte in the 2018 winter market, so a surprise swoop isn't out of the question, especially if the signing can help in Guardiola's quest to win the Champions League for the first time since 2011. For Tottenham boss Jose Mourinho, the future of unsettled playmaker Christian Eriksen needs resolving as the Dane nears the end of his contract. While Eriksen is seemingly on the way out, Mourinho must focus on defensive reinforcements and Napoli's Elseid Hysaj, Marseille's Hiroki Sakai, Bournemouth's Nathan Ake and West Ham's Issa Diop are said to be on his shopping list. With second placed Leicester flying high, Brendan Rodgers maintains nobody will be leaving despite plenty of interest in his talented squad. Rodgers is on the lookout for fresh faces, with Juventus defender Merih Demiral and AC Milan's Hakan Calhanoglu potential targets. (AFP) APA APA

Title: Alia Bhatt's expression in THIS photo shared by Shaheen Bhatt speaks volumes about her mood
Content: Kangana Ranaut fans were in for a surprise on August 21 as the actress announced her arrival on Twitter. And within 10 days of her debut on the micro-blogging site, Kangana has clocked 1 million followers. In an exclusive interaction with ETimes, Kangana Ranaut opened up about her tryst with social media, how she deals with trolls and all things Twitter. Excerpts from the interview:

Title: Goa: Onions down by Rs 20 per kg, sell at Rs 80 per kg in retail market
Content:
Representative image

PANAJI: The start of the new year is set to bring tears of joy as the rate of onions per kg fell to Rs 67 at the state-run horticulture outlets. In the retail market, onions came down by Rs 20, selling at Rs 80 per kg.“Now, there will be a trend of regular decrease in prices. The rates will further fall by the next week and the prices of onions at the outlets runs by the Goa State Horticulture Corporation Limited (GSHCL) will normalise between January 15 to 20,” said the corporation’s managing director, Sandeep Faldesai.Though there was a drastic drop of Rs 20 within a day, vegetable vendors in the retail market said that the prices of onions will stabilise only in the third week of January. “Onions are down to Rs 80 per kg on January 2 as opposed to Rs 100 on January1. The rates are likely to fall in the coming days, but this will be a slow process.” a vendor said.After being at an all-time high for the past two months, the price of this basic kitchen commodity was expected to come down this month following the winter harvest of the horticulture crop, expected to hit the markets by mid-January. Until then, onions are being imported from Turkey into the country to tackle the shortage.Vegetable vendors in the Panaji municipal market had been selling Turkish onions at a price that was Rs 20-30 higher as compared to the Indian variant. On Thursday, however, the prices of the two varieties were found to be the same.“The Turkish onions have not been taken too well by the average Indian consumer since they are very spicy. Their lack of popularity therefore, brought the rates down, selling at Rs 80 per kg,” onion seller, Aladdin Shaikh said.

Title: FA Cup underdogs seek their moment in the sun
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

London, Jan 3 (AFP) Holders Manchester City get their FA Cup campaign underway on Saturday with their third round home tie against fourth-tier Port Vale. The eye-catching clash of the round, where all fixtures start a minute late to highlight a mental health campaign, is Sunday's Merseyside derby as runaway Premier League leaders Liverpool host Everton, who have shown a noticeable improvement since Carlo Ancelotti took over. However, the dreamers who hold onto the idea of the 'romance of the cup' will be hopeful of giantkilling exploits by the underdogs and here AFP Sport picks out three matches to justify the tag: Sheffield United (Premier League) v Fylde (National League) -- Sunday (1401GMT kick-off) The non-league team have quite a task travelling to take on the Blades who are acquitting themselves well back in the top tier. The 'Coasters' have beaten fellow non-league outfits Nantwich and Kingstonian in the previous rounds to reach this stage of the competition for the first time but this is a huge step up for the side in the relegation zone of the fifth tier of English football. However, United lost to another National League side Barnet last season at the same stage. Several of the squad including defender Andy Taylor will be familiar with the hosts having played for them. Taylor, who was a United regular in the Championship in 2009 but failed to win back his place after 14 months out with a serious injury, says they travel with belief they can pull off a major shock. "It's one I look back on with great fondness, playing at that level in a great stadium. There's always an upset, so you never know, we'll be confident, positive and will give a good account of ourselves," said the 33-year-old. Rochdale (League One) v Newcastle United (Premier League) -- Saturday (1231GMT kick-off) Rochdale may be a lowly 18th in the third tier but based on their recent FA Cup record compared to Newcastle's they can entertain genuine hopes of claiming a major scalp. Rochdale have reached the fourth round of the competition in four of the last six seasons which is one more than Newcastle have. The Magpies travel to Rochdale with their morale at a low ebb following a 3-0 home hammering by Leicester which was their fourth defeat in five matches. Adding to manager Steve Bruce's problems is an injury crisis. Four players including captain and most impressive performer this term Jonjo Shelvey went off during the Leicester defeat taking their total of injured personnel to 11. Rochdale's young Irish manager Brian Barry-Murphy has been praised for his side's style of play and victory over the old campaigner Bruce could attract more high profile clubs to the 41-year-old's qualities. The pressure is on Bruce to secure a morale boosting and much-needed win. "We have had a bad week. We have to put it right and get ready for the FA Cup at the weekend," he said. Gillingham (League One) v West Ham United (Premier League) -- Sunday (18:16GMT kick-off) The Gills are just three points off the play-off places and have an imposing recent home run under the experienced Steve Evans -- seven wins and a draw in their last eight matches at Priestfield Stadium. Giving the hosts extra hope of an upset is that the Hammers have been beaten by lower league opposition in cup competitions both last season -- AFC Wimbledon humbling them 4-2 in the FA Cup -- and this term, losing 4-0 to Oxford United in the League Cup. However, the London side go into the tricky tie on the back of a 4-0 thrashing of fellow Premier League strugglers Bournemouth in David Moyes's first match of his second spell. Who comes out on top may depend on whether Moyes picks a first choice team or keeps them fresh for their next league game on Friday week away at Sheffield United. (AFP) APA APA

Title: Are Kartik Aaryan and Deepika Padukone uniting for a film? Their social media banter drops a major HINT
Content: Bollywood actors Deepika Padukone and Kartik Aaryan are making to the headlines every now and then. The two recently broke the internet as they danced together at the Mumbai airport. Deepika took the Kartik’s #DheemeDheeme challenge and both of them performed live for the fans.Since then they have become the talk of the town. Recently, they were also spotted together at a party and the pictures suggested that they had quite a good time there. Deepika, who is currently busy promoting her film ‘ Chhapaak ’, recently, also went on to say that she finds Kartik endearing. Since their airport stint, the duo often keeps on getting into funny social media banters too.Yesterday, the ‘ Pati Patni Aur Woh ’ actor shared a collage featuring Deepika from ‘ Om Shanti Om ’ and his throwback picture. His intent behind posting the story was to challenge the directors to cast them together for a film as he captioned it as, ‘Hai kisi director mein dum?’ Deepika was quick to repost his story and replied back saying, ‘Why these pictures though!?!? @kartikaaryan’Deepika and Kartik’s social media banter didn’t stop here. Kartik was quick enough to repost her story and replied, “Kyunki tabse qainaat iss koshish mein lagi hai”. The ‘ Piku ’ actress, a few minutes back, has replied back and it is just kickass. She has used a dialogue from her own film ‘Om Shanti Om’ as she replied, “@kartikaaryan agar aap kisi cheeze ko sacche dil se chaho…”Well, it looks like a film is definitely on the cards for this duo! Are you excited to watch Kartik and Deepika in a film together?

Title: Delhi: It’s a bird... it’s a plane... it’s cops’ eye in the sky
Content:
Representative image

NEW DELHI: In the Hollywood movie Inferno, Tom Hanks is seen being hotly pursued by the Italian Police who are using a drone to track him and Felicity Jones through the streets of Florence. If all goes well, Delhi Police can soon follow suit for chase sequences in real life.Delhi Police, TOI has learnt, is procuring unmanned aerial vehicles aka drones, which will be used in crime control and to manage law and order situations.Police commissioner Amulya Patnaik has given his nod for the initial procurement of two UAVs, which will be allotted to the mobile control room. There are plans to buy more drones for different units, sources said. These devices will be compliant with the norms specified by the Directorate General of Civil Aviation.The capital’s police force is the first in the country to procure these devices. Currently, Delhi Police hires drones on a need-to-use basis.Cops in many countries have turned to drones to help snare criminal gangs. In 2015, Scotland Yard started using a fleet of drones to track, chase and nab street criminals involved in drive-by snatches. In the United States, drones are used in several states by police and FBI for chase and surveillance. In 2014, Italian Police announced its plans of using drones to monitor major events and to respond to natural disasters and protests.In Delhi, the crime management can substantially improve with the induction of drones as this will not only help avoid fatal collisions during high-speed pursuits, but also keep a watch on crimeprone neighbourhoods. UAVs can also be of great help in monitoring crowds, given the large number of protests and demonstrations held in the city every year.Drones have, in fact, saved the day for Delhi Police on many occasions in the last five years. Police experimented with UAVs way back in 2014 during the Trilokpuri riots. “More than the violence on the ground, we were having a tough time containing stone-pelters hiding on rooftops. The police brass came up with a plan to use drones. Two devices equipped with high-quality cameras were brought in for use over the next few hours,” recalled an officer.As the UAVs took flight, the game changed. In no time, police had the upper hand as they ascertained the specific terraces where Molotov cocktails, stones and bricks were hidden. It also gave the cops precise location of rioters. Even in the recent protests against the Citizenship Amendment Act in areas like central Delhi, Jamia Nagar and Seelampur, police used drones to film rioters.Indian laws permit recreational use of toy drones, like helicopters with limited frequency, but police have banned the use of advanced drones by individuals in the wake of threats and alerts from terrorist organisations. There is also the fear of drones falling into wrong hands. “There are chances of its being hacked. A drone can also be spiked with explosives and used by terror outfits. We fear its misuse but if done with proper planning, drones can change the way we police Delhi,” an officer said.

Title: Tennis and cricket stars get behind Australia bushfire relief
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Sydney, Jan 3 (AFP) Tennis and cricket stars spearheaded by Nick Kyrgios and Chris Lynn on Friday pledged support for victims of bushfires raging around Australia, donating cash for every ace or six they hit. The blazes have claimed 18 lives and forced mass evacuations, with the country bracing for a weekend heat wave expected to fan the deadly infernos. Kyrgios, a controversial figure with a bad boy reputation, has been at the forefront of rallying support and pledged Aus$200 (US$140) for each ace he serves across the Australian summer of tennis, starting with the ATP Cup which began Friday. "I'm kicking off the support for those affected by the fires. I'll be donating $200 per ace that I hit across all the events I play this summer," tweeted the 24-year-old, who was handed a 16-week suspended ban in September after a series of outbursts. His Australian teammate at the inaugural ATP Cup Alex de Minaur went one better. "I like this, I will go $250 per ace, just because I don't think I'll be hitting as many aces as you mate," he replied, with Australian veteran Samantha Stosur also pledging $200 per ace. Kyrgios, who will also play the Kooyong Classic and the Australian Open this month, on Thursday issued a call for fundraisers for victims of the fires, which prompted Australia's tennis chief Craig Tiley to get on board. "We want to help these communities in a meaningful way and will announce a number of fund raising and support initiatives that will be rolled out across the ATP Cup, Australian Open and our other events over the coming weeks," said Tiley. The fires have been a big talking point ahead of the 24-team ATP Cup, which is being staged in Brisbane, Perth and Sydney with top names including Novak Djokovic and Rafael Nadal playing. - Extra motivation - ==================== Tournament director Tom Larner announced that each ace served at the 10-day event would deliver Aus$100 to bushfire relief. The initiative is forecast to raise around Aus$150,000, with more than 1,500 aces expected to be sent down over the duration of the January 3-12 tournament. "Most of the players are already keen to score aces and win a quick point, and having the chance to raise money for the bushfire appeal will give them that extra bit of motivation," he said. There are fears that smoke haze could impact the tournament in Sydney, with officials relying on on-site medical experts to monitor air quality, although there were no concerns on Friday. The third cricket Test in Sydney between Australia and New Zealand is also monitoring for smoke, with players wearing black armbands Friday as a mark of respect for those who have died. Two of the biggest hitters in the game, Lynn and Glenn Maxwell, announced they would donate $250 for every six they smash during the ongoing Big Bash League Twenty20 tournament. "Hey Guys, for every six I hit in this years Big Bash League I will donate $250 towards the Red Cross Bushfire Appeal," tweeted Lynn. "It is special to see so many athletes from various sports getting in behind the real heroes who are fighting to save lives and properties around our country." Maxwell, back in action after a short mental health sabbatical, replied: "Love it Lynny!! I'll match you on $250 per six I hit in this years BBL." D'Arcy Short, who was last week added to Australia's squad for their upcoming one-day tour of India, also jumped on board with the same commitment. (AFP) APA APA

Title: Ranji Trophy: Struggling Mumbai will hope to turn things around against dominant Karnataka
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Prithvi Shaw and Aditya Tare. (TOI Photo)

MUMBAI: Two of domestic cricket ’s powerhouses — Mumbai and Karnataka — clash at MCA’s Bandra Kurla Complex Ground in a key league match of the Ranji Trophy starting today.

And although the game will feature the likes of Ajinkya Rahane and Prithvi Shaw for the home side, and Karun Nair and Abhimanyu Mithun for the visitors, it’s hard not to take note of the players who will not be available for the fixture owing to India commitments.

While a full strength Mumbai side would definitely have included Rohit Sharma, Shreyas Iyer, Shivam Dube and Shardul Thakur, Karnataka would have been mightily boosted by the availability of Mayank Agarwal , KL Rahul and Manish Pandey.

Nevertheless, as experts would concur, their absence gives those waiting in the wings a golden opportunity to leave their imprint on the encounter and add to the lore of Mumbai-Karnataka clashes. Although both teams have featured in some of Ranji Trophy’s most famous games down the decades, their recent meetings have seen Karnataka dominate proceedings in some style.

They have beaten the 41-time champions outright thrice and claimed first innings honours on two occasions. On the other hand, Mumbai have had to largely lick their wounds and settled for a solitary first innings lead in the 2014-15 season.

9am start adds to challenge

Unlike their previous matches this season that started at 9.30am both teams will be out in the centre at 9am to ensure that sharp drop in visibility in the post tea session does not hamper proceedings. Given the current wintry conditions, requests were made by officials for an early start and both camps agreed.

While Mumbai beat Baroda away from home in their season opener and were humbled by Railways at the Wankhede Stadium last week, Karnataka beat Tamil Nadu and claimed first innings bragging rights against Uttar Pradesh in their first two games. They played Himachal Pradesh last week and ended up trailing on account of the first innings. These results mean both teams will be nudged to go for an outright win and climb up the combined Elite Group A and B tables and ensure they are in the mix for a quarterfinal spot.

Mumbai, especially, would like to make the most of the presence of skipper Suryakumar Yadav, Rahane and Shaw as after the game, the trio will be departing for New Zealand to fulfil their national commitments. They will also have to rejig their batting order after leaving out opener Jay Bista and in all likelihood, wicketkeeper Aditya Tare would be partnering the charismatic Shaw at the top of the order.

Kadam set for Ranji debut

On the other hand, Karnataka are yet to come to terms with the absence of off-spinner Krishnappa Gowtham, who took a match haul of 14 wickets against Tamil Nadu, but sadly ended up aggravating his right-foot toe injury during the match. The game at BKC could see middle-order batsman Rohan Kadam make his Ranji Trophy debut. The 25-year-old played a key role in Karnataka’s win in the Syed Mushtaq Ali T20 Trophy and the Vijay Hazare Trophy earlier this season.

Title: Students on AU VC's resignation: It's a moral victory
Content: ALLAHABAD: A day after Allahabad University (AU) vice-chacnellor RL Hangloo resigned amid a controversy over girls' hostel security, the varsity's students called the development a 'moral victory for them' on Thursday. As the news spread, students were seen distributing sweets and dancing to the tunes of dhol on campus.One could even spot some students playing with colours.Hangloo, who had been in the eye of storm over a series of controversies since the past three years, was summoned by National Commission for Women (NCW) earlier in December over allegations of improper handling of sexual harassment complaints and lack of a grievance cell for redress al of such charges. In December first week, a five-member team of NCW members had also visited the Women's Hostel to probe allegations of security lapses.AU Students' Union's former president Richa Singh said, "It's a moral victory for AU students. Apart from Hangloo's resignation, we had been demanding that a detailed investigation be carried out into financial irregularities and sexual harassment complaints reported during his tenure."Singh and his supporters had been protesting for 20 days outside the gate of AU's Women's Hostel against the alleged lapses in inmates' security, until she was arrested on Sunday for defying prohibitory orders as section 144 was imposed across the state.The Samajwadi Party (SP) leader also claimed that inmates of Women's Hostel had been protesting against VC since the past two weeks and had even not celebrated the New Year on Wednesday. The inmates wore black on New Year's Day as a mark of protest."Hangloo was forced to resign as he had been accused of seeking sexual favours from a woman in exchange for a job and protecting those accused of sexual harassment in the university," she added.Singh was referring to the leaked recordings of calls between Hangloo and a Delhi-based woman in 2018, wherein the former promised her a job using his influences."AU students are relieved with the VC's resignation as they had been fighting for a safe campus for long. The resignation would set an example for others. In the past four years, the former VC had not only forced authorities to lodge FIRs against several students, but also expelled more than 100 students."She also alleged that Hangloo had tried to get her Ph.D registration cancelled and also threatened her of dire consequences through his supporters men several times. "I was threatened not to raise my voice against the VC, who was also accused of financial irregularities and nepotism in recruitment of faculty members," said the former AUSU president.Student leader RS Yadav said, "Students from different outfits like Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad, Yuvjan Sabha and National Students' Union of India fought together for the rights of students by joining their hands under the Sanyukt Sangrash Samiti. It was the first time in the history of AU when students with different ideologies came together on a common platform demanding the VC's resignation."Jitesh Mishra, who is an NSUI member, said, "Students were happy to know about the VC's resignation. The authorities had suppressed the voice of students for long during the tenure of Prof Hangloo."Sanyukt Sangharsh Samiti, an umbrella outfit with different student wings as its members, demanded that AU authorities fulfil their eight demands which included construction of a students' union hall, disposal of grievances related to sexual harassment complaints, regularisation of seminars and sports and withdrawal of FIRs against students.The student leaders claimed that the former VC often tried to suppress the voice of students, especially after the students council replaced the students' union.A senior AU official said, "There was tremendous pressure on AU and some outsiders were trying to influence internal decisions. The academic atmosphere of the varsity was crippled. The teaching and non-teaching staff were surprised over the development and would urge the ministry of human resources development to reappoint him."

Title: Class X student tries to kill self after sex abuse bid by dad’s pal
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

Title: Kerala’s tableau for Republic Day parade rejected
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

The state could not satisfy the screening committee with its proposal ‘on art and architecture of Kerala’

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: The Centre has rejected state’s application for parading its tableau in Republic Day parade for second consecutive year.

The state’s proposed theme for the tableau was “art and architecture of the state”. In the tractor portion in the front, the display is state’s traditional festival, the state’s official animal, the elephant, and on both sides, boats carrying spices and other paraphernalia of Ayurveda are part of the tableau.

On the trailer portion of the tableau is Koothambalam — model of state’s architecture — along with performing arts of the state, including Mohiniyattam, Kalaripayattu and Theyyam in the background of Chenda, the traditional drum. The side portions carry Kathakali, Padayani, Koodiyattam and Ottan Thullal on boats floating in backwater.

Top government sources said the state tried its best to be selected this year after losing it last year, but could not satisfy the screening committee constituted for the purpose by the ministry of defence. “We went till the third stage of the screening and thereafter, we weren’t called for the fourth stage. We tried to rectify all the shortcomings pointed out by the committee, but lost out. This is the second time in a row that we have not been selected,” a top official said.

As per the guidelines for the preparation of tableau for 2020, any important event from the history of the state, festivals celebrated, architecture of the state, any important social and development scheme or achievement, environment or any vision for future can be represented. The proposals are scrutinised by the committee, and necessary changes and shortcomings are suggested. Once the sketches are approved, a three-dimensional model has to be submitted before the committee.

Last year, the state had selected and proposed ‘Vaikom Satyagraha’ as the theme for tableau. Vaikom Satyagraha was a historic social protest held in the state at the Siva temple at Vaikom in Kottayam against untouchability in Hindu society in 1924-25.

Title: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan is 'modern Jinnah': BJP leader Krishnadas
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Kerala chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan (File Photo)

ALAPPUZHA: BJP national executive committee member P K Krishnadas called Kerala chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan 'Modern Jinnah' for moving a resolution in the state assembly demanding the scrapping of Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA).

Speaking to reporters here on Thursday, he said passing of resolution in the assembly was part of a move by the state government to make Kerala a separate country.

"The resolution presented by the CM in the assembly is equal to that of the resolution presented by Muhammad Ali Jinnah for partition. The chief minister should gain legal literacy. On what basis he is saying that the act passed by the Parliament would not be enforced in Kerala. If Pinarayi Vijayan is sticking to his stand, he should ask chief secretary to issue the statements in this regard. Opposition leader Ramesh Chennithala is dancing to the tune of Pinarayi Vijayan. So, the state ministry should be reorganised by giving deputy CM post to Ramesh Chennithala. O Rajagopal, who spoke against the resolution in the assembly, should be deployed as the opposition leader," he said.

Krishnadas alleged that Pinarayi had a role behind all the protest against governor. "At present, a person in a constitutional post is not able to enter the state. Those who acted against UAPA later executed it. The same thing will happen in the execution of CAA. The present activities of the government are a gimmick for diverting the attention of the people," he said.
