Title: After Kerala, Maha Vikas Aghad leaders mull a House resolution against CAA
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

MUMBAI: Following the Kerala legislative assembly’s resolution against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), leaders of the ruling Maha Vikas Aghadi in Maharashtra will meet soon to decide if such a resolution could be passed in the next session of the state assembly.

Cabinet member and NCP spokesperson Nawab Malik said that since the state government comprises three parties, the proposal would have to be discussed at a joint meeting of senior leaders of the Congress, NCP and Shiv Sena. “Any proposal would have to be discussed in the meeting so that consensus is secured,” Malik told TOI.

Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said heads of all three political parties have already opposed the CAA. “The NCP, Congress and Shiv Sena have opposed the proposal on the floor of the House. Any further decision will be taken by the leadership of the parties,” Pawar said.

The Congress and NCP had opposed the CAA as “unconstitutional” in the Lok Sabha, while the Shiv Sena had voted in favour of it in the Lower House. The Shiv Sena staged a walkout when the proposal was moved in the Rajya Sabha later.

Ex-minister has sought spl session

Former minister Naseem Khan of the Congress had last week written to state Congress president and cabinet minister Balasaheb Thorat, saying that a special session of the state legislature should be convened for passing a resolution against the Citizenship Amendment Act. On the Congress’s foundation day on December 28, Thorat had declared that the new legislation would not be implemented in Maharashtra. Thorat and many other Congess leaders had that day carried out a rally from August Kranti Maidan to Girgaum Chowpatty to protest agains the legislation and to oppose its implementaion on the grounds that the Act was unfair.

The Sena had earlier said the Centre had failed to clarify certain points about the legislators such as how many refugees would be accommodated and where.

Title: Rajasthan govt ponders wage slips for NREGA workers
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: The MGNREGA workers in Rajasthan may start getting wage/pay slips for working under the scheme. In a bid to empower the labourers, the state's MGNREGA department is mulling over introducing wage slips which will be issued to them as a proof of employment.

If Rajasthan introduces wage slips for MGNREGA workers, it will be the first state in the country to do it. "The person, who is working under the scheme, must know how much wage he/she has earned. We can make that provision for the MGNREGA workers. But, it requires planning and an action plan has to be worked out for this to become a reality. This is a new idea that we wish to execute," said state's MGNREGA commissioner P C Kishan .

"With this inititative, the labourers will be empowered. Apart from this, we also have to ensure that 50 per cent of the mates working at the sites are women. Currently, their percentage is just 30%. Wherever self-help groups (SHGs) are strong, those areas should have 100% female mates," he added.

Calling it a positive move, social activist Nikhil Dey said, "The central government's order on this (wage slips) already exists. The state government should be doing this and it must be done. It will help in transparency and cutting down corruption. So, it is an important step."

Title: Doing well for state my only target: Karun Nair
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Karun Nair. (Getty Images)

MUMBAI: It’s a pointer to the batting riches that India possesses today that even a batsman of Karun Nair’s calibre can’t make his way to the national side. Nair made his First Class debut in the 2013-14 season and caught the eye straight away, hitting three centuries in the Ranji Trophy as Karnataka won the title.

The following season, Nair hit a triple century in the Ranji final against Tamil Nadu, batting at No. 6 and earning an India call up was just a matter of time. He did not disappoint when the chance came his way in 2016, hitting a triple century (303*) in the final Test of the India-England series in Chennai, having made his Test debut earlier in Mohali.

But things did not pan out the way it should have after such a promising start with Nair playing the last of his six Tests way back in March 2017 against Australia. While he remained in the squad of 16 whenever India toured abroad, he missed the playing XI. Sadly, for him, when there were injuries to other players, the team management mysteriously summoned others who were not even in the squad. Hanuma Vihari travelled to England from India after India lost at Lord’s and the team management sent Dinesh Karthik and Murali Vijay back home.

Nevertheless, the 28-year-old continues to hold sway at the domestic level and is a key cog in Karnataka’s wheel.

He will be leading his side against Mumbai in a key Ranji Trophy game starting today at the MCA’s BKC ground and all that he’s focused on at the moment is a good showing for Karnataka.

“For me, it is about playing each game at a time and trying to contribute as much as I can to Karnataka and trying to win games for the team. I am looking forward to contributing more with the bat and as captain, so that we can go on and win games,” Nair said on Thursday, post his team’s net session.

So does he have any other target in mind at the moment, considering that batsmen are generally at their peak in their late 20s? “Not really, because it is important for me to first concentrate on what’s happening over here and whatever has to happen, I have no control over it. So my only focus is to doing well here and contributing for Karnataka,” he said.

Title: Mumbai: 21 years after they brought home baby, guardians get adoptive parents status
Content:
Representative image

MUMBAI: She was nine months old when a Mumbai couple first became her guardians through an order of the Bombay high court. Twenty-one years later, through another HC order, she can finally legally call them her adoptive parents.Last month, Justice G S Kulkarni held that the woman, under legal guardianship since 1998, has a basic human right to a legal identity and can be adopted, despite her current adult status, by her now 66-year-old ailing guardian, Mathew Abreo.Abreo and his wife had first petitioned HC in 1998 to take her home as her guardians under the Guardians and Wards Act. Last year, Abreo, who lost his wife a year earlier, petitioned HC againthis time to legally adopt her.“Mere guardianship being conferred...would certainly not suffice and it has lost its efficacy” as the girl is now a major, said Justice Kulkarni. He held she now definitely requires to be “conferred a legal status of being a daughter of the petitioner”.In 1999, in a landmark judgment, HC had laid down that “right to life” as provided under Article 21of the Indian Constitution of “orphaned, abandoned, destitute or similarly situated child includes the right to be adopted by willing parent/parents and to have a home, a name and a nationality”.The judgment had paved way for adoption among non-Hindu communities which under personal laws were at the time allowed only to be guardians—a tag that did not confer all legal rights of a parent-child relationship on them. There was a legal vacuum for non-Hindus to adopt.Adoption confers the same status and rights as a natural-born child. “The right to be adopted is an enforceable civil right,” the bench of Justice F I Rebello had held in his October 1999 judgment. Last month, Justice Kulkarni relied on Justice Rebello’s ruling and the principles and guidelines he laid down and permitted the foster father’s plea to enforce his right to adopt.The HC had earlier held in the absence of any law setting out who could adopt from among the Christian community, persons who took a child in guardianship under the Guardians and Wards Act also have a right to petition the courts to adopt the child. Such petition could be filed two years later, HC had ruled. In this case, it was 21 years later, but never too late.Abreo’s counsel Rakesh Kapoor informed HC the girl continued to live with the family even after turning 18. The judge, too, interviewed her and found she was financially independent and in fact taking care of her father.The scrutiny officer of Indian Council of Social Welfare (ICSW) said she was “well integrated” into the adoptive family. The HC thus directed that an application could be filed with civic authorities for issue of a birth certificate showing him and his late wife as father and mother.

Title: Gang who broke into four Jaipur apartments busted
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: The police busted an interstate gang of four persons who were behind breaking into vacant houses as well as offices in states like Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh , Gujarat and few others. Since August to December last year, the gang had broken into at least four apartments in Jaipur and made off with lakhs of valuables.

The arrested were identified as Anand Sharma (24), Satyaprakash Jatav (24), Vinod Prajapati (34) and Pushpendra Bhadauria (29). All of them are natives of Madhya Pradesh.

DCP Jaipur West Kavendra Singh Sagar said, “A case was registered in August last year when a unidentified accused broke into a vacant house in Bani Park and took off with Rs 50,000 in cash and one pistol. Following this a team was constituted to look into all such similar robberies.”

Cops started looking at the CCTV footage in Bani Park and found few suspicious people roaming around in the area who appeared to be doing a recce. Based on information from a source, cops traced the accused who confessed to the Bani Park robbery and also admitted to several others during the last few months of 2019.

The gang operated in Gwalior, Ahmedabad and Jaipur. In Jaipur the committed similar robberies in C-Scheme, Ajmer road, Ashok Nagar and others. Cops recovered Rs 47,000 and a firearm from the arrested gang. After getting arrested in Ahmedabad and Gwalior, the gang chose Jaipur as their next target. The members would travel from Gwalior to Jaipur during the day and would conduct a recce looking for vacant houses and offices. They would break into the decided places late at night or wee hours of morning. While two members would break in, the remaining would keep watch outside. According to police records, the gang has been active since 2017 though started operating in Jaipur last year.

Title: Delhi: Forensic software to help ID suspects even from low-resolution videos
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

NEW DELHI: Realising the potential of CCTV footage and mobile videos in identification of suspects, Delhi Police is procuring an advanced video forensic technology that will help retrieve, enhance quality and analyse clips of crime spots and riots.

CCTV cameras have been of a great help to police. In the recent violence during the anti-CAA protests, every suspect was identified through CCTV footage or mobile videos.

Today, over half the crimes in the city are either being solved with the help of CCTVs or the footage turns into a crucial piece of evidence. Often, the images are blurred or of bad quality, which makes the probe hit a temporary dead end. Currently, police have been taking the help of private labs and individuals to enhance the quality of the images.

Police said the software would support recovery of digital videos from the original evidence or a forensics clone. It would have the capacity to bypass system-level passwords and provide the examiner direct access to the recorded data. The software would also help identify and handle drive-level encryption on supported file systems and also recover formatted, deleted and partially overwritten videos.

The software will also help police in filing chargesheets as case notes linked to forensic video evidence can be inserted in it.

“The technology will help us process digital or analog video evidence and enhance dark and poor quality security and surveillance videos. It will have the facility to print stills from video so that hard copies can be circulated for identification of suspects. The programme can also sharpen the clips and adjust the brightness and contrast in images,” said an officer.

A de-blurring facility, with features like focus de-blur and motion de-blur, will help police identify fast-moving vehicles in the clips. The programme will be equipped with a field kit with tools to capture audio and videos directly from a DVR without having direct access to the hard drive.

Title: CBSE schools struggle to conduct revision classes
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

At the receiving end?

KOCHI: CBSE schools in the city are struggling to conduct revision classes and model exams for Class X and XII students with not enough working days due to the preponed board exams, which are scheduled to begin on February 15, instead of March first week, like previous years.

Moreover, the preponed practical board exams, which should be conducted between January 1 and February 7, add to the woes as it cuts off around 15 working days, which could otherwise have been used for revision classes.

As the school authorities have no other option but conduct the revision sessions and model exams back to back within a tight time schedule, teachers said that the students are finding it difficult and the pressure might affect their confidence.

The school authorities said that the vacation classes in April and May need to be allowed next academic year onwards as it will give enough time to complete the portions, revision classes and model exams smoothly.

"Most of the schools have somehow managed to complete the portions before the Christmas vacation began by taking extra hours in the morning and evening most of the days. Also, most schools have started working on Saturdays. But, the difficulty is in conducting revision classes and model exams, which are highly beneficial for the students, unhurriedly. The loss of around 15 days due to the preponement of the board exam by the CBSE is a challenge as it will make us reduce the gap between the model exams. Though many schools have started the model exams, students do not get enough time to prepare for each exam," said K A Francis, secretary of Confederation of Sahodaya Complexes and the principal of Naipunya Public School, Thrikkakara.

Unlike previous years, the CBSE has made it mandatory for the schools to have observers for conducting board practical exams. "The availability and convenience of the observers, mostly principals or senior PG teachers from other schools, is another concern for schools to schedule the practical exam dates. For each class, it needs at least 3 days for completing each practical exam and the observer has to be present on each day. So making the timetable according to convenient dates is more challenging now," said Juby Paul, principal, ToC H Public School.

Earlier, the Kerala CBSE Schools Management Association (KCSMA), had requested CBSE to grant permission to start the new academic year in April just like Kendriya Vidyalaya . The memorandum further said that if holidays are given in April and May for students, all CBSE schools - which will be examination and evaluation centres for public exams by the end of that academic year- may find it difficult to schedule exams and conduct classes in February/March due to space constraints and lack of staff. But a decision on this is yet to be taken.

Title: Sanjay Raut to speak at Jamaat’s anti-CAA, NRC function in Mumbai
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Sanjay Raut

MUMBAI: Days after Shiv Sena inducted Sillod MLA Abdul Sattar as junior minister, senior party leader and Saamna editor Sanjay Raut said on Thursday he will attend a Jamaat-e-Islami Hind (JIH) function to oppose the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) and the National Register of Citizens (NRC) in the city on Saturday.

The meet, being organised by JIH, Mumbai, and Association for Protection of Civil Rights (APCR) at Marathi Patrakar Sangh, will see Raut, Justice (retd) B G Kolse Patil, senior counsel Mihir Desai and APCR president and senior advocate Yusuf Muchchala debate the relationship between CAA and NRC “to understand their constitutional implications,” said a JIH representative. Though Sena had backed CAA in Lok Sabha, it abstained from Rajya Sabha during voting. Subsequently, chief minister Uddhav Thackeray said the state would wait for Supreme Court verdict on CAA before deciding whether to oppose or support NRC.

Meanwhile, a group of community leaders has panned Congress for denying Mumbadevi MLA Amin Patel a ministerial post. “He is not just popular in his constituency (Mumbadevi), he is always available to help people. As a minister, he would have been a big asset for Congress,” said Sunni spiritual leader Maulana Moin Ashraf Quadri.

Title: 5,000 schools in Rajasthan to be linked via satellite tech
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: The state's science and technology department has identified 5,000 schools in the tribal areas and aspirational districts of Rajasthan , in which the students will be taught English and Science subjects through satellite communication (Satcom) technology, to be operated from a centralised location in Jaipur.

Even the Haj pilgrims in the districts will be trained through this technology, and hence, they don't have to come Jaipur for the training. Those schools have been identified where there are no teachers or there is shortage of teachers.

"We have identified schools in the tribal areas where there are no science teachers. So, we have decided to teach english and science subjects, under the state board syllabus, to the students fom 6th to 12th standard. The students will get the services of subject experts and will be taught through Receive only Terminal (RoT) and Satellite Interactive Terminal (SIT)," said Mugdha Sinha, secretary, department of science and technology (DST).

"It is a two-way facility through which the students can ask questions to the teachers," she added.

Title: 'Chhapaak': Deepika Padukone shares a heart-wrenching still from the title track
Content:
'Chhapaak': Deepika Padukone shares a heart-wrenching still from the title track

Deepika Padukone is gearing up for the release of her next flick 'Chhapaak'. Directed by Meghna Gulzar, the film also stars Vikrant Massey in pivotal roles. The diva is currently on a promotional spree and she is leaving no stones unturned. Recently, she took to her social media handle to drop a new still from the film and it is something you shouldn't miss!The 'Bajirao Mastani' actress shared the still and along with that, she announced the release date of the 'Chhapaak' title track. The post was captioned as, ''n a moment. In a splash. A life changes forever... #Chhapaak Title track out today! @meghnagulzar @atika.chohan @vikrantmassey87 @shankarehsaanloy #Gulzar @arijitsingh @_kaproductions @mrigafilms @foxstarhindi @zeemusiccompany''. It was back in 2005 when Laxmi, then just 16, was attacked by a 32-year-old man who threw acid on her because she had turned down his proposal. She didn't let the incident pull her down.Laxmi went on to work as director of a non-profit Chhanv Foundation and also associated with campaign Stop Acid Attacks.Deepika was left so impressed by Laxmi's story, among other things, that she decided to be attached to the film as a producer too.The film is scheduled to release on 10th January 2020. It will clash with Ajay Devgn, Kajol and Saif Ali Khan's 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' at the box office. Picture Courtesy: Deepika Padukone Instagram

Title: Manoj Tiwari: Modi govt to give pucca houses in slums
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari

NEW DELHI: Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari on Thursday said that the Modi government would provide pucca houses to the residents of slums across the capital.

Addressing a public meeting in east Delhi’s Mandawali area, Tiwari said that the registration of details under the scheme ‘Jahan Jhuggi, Wahan Makaan’ had already started on Delhi Development Authority’s portal.

“I come from a poor family and I know the pain of not having a pucca house. I have also spent 23 nights in Delhi’s slums and understand the sufferings of people. I can say this with confidence that the Modi government is working to alleviate this suffering,” Tiwari said.

To propagate the scheme, the Delhi BJP has also started putting up large hoardings of Prime Minister Narendra Modi in JJ clusters.

The move comes days after chief minister Arvind Kejriwal started distributing certificates to slum dwellers promising them pucca houses in place of their jhuggis. Delhi government has distributed about 65,000 such certificates.

The BJP hoardings ask people to register for the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojna (Urban) for owning two room-set houses, which will have water, electricity and sewer connections. Party functionaries said that help centres would be opened in slums for assisting people in registrations. “We have targeted to put up large hoardings of the PMAY in 700 JJ clusters, where around 20 lakh people live,” Delhi BJP JJ cluster cell president Umesh Verma said.

Party sources said that about 1,000 hoardings have already been installed in different parts of the city, including Wazirpur, Tughalaqabad, Kalkaji, Jangpura and RK Puram. The BJP has also put up new hoardings in unauthorised colonies which promise ownership rights to the residents of these areas.

The Delhi Development Authority, meanwhile, approved a proposal to undertake in-situ redevelopment and rehabilitation of JJ clusters on a public-private partnership mode, officials said on Thursday. The decision was taken during a meeting of the urban body at Raj Niwas, PTI reported.

Title: Ajmer police claim to have cracked 13 murder cases in 2019
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

AJMER: The district police on Thursday claimed that they have opened, investigated and solved 13 blind murder cases, lodged 23 cases against illegal liquor and seven cases against drug smuggling in the last year. There were also many cases in which the accused were arrested for burglary, theft and fraud.

Briefing the media about action taken by the police, SP Ajmer Kunwar Rashtradeep said that there were five cases of loot, 10 cases of vehicle theft and similarly several cases investigated and opened by the district police. The important blind murder case was of Christian Ganj region in which a dead body was found on hills, which could not be identified. After investigation, police arrested two accused and prosecuted them.

Many cases of loot were registered, in which the accused looted chains, bags and even money from the roads and the police arrested the accused in all the cases, after investigating CCTV footage of different places. There were also six cases of burglary registered, in which the accused broke into the houses and took away money, jewellery and all these cases were solved by police after investigation and arrests were made.

There was a sensitive case of statue theft from a Jain temple in Dargah Bazaar, wherein the feelings of the community were hurt.

The police, however, within 23 hours arrested the accused and recovered the statue, which costs about Rs 8 lakh. There were 10 cases of vehicle theft registered in different police stations and police arrested the accused and recovered hundreds of vehicles that were stolen from different places.

Police also recovered illegal weapons and broke the network of drug smuggling. Rashtradeep himself sat for long hours to entertain any complaints from the victims and directed the respective police stations to provide relief to them.

Title: Election results Tamil Nadu: National parties fail to impress in Tamil Nadu civic polls
Content:
Counting in process at election centres in Madurai

If local body elections are a test of grass root presence for political parties, then the national parties have clearly failed. The Tamil Nadu civic poll results coming out have shown that it’s the two principal Dravidian parties that call the shots among the rural masses.Congress and BJP have been relegated to insignificant positions, which are disproportionate to the vote share they enjoyed in the Lok sabha and assembly polls in the past. Parties like Vanniyar driven Pattali Makkal Katchi or the dalit Viduthalai Chiruthaigal Katchi and the Tamil nationalist Naam Thamizhar Katchi (NTK) have also not fared well.While Kamal Haasan’s Makkal Needhi Maiam chose to stay away from the polls, the only other party that appeared to have gained from the polls was TTV Dhinakaran’s Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam.``The most striking element of the results was that the polls were reduced to a DMK vs AIADMK affair,’’ said political commentator Ramu Manivannan. Ever since the demise of J Jayalalithaa, the BJP was making concerted efforts to make inroads into this Dravidian heartland. The party retained its alliance with AIADMK to face the civic polls and hard bargained for adequate seats. Simultaneously, BJP leaders were spiritedly countering the opposition campaign of the party being anti – Tamil. Prime minister’s Narendra Modi’s veshti attire during the Mamallapuram visit and his endorsement of Tamil’s antiquity did create ripples. But the Citizenship Amendment Act appears to have played the spoilsport. Poll watchers say that there was a palpable Muslim vote consolidation against the AIADMK – BJP alliance. If BJP’s fortunes were less than promising, the saffron party’s national policies appeared to have cost its ally AIADMK’s winning chances too. For the Congress, which is considered to have a rural connect in pockets like Sivaganga, Kanyakumari and Thanjavur, the factor has not paid off much. Still, Congress fared much better than its national rival BJP.Though PMK could find solace from the fact the polls were not held in much of the districts in northern Tamil Nadu where it has a strong presence, even in places like Dharmapuri the results were disappoointing for the cadres.On the other hand, the AMMK, battered and bruised in the recent Lok Sabha polls had reasons to cheer with the party cadres winning in some places and maintaining a lead in few more.

Title: Mumbai: Man in lawyer’s gown hurls flute at magistrate
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

MUMBAI: Kurar police arrested a 60-year-old man who allegedly hurled a flute in the direction of magistrate SU Baghele at the city civil and sessions court in Dindoshi on Thursday. The flute hit the judge’s steno-typist who suffered a minor injury.

The incident occurred around 11am when the accused, Omkarnath Pandey, walked into the court room wearing an advocate’s gown and flung the object.

“Pandey is employed as a security guard and walked into the court premises wearing an advocate’s uniform and hurled the flute claiming it is Krishna Jayanti,” said a police officer. Kurar police senior inspector Balasaheb Salunkhe said Pandey has been arrested.

To avoid such incidents from recurring on the court premises in future, additional principal judge M S Sharma has made it mandatory for all advocates and their baggage to undergo a security check at the entrance of Dindoshi court with immediate effect.

Title: Mark Boucher hungry to pass on his knowledge to youngsters: Dean Elgar
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Mark Boucher. (Getty Images)

MUMBAI: Before it ended, 2019 provided a silver lining in the cloud of international cricket . South Africa, who were thrashed badly by India just a few months earlier, picked themselves up and against most expectations, outplayed England by 107 runs in the first Test at Centurion.

In a year which saw South Africa crash out at the league stage in the World Cup in the summer, this victory provides plenty of hope to their fans as the hosts take on England in the second Test, which begins at Cape Town from Friday. “It was an important win for us. We haven’t really had the greatest ‘Test year.’ There were a few tough games that we played in the build-up to this series, so that was a good ‘character build-up’ for the boys. Obviously, the hangover is still there. Hopefully, we can build on it,” South Africa’s opening batsman Dean Elgar told TOI in an exclusive interview from Cape Town.

It enabled the Proteas to log their first points on board in the World Test championship. “We are actually so far behind from the leaders at the moment, that we shouldn’t be worried about that. We should ultimately start focusing a little bit more on our team dynamics and what it means to still play for the side and hopefully, the wins will look after themselves. We would try to look after cricket, so that cricket can ultimately look after us!” he says with a chuckle.

Surely, some credit for this turnaround in a such a short time, must go to the new, star-studded support staff in the Proteas set-up — Graeme Smith is now the director of cricket, Mark Boucher is the coach and Jacques Kallis is the batting consultant. “They’ve obviously arrived in the group with a lot of credibility and respect. I’m going to remember it forever that I sat with these cricket legends. They come in the change room and provide the environment with a lot of confidence,” he says, before explaining how he had already benefited from Boucher’s coaching skills at the Titans.

“I have been fortunate with Boucher, as he taught us at the Titans for threefour years. I know what he is about. He is one of the best cricketers to have ever played the game. He also brings a lot to the table with his experience. He has played international cricket for 13-15 years and with that comes a lot of knowledge, and it seems as if he is really hungry to pass on that knowledge down to the younger players. He wants everyone to do well, which is awesome for us as young cricketers. It’s awesome to have these guys around. They provide a bit more clarity and make the environment a little bit more peaceful,” he explains.

A huge setback for the Proteas has been their top players migrating to England after being lured by Kolpak contracts. “I’m a realist when it comes to these topics (financial well-being). I have grown up with the Kolpak players, and have played against them in county cricket. England are in a stronger position with Kolpak players there. I am not going to deny the fact that there are some serious cricketers there and that’s the reason why other countries would want to come and breach our system,” he says.

With the ICC deciding to make four-day Tests mandatory from 2023, there is a huge debate around whether time’s up for five-day Tests. Elgar, himself South Africa’s ‘Test specialist,’ bats for the traditional format to continue. “When it comes to Test cricket, I’m a purist. We don’t play a lot of Tests that go into the fifth day anymore. I would like to think that cricketers out there still want to play the five-day version, because I would like to see a five-day Test. It’s an assimilation of what cricket is,” he opines.

Title: Maradu residents meet Kerala minister, end strike
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

A view of the partially demolished Jain Coral Cove apartment complex on Thursday

KOCHI: The action council of residents living nearby Alfa Serene apartment in Maradu who began an indefinite hunger strike demanding protection of their homes, ended the strike on Thursday night. The council ended the strike after local self-government minister A C Moideen promised that the technical committee will take a decision on their demands at a meeting on Friday.

The council members made it clear that they want the demolition schedule to be changed at a meeting with the minister.

As of now, Alfa Serene and Holy Faith H2O are to be demolished on January 11 and Jain Coral Cove and Golden Kayaloram on January 12. While Alfa Serene and Holy Faith H2O are in thickly populated localities, the other two are in a relatively sparsely populated area.

"The minister promised us that our concerns would be addressed. He also said the insurance company will give the money to reconstruct the houses, if they are damaged beyond repair. It will be based on the market value," said T H Nadeera, Maradu municipality chairperson.

Residents living near Alfa Serene alleged a conspiracy in the authorities' decision to go ahead with the plan to raze the two structures, situated in thickly populated area, in the first phase.

"If the nine houses close to Alfa Serene suffer damages, it will be a huge disaster. It will dissuade the Supreme Court stop the demolition. The court will be forced to impose only a fine on the builders instead of ordering complete demolition. If they demolish Jain Coral Cove and Golden Kayaloram on the first day, it will help them to rectify mistakes, if any," said Rajeevan Nair, who lives behind Alfa Serene's second tower.

Rajeevan and his neighbour have booked a rented house fearing their houses will be completely damaged during the demolition. Some other residents have shifted to other places after cracks developed on the walls of their houses and due to dust pollution.

The council ended the strike after local self-government minister A C Moideen promised that the technical committee will take a decision on their demands at a meeting on Friday.

The council members made it clear that they want the demolition schedule to be changed at a meeting with the minister.

As of now, Alfa Serene and Holy Faith H2O are to be demolished on January 11 and Jain Coral Cove and Golden Kayaloram on January 12. While Alfa Serene and Holy Faith H2O are in thickly populated localities, the other two are in a relatively sparsely populated area.

"The minister promised us that our concerns would be addressed. He also said the insurance company will give the money to reconstruct the houses, if they are damaged beyond repair. It will be based on the market value," said T H Nadeera, Maradu municipality chairperson.

Residents living near Alfa Serene alleged a conspiracy in the authorities' decision to go ahead with the plan to raze the two structures, situated in thickly populated area, in the first phase.

"If the nine houses close to Alfa Serene suffer damages, it will be a huge disaster. It will dissuade the Supreme Court stop the demolition. The court will be forced to impose only a fine on the builders instead of ordering complete demolition. If they demolish Jain Coral Cove and Golden Kayaloram on the first day, it will help them to rectify mistakes, if any," said Rajeevan Nair, who lives behind Alfa Serene's second tower.

Rajeevan and his neighbour have booked a rented house fearing their houses will be completely damaged during the demolition. Some other residents have shifted to other places after cracks developed on the walls of their houses and due to dust pollution.

Title: Maradu residents meet Kerala minister, end strike
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

A view of the partially demolished Jain Coral Cove apartment complex on Thursday

KOCHI: The action council of residents living nearby Alfa Serene apartment in Maradu who began an indefinite hunger strike demanding protection of their homes, ended the strike on Thursday night. The council ended the strike after local self-government minister A C Moideen promised that the technical committee will take a decision on their demands at a meeting on Friday.

The council members made it clear that they want the demolition schedule to be changed at a meeting with the minister.

As of now, Alfa Serene and Holy Faith H2O are to be demolished on January 11 and Jain Coral Cove and Golden Kayaloram on January 12. While Alfa Serene and Holy Faith H2O are in thickly populated localities, the other two are in a relatively sparsely populated area.

"The minister promised us that our concerns would be addressed. He also said the insurance company will give the money to reconstruct the houses, if they are damaged beyond repair. It will be based on the market value," said T H Nadeera, Maradu municipality chairperson.

Residents living near Alfa Serene alleged a conspiracy in the authorities' decision to go ahead with the plan to raze the two structures, situated in thickly populated area, in the first phase.

"If the nine houses close to Alfa Serene suffer damages, it will be a huge disaster. It will dissuade the Supreme Court stop the demolition. The court will be forced to impose only a fine on the builders instead of ordering complete demolition. If they demolish Jain Coral Cove and Golden Kayaloram on the first day, it will help them to rectify mistakes, if any," said Rajeevan Nair, who lives behind Alfa Serene's second tower.

Title: ‘Guruji’ arrested in cash shower con
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

MUMBAI: A self-styled spiritual guru has been arrested in a cheating case where several people were promised a “shower of money” by a gang if they invested in some puja and black magic rituals.

Ashok Lakhan Gupta alias Guruji (45) is believed to have played a key role in misleading several innocent people in the scam. The cops had on Monday arrested Nishwitkumar Shetty (36) after a businessman lodged a complaint that a gang had duped him of Rs 1.12 crore.

Title: Ashok Gehlot to inaugurate trade fair in Jodhpur today
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Ashok Gehlot

JODHPUR: Biggest annual trade fair of western Rajasthan, the Pashchimi Rajasthan Udhyog Hastshilp Utsav-2020 will be inaugurated on Friday here by the chief minister Ashok Gehlot . The 29th edition of the fair will be based on the theme of “Charkha to IT Revolution”.

To be held under the joint aegis of District Industrial Center, Entrepreneurship Development Institute, Jaipur and the Marudhara Industrial Association, the fair will have live demonstration of their art by 70 artisans from different states like Delhi, UP, Uttarakhand , MP, J & K, Haryana, HP, Gujrat, Panjab and West Bengal etc. besides Rajasthan.

According to the convener of the event, Sunil Parihar, the fair will have over 600 stalls under 20 domes and150 tents with 30 separate stalls dedicated to the works and philosophies of Mahatma Gandhi .

He said that two panoramas one each for Rajiv Gandhi and Mahatma Gandhi will be the main attraction of the fair this year. The fair will have a series of conferences and workshops dedicated, to agriculture, solar energy, entrepreneurship, agriculture, mining, pollution and environment etc. inorder to disseminated information to the people and address the shortcomings.

Title: Hardik Pandya’s brother Krunal Pandya welcomes Natasa Stankovic to the family; shares a picture
Content:
Big, big, congratulations @hardikpandya7 and Natasa ❤ Natasa, we're so happy to have you join our crazy fam ❤ Welc… https://t.co/61MJbMfsJ2 — Krunal Pandya (@krunalpandya24) 1577955380000

The year 2020 has started on a good note with Indian cricketer Hardik Pandya getting engaged to his long time girlfriend Natasa Stankovic . The news of their engagement took the internet by storm. The love birds shared the news with their fans on their respective social media accounts.Hardik posted an adorable video of him proposing his lady love in Dubai on a speedboat while enjoying a ride with their closed ones. Sharing the news on social media, he wrote, “Mai tera, Tu meri jaane, saara Hindustan (I am yours, you are mine and the entire nation knows it). 01.01.2020 #engaged.”Soon after his post, fans and their friends from the industry started congratulating the couple. Now, Hardik’s brother Krunal Pandya too has welcomed Natasa to the family. He shared a picture on Twitter and wrote an adorable post for the newly engaged. He wrote, “Big, big, congratulations @hardikpandya7 and Natasa ❤🤗 Natasa, we're so happy to have you join our crazy fam ❤ Welcome to the madness!! Love both of you guys”Hardik’s father Himanshu Pandya revealed that the engagement took them by surprise. He shared, “Natasa is a very nice girl, and we have met her in Mumbai on a number of occasions. We knew that they were going on a vacation to Dubai, but had no clue that they were going to get engaged. This took us by surprise. We came to know about it after they got engaged.”His father also revealed that they haven’t yet decided the wedding dates and they will decide soon.

Title: Delhi: North corporation plans annual fair for small business at Ramlila Maidan
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

NDMC has decided to organise Atal Vyapar Mela from December 25 to January 3 every year at Ramlila Maidan. (Fil... Read More

NEW DELHI: North Delhi Municipal Corporation has decided to organise Atal Vyapar Mela, a traders’ fair, from December 25 to January 3 every year at Ramlila Maidan to help small and mediumsize businesses.

“The fair, named after the late Prime Minister Atal Behari Vajpayee, will have 7x5 feet and 10x10 feet stalls and these will be allotted to small and medium traders dealing in garments, handloom and food industries at minimum charges. Those who can’t afford to put up stalls at the India International Trade Fair can participate in this event,” said Tilak Raj Kataria, leader of the House. This will be the first such initiative by a corporation, he added.

In its finalised budget estimates for 2020-21, the civic agency has decided to dispose of the vehicles left in its parking lots for years. “Thousands of vehicles are kept illegally and despite obtaining no-objection certificates from the traffic police, we could not take action against them for years,” said Kataria. But in the 2020-21 budget, the corporation has created a separate head for these abandoned vehicles and hopes to earn Rs 15 lakh after selling them, he added.

However, the corporation will not hike the property tax or introduce any tax. The property tax will be collected from the residential properties in unauthorised colonies only after their regularisation.

The budget also informed that eight trommel machines had already been installed at the Bhalswa landfill for biomining of legacy waste and three more would be installed soon. “We aim to install more such machines in future from the Centre’s urban development funds to complete the biomining process in a year’s time and develop Rastriya Smarak Mandir there,” he said.

The cleared area will have replicas representing the heritage monuments of undivided India such as the Katas Raj temple in Pakistan, the Dhakeshwari National temple in Dhaka, Bangladesh, and Chanakya Ashram in Pakistan’s Taxila. “It will give an opportunity to those born after 1947 to understand the relevance of our culture,” said Kataria.

Title: Tamil Nadu civic poll results: College students to head two panchayats
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

J SANDHIYA RANI

Two young women have triumphed in the rural local body elections. Winning with a margin of 210 votes in the Kattinaikanthotty village panchayat in Krishnagiri district, 21-year-old J Sandhiya Rani has become the youngest woman village panchayat president in the state. In Tiruvarur district, R Subitha, a 22-year-old BBA graduate was elected president of Poosalangudi panchayat in Thiruthuraipoondi union.

Sandhiya, who contested as an independent, is a third year BBA student in a private college at Malur in Karnataka.

Talking to TOI, Sandhiya said she was grateful to the voters of four villages who elected her without having reservations about her age.

“The villagers have reposed their confidence in me and I will try my best to fulfil their demands,” she said.

Sandhiya’s father Jayasarathi is a farmer and former president of the Kattinaikanthotty panchayat. He decided to field his daughter after the panchayat was reserved for women.

“Our panchayat’s primary issue is drinking water. I will give much attention to that,” she said, adding that she would bring all the basic amenities to her panchayat with her father’s guidance.

Subitha, who was elected the Poosalangudi panchayat president securing 499 votes, had headed several students’ federations during her studies. She was also a member of the All India Students’ Federation (AISF) affiliated to the CPI(M).

“I have headed various federations during my college days. I think it would help me to lead my team. I am aspiring to bring as much development as possible to my village during my tenure,” she said.

Title: Tata Sons: After Cyrus Mistry’s exit, growing under N Chandrasekaran
Content:
N Chandrasekaran (File photo)

NEW DELHI: Tata Sons told the Supreme Court on Thursday that the NCLAT erred in recording that the Shapoorji Pallonji (SP) Group, of which Cyrus Investment and Sterling Investment are a part, had invested Rs 1,00,000 crore in Tata Sons when they had actually put in a mere Rs 69 crore.“Admittedly, Cyrus Investment and Sterling Investment have acquired majority of their shareholdings throughbonus issue and rights issues. While Cyrus and Sterling invested merely Rs 69 crore, they have received dividend of around Rs 872 crore from Tata Sons from 1991 to 2016,” the Tata Sons said in its petition challenging NCLAT’s decision to reinstate Cyrus Mistry as executive chairman of Tata Sons. Mistry was removed on October 24, 2016.It said SP Group first became shareholders of Tata Sons in 1965 by acquiring 40 ordinary shares and 48 preference shares of its paid-up share capital. “Thereafter over the years, Cyrus Investment and Sterling Investment acquired Tata Sons’ shares (largely through bonus and rights issue of shares), which have allowed them to reap great economic reward,” the petition said.The Tata petition said, “This is evident from the fact that their original investment of Rs 69 crore (a large chunk of which was made at the time of the rights issue in 1995), appreciated to around Rs 58,441 crore in March 2016.”Explaining the shareholding pattern of SP Group, including Pallonji Shapoorji Mistry and his son Cyrus Mistry, it said they hold 18.4% of the paid-up ordinary share capital in Tata Sons, which represents 2.91% of the issued share capital of Tata Sons (including ordinary and preference share capital). In August 2006, Cyrus Mistry was appointed as nonexecutive director independently and not as a nominee of SP Group.Ratan Tata’s decision to step down as executive director of Tata Sons in 2012 after a 21-year stint saw Cyrus Mistry’s appointment as executive deputy chairman for five years from April 1, 2012 till March 31, 2017. On December 29, 2012, Mistry was designated as executive chairman. He was also appointed as director and non-executive chairman on boards of Tata Consultancy Services Ltd, Tata Industries, Tata Teleservices, Tata Steel, Tata Motors, Tata Power, Tata Global Beverages, Indian Hotels Company and Tata Chemicals.Tata Sons in its petition said, “Instead of living up to the expectations of the Selection Committee and taking the Tata Group to newer heights, the performance of Tata Sons and most of the other operating companies was unsatisfactory during chairmanship of Mistry. Mistry’s leadership was also marred by his reluctance to disassociate himself from his family business.”The last straw on the camel’s back was Mistry’s decision for Tata Power to acquire renewable energy assets of Welspun Renewables Energy at about Rs 9,000 crore by keeping the Tata Sons board in the dark about the transaction, the petitioner alleged. “By October 24, 2016, Tata Sons had completely lost their confidence in the ability of Mistry to lead the Tata Group” and agreed for a motion to replace Mistry.The petition said, after N Chandrasekaran took over as executive chairman of Tata Sons on February 21, 2017, “Tata Sons is on an accelerated path of growth and witnessing improvement in several financial parameters”.

Title: Full cream milk vs toned milk: Which one is better?
Content: We all have grown up hearing that a glass full of milk can suffice the body’s nutritional requirement. There’s nothing better than a glass full of milk as it has ample nutrition to satiate the body’s daily dose of good health. But for most of us it is confusing to decide -- which is better-- toned milk or full cream milk. After losing weight is always a priority!Since ages, we have been reading and hearing a lot about milk and it’s amazing health benefits, but despite all good things many people find it difficult to digest this healthy drink. This is usually due to lactose-intolerance, which makes it difficult for people suffering from it to lose weight and digest milk. If you too find it confusing to decide which type of milk is good for you then keep reading.Enriched with the goodness of calcium , milk has always been associated with healthy bones and healthy teeth. Milk is one of the healthiest drinks, but if you are planning to lose weight then going for the low-fat variant of milk is often advised by experts. Since ages, we have been drinking cow milk also known as full cream milk, but is it good for someone trying to lose weight or someone suffering from lactose intolerance. However, there are so many varieties of milk which makes it a perfect drink to stay healthy and lose weight. One of the most popular variants of milk is a toned milk and it is believed to be a much healthier variant in terms of losing weight.No wonder losing weight is a universal desire, but the efforts needed can seem daunting sometimes. Hence, the best way to embark on a weight loss journey is by tweaking the way we eat or drink. In fact, healthy choices can set the tone right for losing weight. So, if you want to lose weight in a sustained way then selecting the right variant becomes a challenge read on to find out what is better toned milk or full-cream milk.One of the most popular milk variant- toned milk is prepared by adding skimmed milk powder and water to whole milk. This process helps in cutting down the fat content of milk. Moreover, it also increases its quantity as well as quality. Technically, it is the same thing as skimmed milk. In fact, one glass of toned milk contains around 80 calories, which is as good as half-the calorie count of full-cream milk.

Title: Mumbai Robbery: Mumbai businessman held for robbing forex delivery boy
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

The Hyderabad police have arrested a Mumbai businessman on charges of robbing $7,500 from the delivery boy of a foreign exchange firm at Kalyaninagar on November 21 after placing an order for forex over the phone.

The businessman, Rahul Kiran Gatiya, was arrested from his Mumbai residence on December 28. Inspector Ajay Waghmare of Yerawada police told TOI, “During questioning, Gatiya confessed to the Hyderabad police he had committed similar robberies in Mumbai, Pune, Bengaluru and Hyderabad.”

“The Hyderabad police have recovered Rs7.50lakh from his possession,” he said.

Investigations have revealed Gatiya faced losses in his business, following which he took to crime.

Title: Mumbai Robbery: Mumbai businessman held for robbing forex delivery boy
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

The Hyderabad police have arrested a Mumbai businessman on charges of robbing $7,500 from the delivery boy of a foreign exchange firm at Kalyaninagar on November 21 after placing an order for forex over the phone.

The businessman, Rahul Kiran Gatiya, was arrested from his Mumbai residence on December 28. Inspector Ajay Waghmare of Yerawada police told TOI, “During questioning, Gatiya confessed to the Hyderabad police he had committed similar robberies in Mumbai, Pune, Bengaluru and Hyderabad.”

“The Hyderabad police have recovered Rs7.50lakh from his possession,” he said.

Investigations have revealed Gatiya faced losses in his business, following which he took to crime.

Title: Kerala: Man attacked for refusing CPM leader money for bash
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Jackfruit vendor Senthil Roy (in picture) was hospitalized after the attack by secretary of CPM’s Naduthottam ... Read More

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: A local CPM leader at Parassala was arrested by police on Thursday on charges of attempt to murder for allegedly subjecting a man to brutal assault for questioning extortion.

Pradeep, 29, of Naduthottam under Parassala police station limits is the secretary of CPM's Naduthottam branch. The complainant, Senthil Roy alias Reji, 39, of Valanvila near Injivila under Parassala police station limits is being treated at Thiruvananthapuram Government Medical College Hospital. Roy, a jackfruit vendor, has sustained five broken ribs, a fracture on skull and injuries on lungs, police said.

Parassala police station house officer inspector S M Riyaz said as per the statement of the complainant, he was assaulted by a group of men, including Pradeep, during the early hours of January 1 at Valanvila after he refused to give them money for buying beverages for New Year celebrations. They kicked him down and ran an autorickshaw over his body, inflicting serious injuries on his ribcage.

"The complainant mentioned four people whom he could identify and three men, whom he could not identify. Pradeep was one among those identified. Hence, we took him into custody and recorded his arrest. A search is on for the remaining assailants,'' the inspector said.

Though the alleged attack took place around 1am on Wednesday, police received the information only by the evening. On the same night, they visited the complainant at the hospital and recorded his statement following which a case was registered. On Thursday, around 11am, they detained Pradeep and simultaneously made arrangements to record the sworn statement of the complainant by a local magistrate under provisions of section 164 of CrPC owing to the serious nature of the case as the accused was a local leader of the ruling party. They also moved Pradeep to a secret location anticipating protests from his party workers.

Meanwhile, the CPM local leadership of Parassala cried foul over the arrest of Pradeep. Speaking to TOI, CPM Parassala local committee secretary R Biju said Pradeep was not even there at the crime scene when it occurred. "Pradeep has been on the forefront of activities related to curbing substance mafia in the locality. The people who attacked Roy are members of substance mafia. There are people, including elderly persons returning from church, who witnessed the attack. According to them, it was just two men who assaulted Roy, and Pradeep was not there,'' Biju said.

Title: Bigg Boss Kannada 7 written update: Bigg Boss Kannada 7 update, Day 81: Shine Shetty gains maximum luxury points
Content: In the latest episode of Bigg Boss Kannada 7 , Bigg Boss announces the next stage of the luxury budget task, in which the contestants are provided with stocking and an egg.The contestants are asked to break the egg placed on their opponent's head with the help of a baton made of foam. While some choose to stand alone, others team-up for an attack.Bhoomi manages to protect the egg and gains 400 points. Prathap earns 200 points and bags the second spot.After a while, Bigg Boss assigns a task to Shine Shetty as he hits the buzzer first. As per the task, Shine is asked to pick nicknames for his inmates according to their characteristics and behaviour inside the house.By the end of the task, Shine gains 100 points.Later, Bigg Boss announces the next task for the day. As per the task, the contestants are asked to grab a balloon from one end and tag it to a pole at the other end of the garden area. To tag the balloon, the contestants are asked to pass a frame, which consists of tangled ropes.The housemates gear up for the task. As the task progresses, Deepika, Kishen, Bhoomi and Prathap team up and decide to blast the balloons of the other contestants.However, Shine manages to overcome all the obstacles and tags four balloons. He gains 400 points.Since Deepika and Prathap managed to tag three balloons each, Bigg Boss announces a tiebreaker between them.As the duo gear up for the task, the inmates cheer for them. Prathap completes the task first and bags the second spot.After the task, Chandana suffers a breakdown due to embarrassment as she failed to perform in the task related to balloons. Shine and Bhoomi console her.

Title: Cops act after clip of moral policing at fort in Kajrat goes viral
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

NAVI MUMBAI: After a video of a group of 11 youths being harassed by another group and accused of consuming alcohol and drugs during New Year celebrations in the Peb fort area of Karjat went viral, the police initiated action on Thursday.

The police are yet to ascertain how many people assaulted the youths and made them remove their shirts on New Year’s Eve.

The victims included a Chhattisgarh resident, while the rest were from Mumbai.

The victims were stripped, assaulted, made to kneel down and forced to promise not to repeat what they were doing.

The group that did the moral policing filmed the incident and posted the video on social media.

“After the video went viral on social media, our officials had a discussion on the issue with Raigad SP Anil Paraskar,” assistant inspector Avinash Patil said. “Based on his instructions, the details were found out and a suo motu police case has been registered for wrongful restraint (IPC 341) against unknown persons on Thursday.”

Patil said that after recording the statement of the victims additional sections would be invoked and a manhunt launched for the suspects.

“As nobody goes to the fort at the year-end, our teams were not patrolling the area,” he said. “One of the victims was supposed to come to the police station but was not able to do it due to some family issues.”

Locals say there are many organisations, many of them with very similar names, that are into moral policing there. The number of people involved in the harassment would be known after the victims come forward and give details of the incident. One of the accused is partly visible in the video but is yet to be identified.

Title: Trichy: Class 11 girl, missing for two days, found dead
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

TRICHY: A 16-year-old girl, who went missing from home a couple of days ago, was found dead with her face wrapped at North Nagamangalam near Manikandam in Trichy on Thursday.

Acting on the information from local people, the Manikandam police rushed to the spot and found the girl’s body under the bushes. The police said that her face was covered with her dupatta. The hands and legs were not tied. The police recovered the body and brought it to Mahatma Gandhi memorial government hospital (MGMGH) in Trichy.

The preliminary enquiry revealed that she was a Class 11 student residing in the area. Her parents had lodged a complaint with the Manikandam police after the girl reportedly went missing from home at 8.30 pm on December 31.

The police said that the parents of the girl said to the police that she went out to relieve herself on the day but she failed to return home. The police said that there were no external injuries on her body.

Title: Mikel Arteta appointment has changed Arsenal
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Mikel Arteta. (Reuters Photo)

Title: 20 foot-tall purifier to keep the air clean at Lajpat Nagar market
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

The tower will be inaugurated by Gautam Gambhir on Friday.

NEW DELHI: In a first-of-its-kind initiative, the Traders’ Association Lajpat Nagar (TALN), in coordination with east Delhi area MP Gautam Gambhir , has decided to install a 20-foot-tall prototype air purifier in Central Market.

The tower will be inaugurated by Gambhir on Friday.

Ashwani Marwah, general secretary of the association, said that the tower will purify air within a circumference area of 500-750 metres.

“We were working on this for long. It could be realised only after we got permission from various authorities, including South Corporation, to install the tower over a covered drain. Our area MP’s foundation agreed to support the cost of equipment. We will bear the running cost,” he said.

“It may also curb foul smell emanating from the main drain in Lajpat Nagar,” he added.

Gambhir said that the tower is expected to treat up to 6,00,000 cubic metres of air per day and collect more than 75% of two kinds of pollutants i.e. PM 2.5 and PM 10.

“Fighting Delhi’s pollution is my priority and we are working on several such initiatives. We will analyse this outdoor purifier’s performance and then install several such purifiers across the constituency,” the MP added.

Title: Finance ministry pushes banks, businesses to put in RuPay infra
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

(Representative image)

NEW DELHI: With a large number of banks only issuing Mastercard or Visa cards, the finance ministry has decided to ask them to ensure that there is no infrastructure or card constraint that holds back consumers from taking advantage of the benefit of no merchant discount rate on RuPay or UPI.

Similarly, the revenue department is meeting industry bodies to spread the message that all businesses with annual turnover of Rs 50 crore or more put in place the required infrastructure for the smooth rollout of the regime that was announced in the Budget. “Anyone who does not allow consumers to take advantage of this scheme will face a daily penalty of Rs 5,000. We want to ensure that the rollout is smooth,” a senior officer told TOI.

The sources said that tax officials will visit stores from February 1 to check if the facility is available or not and anyone found to be violating the diktat will be fined.

The move is part of the government’s push to promote digital transactions, which not only help track fund flow easily but also reduce the cost of business. Tax officials said that banks should be encouraging the use of cashless transactions instead of hobbling them. The revenue department stepped in to announce the measures that banks were seen to be moving slowly in the absence of RBI guidelines.

“Banks can’t be seen to be promoting one or the other payment system, they need to provide RuPay and UPI,” said an officer. The MDR waiver for businesses with annual turnover of Rs 50 crore or more is effective from Wednesday. MDR is the cost paid by a merchant to a bank for accepting payment from their customers via digital means.

Title: Maharashtra: Employee of ATM security firm decamps with Rs 4 crore
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

NAVI MUMBAI: The Koparkhairane police are on the lookout for an employee of a security firm, which handles cash for several bank ATMs, for allegedly decamping with Rs 3.96 crore cash meant for 35 ATMs in Thane, Bhiwandi and Palghar.

Senior inspector Suryakant Jagdale said accused Sachin Wagh (35) is a resident of Kalwa, Thane and had been working for Securitrans India Pvt Ltd (SIPL) for the past 12 years as senior custodian of the cash to be deposited in ATMs. “He had the keys and passwords of 37 ATMs in Thane, Bhiwandi and Palghar areas and he allegedly misused this information to commit the crime,” the police officer said.

Jagdale said the embezzlement came to light after Wagh did not report to work on December 26. When Wagh was not reachable on his cellphone, staff members went to his house. They were told he had left for office at 6 am.

“An audit of route number 2 assigned to Wagh revealed he had loaded only partial cash in 35 ATMs and swindled the rest between December 11 and December 13,” Jagdale said.As the agency has alleged some bank staff might also be involved in the crime, an FIR has been registered against Wagh and others.

Title: Mumbai: Ajit Pawar takes cue from uncle, begins Dalit outreach
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Deputy chief minister Ajit Pawar reviewed the Ambedkar memorial project on Thursday

MUMBAI: In a bid to connect with NCP’s Dalit voters, deputy CM Ajit Pawar visited Koregaon-Bhima on January 1 and on Thursday paid tributes to Dr BR Ambedkar at Chaityabhoomi and reviewed the Ambedkar memorial project at the Indu Mill compound in Dadar.

Ajit on Wednesday skipped a meeting on GST called by CM Uddhav Thackeray and went to Koregaon Bhima in Pune district, where the ‘Jay Stambh’ marks the battle of 1818 remembered by Dalits where soldiers from the Mahar community fighting as part of the British forces were ranged against the army of the Peshwas. On Thursday, he first went to Chaityabhoomi and then visited the Indu Mill compound. After a review meeting with officials of the implementing authority, MMRDA, the deputy CM told mediapersons, “The project will be completed by April 14, 2022. There are a few formalities to be completed regarding permission. However, work will get started this month.”

He instructed officials that gates of the monument should be high and a tree plantation programme undertaken to ensure more greenery. “After reviewing the project, gave instructions to concerned project officials regarding future work. Discussed key issues including security aspect at the time,” Pawar tweeted.

PM Modi had laid the foundation stone of the memorial in October 2015. During the BJP-Sena government, then CM Devendra Fadnavis had said the project would be completed by December 6, 2020 (Mahaparinivan Din, Ambedkar’s death anniversary), while the Maha Vikas Aghadi has extended the deadline by two years, until April 14, 2022 (Ambedkar’s birth anniversary).

NCP chief Sharad Pawar had, after the assembly poll results, told party leaders to work to win the confidence of the Dalit community. NCP, which won 54 seats, has been concerned about Dalit voters going to the Prakash Ambedkar-led VBA which bagged a sizeable chunk of votes during the LS and assembly polls.

Title: Karnataka’s Jammu and Kashmir luxury hotel plan hits snag
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Karnataka tourism minister CT Ravi

BENGALURU: Three months after it was mooted, the Karnataka government’s ambitious proposal to run a luxury hotel in Jammu & Kashmir has failed to take off due to technical reasons that include the absence of internet and mobile services in J&K and the change in the status of J&K from a state to Union Territory.

The state government had proposed a luxury hotel in J&K soon after the Centre revoked special status to the state in September last year. Tourism minister CT Ravi had written to then J&K governor Satyapal Malik and outlined the state government’s intent.

Karnataka State Tourism Development Corporation (KSTDC) was to run the hotel. Speaking to TOI, KSTDC MD Kumar Pushkar said the government plans to buy 10 to 15 acres of land in J&K.

“We want to facilitate Karnataka tourists who frequent J&K for religious events like the Amarnath Yatra,” Pushkar said. “More than commercial viability, we are looking at a property to serve citizens. However, we are yet to hear from the J&K administration.”

Officials said the communication blockade had hampered efforts. “We were unable to reach officials to know the status of our proposal. This included the governor’s office,” said a senior official.

However, Pushkar said he managed to get in touch with the director of tourism for J&K a few days ago and there has been some development on the proposal. “If required, a team from Karnataka will visit J&K for further negotiation,” Pushkar said.

The other major problem was the change in the status of J&K. “The minister’s first letter was addressed to the state government of J&K. Now, they are changing it to a UT and they have asked for a fresh process.”

“The J&K governor had in fact given me an appointment in this regard on December 20, but due to anti-CAA protests, the meet was cancelled,” Ravi said.

Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Karnataka tourism minister CT Ravi

BENGALURU: Three months after it was mooted, the Karnataka government’s ambitious proposal to run a luxury hotel in Jammu & Kashmir has failed to take off due to technical reasons that include the absence of internet and mobile services in J&K and the change in the status of J&K from a state to Union Territory.
