Title: Manish Sisodia, Harsh Vardhan in war of words over parent-teacher meet
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Union health minister Harsh Vardhan and Delhi Deputy chief minister Manish Sisodia. (File photo)

NEW DELHI: Deputy chief minister Manish Sisodia on Thursday lashed out at Union health minister Harsh Vardhan , a day after the latter wrote to LG Anil Baijal against the scheduled parent-teacher meeting in government schools on January 4 in “extreme cold weather”.

Addressing a press conference, Sisodia said, “How dare the health minister write a letter to stall the meeting, he should be ashamed...” The deputy CM said AAP government believed that PTMs were instrumental in improving the quality of education in Delhi and accused the central minister of conspiring for political mileage.

Chief minister Arvind Kejriwal said the PTMs allowed parents to discuss with teachers the progress of their wards and that many parents eagerly waited for these meets. The CM said that not only would the PTMs be organised as scheduled but he would also attend one of them.

Sisodia, too, insisted, “PTMs are one of the major reasons behind the remarkable transformation of Delhi’s government schools. It is clear that BJP is against the very idea of affordable and quality education.” He added: “It is unfortunate that we have such leaders and ministers who can stoop to the level of stopping a PTM. BJP is not interested in developing the education system of the country or any state, but in Delhi, because AAP government has done remarkable work, it wants to disrupt it.”

Sisodia said AAP had worked hard in the last five years to develop the government school education system in Delhi and now the Delhi model was being discussed everywhere. He said the PTM was scheduled keeping in the mind the upcoming board examinations.

Harsh Vardhan rejected the allegations and said he didn’t need a certificate from Sisodia. “They (AAP) are disturbed because they are going to face a very tough situation in the election. They may come up with more such remarks. I believe in my duty. The education fraternity is well aware of my credentials (sic),” he said.

He added that he wrote the letter only after a teachers’ association reached out to him.

Title: IOC plans to monetise its assets through SPVs, arms
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

(Representative image)

NEW DELHI: India’s largest oil refiner and fuel retailer, IOC , is looking at monetising its pipelines and storage infrastructure.

The plan is to create special purpose vehicles (SPVs) or subsidiaries to tap private equity and venture capital funds to maximise utilisation of assets, and lock in future revenue.

The option of BOOT (build, own, operate and transfer) is also on the table as the company has successfully implemented this model for the tank farm, the vital storage facility, at its 300,000bpd (barrels-per-day) Paradip refinery in Odisha.

Sources told TOI the discussions among the top management and the parent oil ministry revolve around creating SPVs or subsidiaries and then offering stake in them to PE or VC funds. The discussions are at a nascent stage and the quantum of stake to be offered will depend on the assets and their layouts.

“Given the low interest rates abroad, many PE and VC funds are willing to invest in IOC assets as they offer assured and elevated returns due to high utilisation as well as a quick exit option, while the asset can remain with IOC — something like a hospitality arrangement,” one executive told TOI.

The PE route, thus, is seen as economical funding source for IOC without losing assets. PE funding will lock in future revenue at today’s value. It will provide money for the expansion, reduce borrowings and interest outgo. This will raise profitability and dividend payout.

On New Year Day, IOC chairman Sanjiv Singh told employees not to “consume WhatsApp theories” and focus on the company’s inherent strengths to prepare for the changing energy market architecture.

Title: Chile's Niemann grabs Tournament of Champions lead
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Los Angeles, Jan 3 (AFP) Chile's Joaquin Niemann, riding the confidence-boost of a Presidents Cup appearance, fired seven birdies in a seven-under par 66 on Thursday to take a one-shot first-round lead in the US PGA Tour Tournament of Champions. Niemann didn't win a match in the International team's Presidents Cup loss to the United States at Royal Melbourne last month, but the 21-year-old said the week was a valuable learning experience. "I think the Presidents Cup was huge for me, for my career, for my future," Niemann said. "I think during that week I learned a lot, I was with the best players in the world, I was teammates with Adam Scott. I talked a lot with them. It was an unbelievable week." Niemann, whose six-shot win at The Greenbrier in September secured his spot in the winner's only Tournament of Champions, showed plenty of confidence on the par-73 Plantation course at Kapalua, Hawaii. He rolled in a 31-foot birdie putt for his first birdie of the day at the fourth, and his remaining six birdies were all from within 11 feet. He missed just one green in regulation, and got up and down for par to head into the second round with a one-shot lead over world number four Justin Thomas. Thomas also played without a bogey, grabbing five of his six birdies on the back nine to take sole possession of second place on 67. Americans Matt Kuchar and Rickie Fowler shared third on 68, with defending champion Xander Schauffele heading a group of five players on 69. Only nine players in the 34-man field were over par in Thursday's light breezes -- which were expected to be replaced by gusty winds on Friday. Despite the relatively benign conditions, it was an eventful day for two-time tournament winner Dustin Johnson. The former world number one's one-under par 72 included five birdies and an eagle along with a double-bogey seven at the par-five ninth and four bogeys. (AFP) APA APA

Title: West Bengal government leans on schools for buses to ease jams, reduce pollution
Content:
The stretch in front of a school on AJC Bose Road choked with vehicles during closure time

KOLKATA: Schools in the city had been asked to introduce buses to ferry students to and from homes to decongest roads and reduce pollution, state chief secretary Rajiva Sinha stated in an affidavit to the NGT in relation to a case on the city’s degrading air quality filed by green crusader Subhas Datta.Twenty-seven institutions, including La Martiniere that does not have school buses, submitted a report to the government about their willingness to start the facility and that they expected a substantial number of students to avail of the service from April 2020. Sinha mentioned the schools’ report in his affidavit. At schools that don’t have buses, especially those located in central Kolkata, kids travel by private or pooled cars, contributing to snarls owing to the sheer number of vehicles used by them. Because of the schools’ locations on thoroughfares or just off them, traffic came to a grinding halt at the beginning and end of school hours every day, said a Nabanna source, adding that the congestion led to enormous pollution.A bus occupied a space of three cars (three-passenger car unit) on the road but carried passengers of nine cars, said an expert, adding a bus thus saved fuel and emission of at least nine cars. Pointing out that most private cars ferried only one student to a school, Bhargav Moitra of IIT Kharagpur, who came up with an integrated model for school transit system, said school buses were the most preferred option to decongest roads. Moreover, if schools invested in electric buses, it would be a profitable venture in the long run, as it would mean low energy cost and zero emission, Moitra said.A stakeholders’ committee, headed by commissioner of school education Soumitra Mohan, has held multiple meetings with big institutions in the city, especially those in central Kolkata. The committee forwarded their recommendation to the chief secretary. In the meeting, prime institutes, like Modern High, La Martiniere, Sri Sri Academy, Calcutta international School and Techno India took part. A La Martiniere official said they would convene a meeting with parents and senior police officers. “We will tell parents about our plan to introduce school buses. Even if 30%-40% students opt for the service, we will go for it. We know school buses will decongest roads to a great extent,” said the official.Modern High has recently increased its school bus fleet by one. “We will add more if more kids opt for school buses,” said an official. Father Don Bosco School principal Bikash Mondal, however, said, “Buses may not solve our problem. The adjacent Darga Road is not wide enough but school buses will add to the congestion. We have submitted our opinion, counter-signed by the local traffic police guard officer.”“Buses have distinct advantages as far as easing snarls and students’ safety are concerned. We now prefer 50-seater omnibus, which brings down the cost per student and ensures high level of comfort. Thanks to advancement of technology, like CCTV surveillance and RFID tags, security of children in modern bus system is also ensured,” said Anurag Agarwal, who runs 850 school buses for 16 big institutions in and around the city. IIT’s Moitra pointed out car-pooling had spoilt the system as parents were now got comfortable with doorto-door services. But for greater safety of students and city’s pollution, school buses were an absolutely necessity, he said. He added school buses saved hundreds of lives, provided millions of jobs nationwide, improved traffic and cut down on pollution.

Title: India tops in user information requests on TikTok
Content:
(File photo)

CHENNAI: India sent the highest number of requests for user information and content removal to popular short video app TikTok . This was revealed by the app’s owner — Chinese social media company ByteDance — in its first transparency report for the first six months of 2019.India made a total of 107 requests to the Chinese social media company, of which 99 were legal requests and eight were emergency requests. The Centre also made an additional 11requests for content removal across nine specified accounts. TikTok said it removed or restricted eight accounts and four pieces of content after the Indian government’s request. A total of 143 Indian accounts were mentioned in these requests.TikTok complied with about 47% of requests made by India for user information. After India, the US made the highest number of such requests (85) to TikTok, according to the report. Japan, Norway and the UK were some of the other countries mentioned in this transparency report, released on December 30.Social media platforms like Twitter and Facebook also publish similar reports on a biannual basis. For Tik-Tok, India is a critical market with over 120 million monthly active users.“Any information request we receive is carefully reviewed for legal sufficiency to determine whether, for example, the requesting entity is authorised to gather evidence in connection with a law enforcement investigation or to investigate an emergency involving imminent harm,” TikTok said. It declined to respond to TOI’s queries on how the app evaluates state requests.Owing to its Chinese roots, the company has been under scrutiny over the storage and treatment of user data, including from the government and RSS-affiliated Swadeshi Jagaran Manch (SJM).

Title: Why January is dubbed ‘divorce month’ in the US
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

Matrimonial attorneys across the United States have prepared for this January when divorce filings peak. Unofficially dubbed “divorce month” in legal circles in US, there’s a variety of reasons why couples have historically chosen to separate after the holidays — and a number of ways for clients to cope.

The phrase “divorce month” became so prevalent in matrimonial law that, in 2016, a study from the University of Washington was conducted to see if there was any statistical evidence to back up the anecdotes. Researchers examined divorce filings from 2001 to 2015 in the state of Washington and determined that filings did indeed increase in January, compared to December .

Ohio, Minnesota, Florida, and Arizona were found to exhibit similar patterns; according to Google Trends , the topic of “divorce” peaked the week of January 6 through 12. But while divorce filings spike in January, couples begin their search for legal resources during the holidays when many attorneys are out of office.

For many, the new year often reminds us that we need a fresh start. This is particularly common in unhealthy relationships and dead-end marriages, where couples may decide the best resolution is to part ways. It’s also important to remember that winter and summer holidays are culturally important times for families with children, and filing for divorce during them may be seen as inappropriate.

Other troubled marriages may see the holidays as a time to patch things up, with hopes that things will improve. People often raise their expectations during the holidays, despite past troubles in their relationship. Coupled with an expectation for positive change at the new year, many couples attempt to stick it out through the holidays.

But for others, the University of Washington study found the holidays to be exhausting and emotionally demanding, exposing cracks in their marriages.

Overall, experts advise to do what’s right for you. And, once you make your call, don’t look back.

Title: Ke Apon Ke Por written update: Ke Apon Ke Por update, January 2: Joba gets a clue
Content: In the latest episode of Ke Apon Ke Por , Joba feels helpless and wonders how she can handle the situation. She is equally worried about Itu’s situation and decides to talk to her. Meanwhile, Koel speaks with Itu, pleading her to calm down. But the latter shows no interest in listening to her. Joba enters the room and asks her to stay strong.When Itu continues crying, Joba decides to be strict and asks her to accept the truth, even if it is harsh. She asks Koel to go outside and has a private conversation with Itu. She asks her whether Sarthak told her anything.Itu feels bad thinking Joba doubts Sarthak. Joba explains that she can help Sarthak only if she gets a clue about him.Elsewhere, Sarthak wonders what he has to do now. He feels bad for his family. The men appointed by Tandra ask Sarthak to stay away from the outside world.At home, Mitti and Tinni bother are curious about Sarthak’s case. Both of them have a different agenda. They notice Koel standing outside Itu’s room and learn that Joba is speaking with Itu.Joba searches Sarthak’s room with the hope of getting some clue. She finds out his diary which mentions about some expenditure. This makes her curious.Sarthak turns emotional and decides to call Itu. As soon as he calls, the goons snatch the phone from him. Although Sarthak is unable to speak anything, Itu realises it must be him. Joba and Param learn about the call and contact police.

Title: Forensic Lab in Delhi: Forensic lab in Rohini to have hi-tech DNA testing
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Delhi home minister Satyendar Jain

NEW DELHI: Delhi home minister Satyendar Jain on Thursday laid the foundation stone for expansion of Forensic Science Laboratory (FSL) in Rohini . The lab will be equipped with high-tech DNA lab for crime against women and children, advanced cyber forensic lab , facilities for testing of narcotic drugs and psychotropic substances, among other facilities.

Delhi government’s forensic science laboratory plays an important role in the area of scientific examination of crime exhibits and evidential clues which go a long way in fighting crime. Jain laid the foundation stone of Annexe Building on the premises of the FSL.

“The expansion of forensic facility would create fear among the criminals, and it would certainly bring down the crime rate in Delhi,” said Jain.

The expansion will equip the forensic lab with advanced narco analysis and brain mapping facilities for psychological examination of criminals. It will also get 24X7 advanced crime scene examination and investigation services. In the wake of the growing cyber crime cases of late, an advanced cyber forensic lab has also been planned. “All the facilities would be ultra modern to produce best results.”

Meanwhile, a separate vehicle examination site, which would be exclusively for examination of vehicles involved in crimes, is ready. It is expected to become operational soon.

The minister also inaugurated the brain fingerprinting facilities for forensic psychological examination for suspects and criminals. “The government has decided to search and establish the world-class latest technology and to reform the laboratory with wellequipped forensic tools and machinery,” the FSL said in a statement.

Title: Karnataka: Govt pharmacists protest, demand pay scale revision
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

BENGALURU: Pharmacists working for the state government on Thursday launched a protest raising demands, including upward revision of their pay scale and filling up posts of pharmacists.

As many as 2,000 pharmacists attended work wearing black ribbons on their shoulders. Karnataka State Government Pharmacists Association president BS Desai said despite several representations made to the government to consider pharmacy education as technical education, the state has not done so, affecting pharmacists’ pay scales.

If the government fails to fulfil the demands, members will boycott central government programmes from February 10 and stop working in hospitals in March, the association said.

Title: Resignation of Allahabad University VC accepted: HRD ministry
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

NEW DELHI: The resignation of Allahabad University Vice Chancellor Ratan Lal Hangloo , who was under the scanner over alleged financial and administrative irregularities, has been accepted, officials said Friday.

“His resignation was sent by the HRD ministry to Rashtrapati Bhawan and it has been approved,” officials told PTI.

Hangloo had resigned on Wednesday.

He was under the scanner since 2016 over irregularities. Hangloo was also summoned by the National Commission for Women (NCW) last week over allegations of improper handling of sexual harassment complaints and lack of grievance redressal mechanism for female students.

Title: Punjab education department to fill all vacant posts before new session
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

CHANDIGARH: With an aim to improve quality of education by overcoming the chronic problem of staff shortage, the Punjab education department has set a target of filling the vacant posts by the end of current academic session.

The move is in line with the target set by the state government to fill the vacant posts in different departments by the end of this year under the flagship ‘Ghar Ghar Rozgar’ scheme.

For filling up of vacant posts, the finance department has accorded approval to the proposal, which will now be put before the state cabinet. After getting the cabinet’s nod, the department aims to complete the recruitment process by the March 31.

In addition to new recruitment, the department has completed the process for promotions of primary teachers to master cadre, master cadre to lecturer, and lecturer to principal.

The department recently held a meeting with all the district education officers and they were directed to complete the seniority lists of the teachers and process of pending promotions at earliest.

Punjab education minister Vijay Inder Singla has said that recruitment of teachers and other staff is top priority and the recruitment process has been put on fast track mode.

The move has given a ray of hope to teacher eligibility test (TET)-qualified unemployed youth who have been staging protests for jobs. The minister has thus exhorted the unemployed youth to shed the path of demonstrations as the department has expedited the recruitment process.

The government jobs remain the first choice of educated youth of the state. There are about 1.10 lakh jobs in different departments of the state government which are lying vacant from past many years. Preference of government jobs over private jobs has been one of the key reasons for large number of private jobs offered during the job fairs not being taken up.

With figure of about 18,000, the Punjab State Power Corporation Limited has the highest number of vacant post, followed by director of public instructions (secondary education) where about 5,000 posts are lying vacant. Around 12,000 posts at different levels are unfilled in local government department.

Title: Woman shot by dad-in-law in Faridkot
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

BATHINDA: Angered by getting his breakfast late and a trifle cold, an ex-serviceman shot dead his daughter-in-law in Kotkapura town of Faridkot. Sham Puri , 62, is a retired airman.

Neelam Rani, a school teacher, had to take care of her physically-impaired husband Manish and her father-in-law apart from her two children. Thursday being a holiday, she took her time preparing breakfast. So, when her father-in-law demanded his meal, she could not immediately comply, and by the time she did serve it, it had turned cold.

This led to a heated exchange between the two and Puri allegedly fired at Neelam with his .12 bore gun.

Police have arrested him and registered a case of murder and under the Arms Act."

Title: Promoters of NDTV move HC on notice from Sebi
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Pronnoy Roy (File photo)

MUMBAI: NDTV promoters Prannoy Roy and his wife Radhika approached the Bombay high court on Thursday to challenge a show-cause notice issued to them in 2018 by Sebi for alleged violations of insider trading rules. The markets regulator’s charges relate to the two trading in scrips of news channel NDTV as its promoters.

The Roys have challenged the validity of the notice dated August 31, 2018, issued by the regulator 10 years after the alleged trading activity in violation of Sebi (Prohibition of Insider Trading) Regulations. Through their counsel Fereshte Sethna, the Roys submitted that the Sebi notice “constitutes a gross abuse of process” and that the allegations levelled by the regulator “are baseless and unfounded”. Their case is that there is “no shred of evidence” with Sebi, nor have they been furnished any documents to substantiate the allegations.

Their plea before the HC bench, headed by Justice S C Dharmadhikari, was to quash the notice and to be given documents which Sebi is relying on. Their case is that the nature of allegations levelled against the Roys are serious in nature, and hence require “clinching evidentiary basis” as a “mandatory precursor for the initiation of any such proceedings”.

Also, Sethna’s argument was that the framework doesn’t require records to be maintained for over three years by the company, and hence the notice for a 10-year-old trade puts them in an unfair position for rebutting. Their petition says that since the Sebi notice is issued after 10 years from the alleged transactions, relevant records are no longer available with them and hence the notice would “irretrievably prejudice and jeopardise the right to defend themselves”.

The Roys said that the Sebi notice relates to the proposed restructuring of NDTV into ‘news-related businesses’ and investments in ‘beyond news’ businesses held through NDTV Network Plc, in 2008, a proposal that was eventually not implemented.

Title: Tamil Nadu: Cattle farmers worried about new breeding Act
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Farmers from Madurai say imposing restrictions through Bovine Breeding Act 2019 by the government will have ad... Read More

MADURAI: At a time when farmers raising indigenous bulls are facing several financial hardships, the Tamil Nadu Bovine Breeding Act , 2019, will only make it harder for the farmers to raise non-castrated indigenous bulls . Harsh punishment like ₹50,000 fine for owning unlicensed bulls and forcing farmers to kill those which are declared to be unfit for reproduction, will force them out of the activity.

Experts say that the Act is aimed at facilitating corporates to flourish in the business of artificial insemination and make farmers dependent on large firms for insemination, just like the seed business which has gone into the hands of corporates.

B Mani, a bull owner from Mudakathan, said the new act says that officials can enter any premises without any notice for inspection if they believe there is bull raised with or without registration. It is no business of the state to check what kind of indigenous bulls are being raised by farmers. “If the government do not want to gove farmers incentives, it should at least stay away from imposing unnecessary burden. It will not be feasible for us to register and renew it every two years. There is a fine of ₹50,000 for not registering a bull. Why should a farmer have to undergo punishment for raising a bull,” he asked.

An official from animal husbandry said that the Act was brought since there has been no regulation in place for bovine breeding. It is also to prescribe standards for frozen semen production and artificial insemination. He also said that indiscriminate cross breeding will bring down the quality of bovine in the state.

The bloodline of exotic animal should not exceed 50% while doing crossbreeding and the act will regulate it, he said.

T Rajesh of Jallikattu Pathugappu Kuzhu said that they are not concerned about other sections of the law, which controls companies into production of frozen semen or artificial insemination services,butthey opposeonly section 12 of the act pertains to farmers.

Title: Windshield cracks, Chennai-Goa SpiceJet flight lands in Bengaluru
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

BENGALURU: Passengers on board a SpiceJet flight from Chennai to Goa on Thursday spent an anxious hour as the cockpit windshield developed a crack mid-air, forcing the pilots to make an emergency landing at the Bengaluru airport.

Sources said the windshield on the co-pilot’s side cracked shortly after takeoff from Chennai around 11am. Around 70 passengers were onboard.

“SpiceJet flight SG3105 (Chennai-Goa) was diverted to Kempegowda International Airport due to a technical issue. It landed without incident at 12:17pm on January 2, 2020. All passengers and crew are reported safe,” a Bangalore International Airport Limited (BIAL) spokesperson said. BIAL is the operator of KIA.

“While cruising, the outer pane of P2 side windshield cracked. The pilot in command decided to divert the flight to Bengaluru. The aircraft landed safely,” a SpiceJet spokesperson said.

The passengers left for Goa in another aircraft after 2pm. The flight was originally scheduled to arrive in Goa at 1.23pm.

Title: HAL, Wipro ink pact for 3D printing in aerospace
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

BENGALURU: In a first, defence PSU Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL), and Wipro 3D, the metal additive manufacturing business of Wipro Infrastructure Engineering (WIN), have signed an MoU to design, develop, manufacture and repair aerospace components using metal additive technology.

The agreement, HAL said on Thursday, accentuates development, prove out and application of new material for use in metal additive technology.

“Qualification of parts for aerospace is challenging as it would require prove out and extensive testing followed by certification by regulatory authorities. This cooperation would be a unique opportunity for both the parties and metal 3D printing has the potential to play a significant role in the success of national aerospace and defense platforms, including HAL’s own needs,” said Shekhar Shrivastava, CEO, Bengaluru Complex, HAL.

Pratik Kumar, CEO, WIN, said, “This MoU will bring Metal 3D printing into the mainstream of India’s aerospace. It further strengthens our collaborative efforts to create additive technology leadership in Aerospace.”

Title: Road fatalities in Himachal Pradesh down by 7%: DGP
Content:
Representative image

SHIMLA: Deaths in road accidents in Himachal Pradesh fell by 7.08% last year as compared to 2018. Stating this here on Thursday, DGP Sita Ram Mardi said stopping road fatalities would be a top priority in 2020 for police. Other priorities of the department include implementing NDPS Act more effectively and improving investigation capacity for cybercrime , the officer added.Over 1,000 people are killed every year in road accidents in Himachal and registration of crime under NDPS Acts went up by 7.2% as compared to 2018. It has also been found that youthin the state are falling prey to synthetic drugs even as the cybercrime graph is rising. Considering this, police has included road accidents, drive against drug abuse and cybercrime in its priority of 2020.Mardi said that to curb road accidents, police will work under EEE strategy — education, engineering and enforcement. Under education, police would create awareness among drivers and identify accident prone spots. As for enforcement, the department would be tighten the noose around drivers involved in over-speeding, overloading, using mobile while driving and not using seat belts. To keep an eye on criminals and anti-social elements, CCTV cameras networking would be increased. Police have also set a target of adding one lakh people to drug-free Himachal app , which has only 10,000 people connected so far. He said people can use this app to expose those involved in illicit drug trade to ensure that their identity is not revealed.Comparing the crime data of 2019 and 2018, the DGP said of the 19,924 FIRs registered last year, 69 were of murder — the lowest in the state in last 10 years. Besides, 95.7% of the 358 rape cases registered last year were solved. Mardi said that there was increase in registration of cases under NDPS Act and dip in those of rape and murder last year as compared to 2018.

Title: Mohali: Rs 2 lakh compensation for death caused by animal
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

The move aims at controlling stray animal menace in Mohali

MOHALI: The municipal corporation has proposed a Rs 2-lakh compensation for death caused by an animal. In case the animal is a pet, its owner is liable to pay the compensation. And in case of a stray, the civic body will shell it out.

This is part of animal bylaws' draft for registration and control of stray animals. The agenda points will come up for approval in the MC house meeting slated for Friday. In case the victim becomes disabled due to the animal attack or bite, (s)he, too, will be entitled to Rs 2-lakh compensation, but only after the case is duly certified by the civil surgeon.

Besides, one family can get only three pets registered at a given time, and the registration will be renewed every year by April 1. Annual registration fee for a single pet is proposed at Rs 100, and late fee for first month will be Rs 100 (over and above the registration fee), for two months Rs 200 and beyond two months five times the first month late fee.

Earlier, the MC had no bylaws to govern the stray animals and compensate the victims. A few months ago, it had announced to compensate the stray dog bite victims with Rs 1,500, but no one came forward to claim it. The byelaws draft says the compensation should be settled by the joint commissioner or executive officer of the corporation concerned on application under Rule 12 of the Act. Owners will have to get their animals registered with the MC and put a tag around their necks. The animal to be registered will undergo a medical examination and the owner will have to produce the medical fitness certificate along with the registration application.

Mohali mayor Kulwant Singh said, "To control the stray animal menace, dog or cattle or even monkeys, we have drafted policies for registration of animals as well as compensation to victims. Some changes in the construction of cattle pound and its maintenance have also been proposed."

The byelaws say animals' owners or caretakers will not allow them to be at large at a public place without a muzzle and a leash. The byelaws will also defend the Prevention of Cruelty to the Animals Act, 1960, and the violating owner will be tried as per law and a complaint can be made to the MC.

Title: HC notice to railways on plea against surcharge levy
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

BENGALURU: The Karnataka high court on Thursday issued notices to the Railway Board and the South Western Railways on a petition seeking review of superfast surcharge being levied on passengers in Malgudi Express train .

Petitioner and Mysurubased advocate Mohammed Dastagir, in a public interest litigation claimed that as per the circular issued by the Railway Board on December 10, 2006, Malgudi Express — which runs from Mysuru to Yelehanka — is not designated as a superfast train and despite the same, the authorities are illegally collecting additional charges known as supplementary charges ranging from Rs 15 to Rs 75 from passengers.

A division bench headed by Chief Justice Abhay Shreeniwas Oka posted the petition to second week of February.

Title: Chennai City FC sell Pedro Manzi to Japanese club
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

CHENNAI: Defending champions Chennai City FC ( CCFC ) are all set to release their top striker Pedro Manzi in the January transfer window. It was learnt that the Spanish forward is likely to join a Japanese second division club. An official announcement will be made in the next couple of days.

A source confirmed the development even though he didn’t reveal the name of the Japanese club. “CCFC have come to an understanding with the Japanese club after they were offered a very good deal. Manzi is also okay with the move as it will present him with a fresh challenge. The decision was taken after consulting with CCFC coach Akbar Nawas,” the source told TOI on Thursday.

Manzi played a crucial role in Chennai City’s title triumph last season as he led the attack with flair. He was the joint top scorer with 21 goals and was a constant threat to opposition defence. Following his successful season, a lot of ISL clubs too had approached CCFC to buy the player.

The striker showed signs of his dazzling form this season too before getting injured last month with a side strain. “He is fit now and was ready to join practice. But the offer was too good to refuse,” the source said.

It was also told that the club isn’t seeking Manzi’s replacement right away. “The coach is in Singapore during the break. Once he returns, we will look for a replacement,” the source said.

CCFC are currently placed eighth in the I-League table with five points from five games. Their next game is away to Gokulam Kerala on January 9 while they start their AFC Cup campaign against Bahrain’s Al Riffa on January 14.

Title: Mahim beach to don a new look by April 2020
Content:
Mahim beach

BMC

St Michael’s Church

Mahim Reti Bunder

Mahim Causeway

The Mahim beach will have adequate open space for physical and cultural activities. The proposed plan includes setting up benches and importing sand

beautification and unclutter

Mahim fair and Ganpati visarjan

festivals and cultural programmes

The decrepit, which has long been a dumping ground, is primed for a facelift. Thehas joined hands with the locals to form a beach monitoring committee to oversee the work, which is likely to be completed by April 2020.The BMC’s jurisdiction over the Mahim beach covers 200 metres — fromtoat. The corporation is looking at a minimalist design for beautification — replete with bamboo installations.The part of the beach currently used as bamboo and timber marts will be fenced. The police housing wall running along the beach will be restored and the BMC will remove all kinds of encroachment, including illegal parking of trucks and water tankers. Toilets will be set up to prevent open-defecation.The beautification drive will also include creating pathways and an amphitheatre and the restoration of the Mahim fort.Kiran Dighavkar, assistant commissioner, G(north) ward, who had inspected the site, assured the residents that the beach would become a major tourist attraction.Dighavkar told Mirror, “We have approached Mumbai Port trust to convert it into a tourist spot. The beach offers an unfettered view of the Bandra-Worli Sealink. However, to sustain this project, we need citizen participation.”Architect Alan Abraham, who has designed the Mahim beach plan, told Mirror, “We have to work around a building in the middle of the beach, which belongs to the Coast Guard. Fencing the bamboo marts on the beach will restrict the spread of waste originating from these establishments. With the trucks and tankers gone, a lot of space will be freed up.”Abraham also said that a structural audit of the dilapidated police quarters along the beach will be conducted. “We want to build as little as possible to maintain the open space. However, cleaning up of the beach should actually begin at the very source of the problem, the Mithi River. The waste carried by the river washes up on the beach. Contractors must be hired for regular clean-up operations. Initially, we will import sand for the beach but once the area has been cleaned up, the existing sand will suffice,” he said.The beach will be dotted with benches and street lamps, he said. The BMC is also planning a little garden on the inside which will be completed by April. The Mahim fort, with its rich history, will be turned into a venue for a light-and-sound show, said the architect.Indranil Sengupta, a local resident whose clean-up drive on Mahim beach drew attention to the scale of the problem, will be part of the monitoring committee. “Finally, the BMC is convinced that this beach has potential and needs urgent attention,” he said.Rabia Tewari, another member of the committee, said, “The idea is to use sustainable material forthe space.”Both Sengupta and Tewari attributed the beautification efforts to the victory of a citizens’ movement that began two years ago.“We need to involve the Koli community living on the beach and keep in mind the round-the-year activities happening in the neighbourhood such as the,”said Tewari.Sengupta said the beach can also be used to host

Title: Ranji Trophy: Pitch threat looms after State Games opening ceremony
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

JAIPUR: With the opening ceremony, the fanfare over the first-ever State Games soon subsided, leaving a mammoth task at hand for the groundsmen to deliver a match-ready pitch for the Ranji Trophy match between Rajasthan and Andhra Pradesh beginning January 3 at the SMS Stadium.

For the inauguration at the stadium, the stage was set in the outfield where horse show and march past were also held with participating students being seated right in the middle of the field of play.

The clip-clop of horse hooves against the manicured outfield and the damage caused because of setting the stage will have the groundsmen on their toes till midnight in spine-chilling cold, TOI has learnt. The pitch, though it was covered, saw youngsters ambling and sitting over it. Experts are of the belief that it takes more time in winter to get the ground ready and the groundsmen require 10-12 days to get the pitch match-ready.

Sources told TOI that the pitch curator for the Ranji match — Sunil Chauhan from Himachal — in his report to the BCCI has informed them about the State Games’ opening ceremony being held at the ground on the eve of the match.

While the ground was at the receiving end, the Games have come as a welcome sign for the upcoming sportspersons of the state. Giving a new lease of life to sports culture in Rajasthan, the first-ever State Games flagged off with a decent crowd in attendance.

Title: This Indian startup gave as much as 270% salary hike
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

In Dream 11 , a gaming and sports startup based in India, employee can dream of getting a salary hike as high as by 270%. So, how does the startup operate? According to a report by Business Insider, one of the offbeat options the startup gives its employees is to set up their work targets themselves provided they reach the company target as a whole. All the teams in the startup, be they tech, marketing or product ones, are part of the “dream team” which is basically a pod structure where all the teams of the group work together in pods.

How the appraisals work

In Dream 11, the appraisals range from 15% to 270%. Employees are judged by their managers and coworkers both. Each employee is also judged by 25 coworkers each quarter based on parameters: data, user, performance, ownership and transparency. Dream 11 has got a total of 200 people working in the teams.The freedom to set your own goals and upto 270% salary hike comes with a caveat too. If the employee gets 7/10 on an average in the first quarter, he is given a warning. If he/she gets the same rating in the next two quarters, they are asked to leave the company. So, everything does not seem to be hunky-dory when the whole process of inducting an employee, the kind of result they turn in and the rating given by managers and coworkers is taken into account.

Harsh Jain, co-founder and CEO of Dream 11 told Business Insider in an interview: “We don’t believe in bell curve. The culture and philosophy of how we work is completely different. We don’t have things like OKR, KRA and KPI individually set across the organisation. We only have one thing, which is a team target. Either the entire company achieves the target or we don’t.”

“Everything is data driven for us. We do benchmarking of competitive companies which can poach from us. We see what they pay and then we pay at the 99th percentile,” Jain said in the interview.

Title: Display of fireworks at Mysore Palace leaves revelers spellbound
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

A display of fireworks at Mysore Palace on Wednesday for over half an hour left revellers spellbound. The display was supposed to be held at the stroke of midnight on December 31 to welcome the New Year , but was put off following the death of seer Vishwesha Theertha Swami.

People from different age groups took part on the final day of the winter festival to usher in the New Year. Before the fireworks were displayed, members of the police band, singer Harsha and a performance called Srinivasa Nritya Vaibhava by Sunitha Chadrakumar’s Sri Raghuleela Sangeetha Mandira, enthralled the revellers.

Veteran director and actress Vijayalakshmi Singh, who is currently seen in the serial Jothe Jotheyalli, was spotted at the event. She said, “I came to Mysuru to take the blessings of goddess Chamundeshwari on New Year's eve. One of my friends insisted that I attend the event and it turned out to be a fabulous experience. I enjoyed watching an array of events unfolding in front of the palace.”

Harshika Poonacha sets the stage on fire

Sandalwood actress Harshika Poonacha set the stage on fire with an electrifying performance at a resort in Mysuru to mark the New Year. The next day, the actress started the New Year by depositing money at a bank. “I wanted to start the New Year on a positive note. I thought saving money is the right way to bring in the New Year,” she said.

Title: Emulate your MG Road colleague, residents dare health inspectors
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

BENGALURU: Santosh Raj M, the Shanthalanagar junior health inspector who swung into action in the small hours of Wednesday to ensure residents in and around MG Road, Brigade Road and Church Street woke up to a spickand-span 2020 has turned a hero. Resident welfare associations (RWAs) elsewhere in the city are now throwing their respective health inspectors a challenge to fix their streets.

Raj and his staff had trooped on to the hub of New Year celebrations within hours of the revelry and cleared the three-km stretch of garbage. He had also dared The Ugly Indian (TUI), a volunteer group of anonymous citizens, to find black spots on the three roads. TUI was surprised as it couldn’t see even one.

Soon after TOI published the New Year feat of Raj and his colleagues on Thursday, impressed residents elsewhere in the city began challenging their health inspectors to follow suit. The feat and the challenge have been trending online.

Dr Hemant Kumar Agrawal, a resident of Domlur, said it’s very important to challenge BBMP officials to emulate their better-performing colleagues as at least that way they will start taking things seriously. “It should become a Bengaluru-wide challenge!” Agrawal said, adding: “Daily, we don’t come across such feats but it’s very important for BBMP to be challenged to see changes in the city.”

Priyanka Pillai, a resident of CV Raman Nagar , said all health inspectors should follow Raj and make him their role model. “If one health inspector could clean so much of trash, our health inspector can also take responsibility of the ward and do the same,” she said.

Somashekar S, junior health inspector of JP Park ward, said he’d be more than happy to accept the challenge. “I want to beautify black spots and ensure waste gets segregated. I would like to take up the challenge,” he said. Somashekar, however, added only health inspectors can’t be blamed for the state of affairs and people too need to do their bit to keep the city clean.

Harish P, a resident of Cubbonpet, had another point to make. “Firstly, we need to find out who our health inspector is and then think of challenging him. The Palike needs to hand over a list of health inspectors so that residents can bring problems to their notice,” he said.

Title: Dance Karnataka Dance Family war 2: DKD family war to air Grand Finale on January 5
Content: The latest edition of Dance Karnataka Dance family war is all set to witness the supreme winner of the season.The grand finale episode was shot last week and will go on-air on Sunday (January 5). Celebs like Rakshith Shetty, Shanvisri, Pramod Shetty and others shall also be a part of the finale as special guests.Aditi, Anup-Dimpana, Prekshith-Anvesha, Hiranmayi-Vivek and Tejas-Pranati are the finalists and one jodi among them will lift the trophy as the winner of the Dance Karnataka Dance family war season 2.The previous season of the dance reality show saw Deepika Das and Dheekshith Shetty of Naagini fame as the winners.Meanwhile, Dance Karnataka Dance Family war season 2 is one of the most loved reality shows of Kannada television. The show has been scoring well on the TRP charts as well.Family War Season 2 features actors from various fiction and non-fiction shows of the channel airing the dance show DKD family war Actors from different shows like Kamali, Gattimela, Brahmagantu, Jodi Hakki, Radha Kalyana, Mahadevi, Paaru, Jodi Hakki, Ughe Ughe Mahadeshwara, Sa Re Ga Ma Pa Season 15, Drama Juniors Season 3 and Comedy Kiladigalu Season 2 have participated in this popular show.Actress-turned-anchor Anushri host the show while Crazy Queen Rakshita, Vijay Raghavendra and composer Arjun Janya are the judges.

Title: Hunt for cyber crook Vikas proves pointless
Content:
CCB sleuths

cyber criminals

Bengaluru

QR codes

We will soon go to back to Deeg for another operation to nab this gang, this time with our DCP, and we will not inform the local Deeg police. –The senior official said

who went to track downto Rajasthan, return empty handedThe Central Crime Branch (CCB) sleuths trip to track down cyber-crooks to a remote village in Rajasthan, seemed like a waste of time. The CCB only managed to arrest one person, who only had connections with to the gang. The actual gang that operated from Deeg, in Bharatpur district of Rajasthan, is believed to have been tipped-off by the local police. CCB sleuths believe that the local police works hand-in-glove with the gang.This notorious gang is the brain behind the recent spurt in Cybercrimes inpertaining to. These codes, when scanned, debit money from the victim’s bank accounts linked with digital wallets, on their mobile phones. The gang members posed as army personnel who were getting transferred and won credibility with their victims. The scam is still active numerous people have fallen prey to the gang.A senior CCB official elaborated how the gang has at least a dozen members and with their illegal earnings, they have built houses in Deeg, worth Rs 60 lakh to 70 lakh.On December 23, a team of eight CCB members, along with two police inspectors, reached Deeg. The team members were tracking the phone numbers the culprits, who were using the number to make calls to potential victims. They would ask sellers to come near Command Hospital in Cambridge Layout, to show them the vehicles they have for sale. The CCB members posed as potential buyers and kept tracking the gang.Despite have narrowed the culprits to an area in Deeg, the CCB team did not manage to nab them. However, one Karan Singh was taken into custody. Singh is believed to be one of the beneficiaries in the scams and also gets commissions from the gang, said the officer on part of investigations.“We made a mistake by informing the local police about our operation,” said the official.The CCB team said that the local police had not helped them with their operations and instead acted as road blocks. First the CCB team was not allowed to enter the locality where the gang was believed to be hiding. Additionally, instead of offering the protection, the CCB team was also discouraged to chase the culprits, fearing the violent reaction from the locals. The Deeg police also promised that they would bring in the culprits and the CCB team was made to wait. When the Deeg police returned, they said the culprits had escaped. Seeing their absolute lack of support, the CCB suspects the Deeg police works in tandem with the cyber criminals.While applying for a transit warrant for the Karan Singh, the CCB teams complained to the magistrate about the lack of support from the Deeg police and also expressed their suspicion about the Deeg police’s intentions.The CCB team has brought Karan Singh to Bengaluru and are trying to establish his involvement in cases of QR code scams that have been registered across the city.“We will soon go to back to Deeg for another operation to nab this gang, this time with our DCP, and we will not inform the local Deeg police. Instead, we will straight be conducting a raid after informing the SP’s office,” said senior official.

Title: Congress not notified ahead of Soleimani killing: Senior US lawmaker
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

House Foreign Affairs Committee chairman, Eliot Engel. (Credits:AP)

WASHINGTON: US lawmakers were not told in advance of the attack ordered by President Donald Trump that killed a top Iranian military commander, a Senior House Democrat said late Thursday.

The strike conducted in Iraq against Iran 's Qasem Soleimani "went forward with no notification or consultation with Congress," House Foreign Affairs Committee chairman Eliot Engel said in a statement.

Soleimani was "the mastermind of immense violence" who has "the blood of Americans on his hands," the Democratic lawmaker said.

But "to push ahead with an action of this gravity without involving Congress raises serious legal problems and is an affront to Congress's powers as a coequal branch of government," Engel added.

Fee once paid will not be refunded under any circumstances.Women candidates and candidates belonging to Schedule Caste, Schedule Tribe, P.W.D. & Ex-serviceman category are exempted from paying Application fee.Ex-servicemen who have already secured employment in civil side under Central Government on regular basis after availing of the benefits of reservation given to ex-servicemen for their reemployment are NOT eligible for fee concession.Note: The candidates submitting their application online should pay the requisite fees only through SBI e-pay.
