Title: Parambrata plays a crime reporter in Anindya Bikas Datta’s ‘Shokuner Lov’
Content: An actor who loves to wear different hats, that’s what Parambrata Chatterjee is all about. He runs a small production unit, directs films but a bit choosy about his projects keeping a decent gap between directorial works. Being one of the most moving Bengali films last year, ‘Shonar Pahar’ directed by him earned accolades. At the same time, actor Parambrata is much in demand in Tollywood, in Bangladesh and even in Bollywood.2019 ended remarkably for Parambrata as his latest film ‘Sagardwipey Jwaker Dhan’ was lapped up by the audience and looks like 2020 will start with another interesting film where we would get to see the versatile actor as a crime reporter.Titled ‘ Shokuner Lov ’, the upcoming thriller directed by Anindya Bikas Datta sees a crime reporter risking his life to solve a 16-year-old murder. Can he overcome the challenges on the way? What will the outcome be? Sounds interesting, right!The cast of the film is also an ensemble one. While Param will be seen as a crime reporter, Joy Sengupta plays a police officer. ‘Ghawre Bairey Aaj’ fame Tuhina Das plays the female lead.‘Shokuner Lov’ will hit the theatres in February.

Title: Panchkula: Woman takes clerk job bait, duped of Rs 5.5 lakh
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

PANCHKULA: A woman was duped of Rs 5.5 lakh on the pretext of providing her a clerk's job in Haryana .

On the complaint of the victim's uncle, Dharambir Singh, police on Thursday registered a fraud case.

Dharambir, a resident of Jajwan village, Jind , said in his police complaint that his niece Shashi, a resident of Kaithal , went to Kurukshetra University to check her name in the 198-clerk posting list. She was disappointed on not finding her name. "A man standing there introduced himself as a member of the recruitment team of the university. He lured her by offering a clerk's job in the university. He sought Rs 10 lakh to provide her the job during the candidate document verification time. My niece handed over Rs 3 lakh to him near Mansa Devi Complex in Panchkula . He demanded more money to expedite the work. She then gave him Rs 2.5 lakh and the accused called her to Kurukshetra government hospital for a medical examination. He then asked her to wait for a call from the university," he added.

Shashi alleged that the accused never called her back and his phone number was now unavailable.

Police have registered a case.

Title: PhD in management most sought after at Bangalore University
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

BENGALURU: The management discipline is gaining popularity among students seeking admission to the doctor of philosophy ( PhD ) programme in non-engineering subjects at Bangalore University this year.

According to BU officials, 361 candidates have applied for 12 slots of PhD in management (part of the commerce faculty), the highest among all subjects. Though the subject has always been popular among commerce and engineering students, a shift from IT to teaching jobs has led to the increase in PhD applications. While some hoping to get an assistant professor’s job write the National Eligibility Test and apply for the doctorate, others take the entrance exam to land the PhD seat.

The university received 3,738 applications this year for 482 PhD slots, more than a 100% jump from 2017 (the last time applications were invited), and 1,600-odd students applied. After management, Kannada received the second-highest applications

(243), followed by mathematics (127). The entrance exam held on December 29 was attended by 2,822 students across five centres in the city.

Experts say the increase in PhD aspirants reflects the waning popularity of engineering subjects and a growing affinity to teaching jobs, which are seen as better paying and more respectable.

Prof C Shivaraju, registrar of evaluation, BU, said the rise in number of applicants for management and commerce PhDs is being witnessed for some time now. “Besides showing a growing preference for teaching, it depicts a greater attraction to management courses. Students see the job of an assistant professor in management as more glamorous than any other subject,” he said.

BU has received 822 applications for 218 PhD vacancies in five engineering subjects. However, officials said the number has been declining.

Title: Shantilal and Rajatava in a high-drama Tolly thriller
Content: The Bengali audience has always liked thrillers on the big screen. And Arghadeep Chatterjee’s Mukhosh is the latest whodunit on the block that’s sure to pique the interest of thriller lovers. The SSG Entertainment film, which stars Rajatava Dutta Paayel Sarkar and others, is releasing in theatres today. It will also see an intense drama unfold between veteran actors Rajatava and Shantilal.Elaborating on his character, Rajatava said, “I play the role of an industrialist, who gets an election ticket and is likely to win the seat. But my campaign is embroiled in scandal after a young woman alleges that I have abducted her sister (my wife). Shantilal is the cop and there are very interesting dialogues between his character and mine. In fact, the crew members also enjoyed shooting our scenes.”On the other hand, Shantilal’s character has a lot of layers. “I play an efficient officer-in-charge of a police station. His seniors trust him and he takes up the case of a young woman who brings an allegation against an influential person (Rajatava). But my character has a history. As for working with Argha, I found him very organised. I really liked working with him,” the actor told us.Rajatava, too, said he enjoyed working with Arghadeep. “He has clarity and he is very intelligent. Argha and DoP Madhura Palit are young and yet, they are so impressive with their work. Since Argha has a knack for music, he also took great care with the songs, which have been composed by Nilanjan Ghosh,” the actor said.

Title: 'Indian archers can win Tokyo medal'
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Archer Akash Malik battled a lot of financial hurdles to continue in the sport

CHANDIGARH: Akash Malik, who made history after clinching India's first silver in archery at the Youth Olympics in 2018, said he is sure that the Indian archery contingent will win a medal at the 2020 Tokyo Olympics.

Malik, who hails from Hisar in Haryana , said that the third edition of the Khelo India Youth Games will serve as good preparation for the Indian archery Olympic team trials. The Khelo India Youth Games will be held from January 10 to 22 in Guwahati.

"I am sure the Indian archery contingent will win a medal at the 2020 Tokyo Olympics. The players for the team will be selected through trials, which will be held early in 2020. The third edition of the Khelo India Youth Games in Guwahati will serve as a brilliant preparation for the trials," said Malik.

The promising archer had won gold (men's team event) at Asia Cup Stage-I, silver (mixed team event) and bronze (men's team event) in Asia Cup Stage-II in 2018. Malik expressed that he had a great experience while participating in the first edition of the Khelo India Games in 2018.

"I won bronze in the first edition of the Khelo India Games. I had a great time at the tournament. The competition is a great platform for the young athletes to learn different skills. The athletes get a lot of confidence while playing in the Khelo India Games environment," said Malik.

The 17-year-old, who is a farm labourer's son, developed an interest in archery after watching his friends practice the sport in 2016.

"I took up archery in 2016. I saw my friends practice archery in Hisar and then gradually I developed an interest in the sport," said Malik.

The archer faced financial difficulties to acquire equipments at the beginning of his career. However, the Olympic Gold Quest spotted Malik in 2017 and thereafter the organisation has been providing equipment to the young archer.

"Initially, I faced financial difficulties to acquire equipment because archery is an expensive sport. As I progressed in my career, I received financial assistance from Sports Authority of India, Khelo India Games and the Olympic Gold Quest. I had gone for the Asian Championships trials in 2017 and that's where I was spotted by the Olympic Gold Quest. Thereafter, the organisation started providing archery equipment to me," said Malik.

Title: Bhumi Pednekar reunites with Ayushmann Khurrana for 'Shubh Mangal Zyada Saavdhan'
Content: While speaking to media earlier, Bhumi Pednekar had said that after working with Aanand L Rai on ' Shubh Mangal Saavdhan ', she knew that she would reunite with the filmmaker for another film. “Our sensibilities match and I look up to him. Maybe they can make a sequel to 'Shubh Mangal...' so Ayushmann and I can complete a hattrick,” she had said. Now, we have learnt that the 30-year-old actress is set to feature in 'Shubh Mangal Zyada Saavdhan', which revolves around a same-sex couple and is produced by Bhushan Kumar and Aanand.Confirming the news, Aanand said, “Bhumi is a part of 'Shubh Mangal Saavdhan' family and we couldn’t imagine making 'Shubh Mangal Zyada Saavdhan' without her. She has a special appearance in the narrative and we are extremely happy to have her on board.”This will be Ayushmann and Bhumi’s fourth film together in five years. The duo first shared screen space in the 2015 romcom, ' Dum Laga Ke Haisha ', which was followed by 'Shubh Mangal Saavdhan' and 'Bala' in 2019. “Bhumi’s association adds value to the storyline. She is an amazing actor and I am glad she is a part of our film,” Bhushan added.Written and directed by Hitesh Kewalya, the sequel also marks the reunion of Neena Gupta and Gajraj Rao after the National Award winning social-comedy, 'Badhaai Ho', in which they played parents to Ayushmann. Bhumi shot for her part over a two-day schedule in Varanasi in November. Bhumi had said earlier (February 2019) that Ayushmann and she are not just co-stars but also good friends and they love working together owing to the comfort level between them. According to a source close to the development, Bhumi’s part had been in the script right from the beginning.Like her co-star, Bhumi, too, had a busy 2019 with four releases, beginning with Abhishek Chaubey ’s 'Sonchiriya', followed by 'Saand Ki Aankh', 'Bala' and ' Pati Patni Aur Woh '. This year, she will be seen in three films 'Durgavati', 'Bhoot –Part One: The Haunted Ship' and 'Dolly Kitty Aur Woh Chamakte Sitare'. The actress is also scheduled to shoot for Karan Johar ’s multi-starrer period-drama 'Takht' this year.

Title: South Kolkata Nrityangan stages annual dance program
Content: South Kolkata Nrityangan, a dance institution recently staged its annual dance program at Rabindra Sadan in Kolkata. Famous dancer Thankumuni Kutti and founder of South Kolkata Nrityangan Jhinuk Mukherjee Sinha inaugurated the dance event. Several renowned personalities from the city were facilitated at the event including head of ICCR Gautam De, dancer and actress Malabika Sen, dancer Sangeeta Aich Bhowmick, dancer Kohinoor Sen Barat and secretary of Kallamandalam Somnath Kutty. Jhinuk Mukherjee Sinha enthralled the audience with her Bharatnatyam (Anada Natana Ganapatim) performance to make the evening more exciting. Then a dance performance from 150 students of South Kolkata Nrityangan institute received accolades.The performances included Pushpanjali, Natyanjali, Sree Ganapati, Jyoti Saram, Mohona Murlidhar sloka to name a few. Last part of this dance drama was inspired by the Rabindra Sangeet 'Shanti r Barta'. While Rohini Roy Chowdhury, Sonak Chattopadhyay and students performed music, Subhadeep Chakraborty presented the script. Music was arranged by Subrata Mukherjee. The dance drama concept and direction was by Jhinuk Mukherjee Sinha who also performed in it.

Title: Patiala cops seize 25,000 banned tablets, 32 boxes of liquor
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

The boxes of illegal liquor were being carried by a pick-up van

PATIALA: In separate cases, the city police have seized 25,000 banned tablets and confiscated 32 boxes of illegal liquor.

The cops said that 25,000 tablets of tramadol were seized during a raid in Samana on Wednesday late evening. The tablets, which are banned to be sold at medical shops, were being sold openly.

The cops said that these opioid tablets are to cure drug addicts.

"The tablets were seized from a car near Dhaintal bus stand during a routine checking. As many as 50 packets with 500 tablets in each packet were confiscated. The accused travelling in the car were asked to stop for checking at a police barrier near Dhaintal bus stand. The accused abandoned the car and managed to escape," the cops said.

"The tablets were lying beneath the seats of the car," said Sarabjit Singh who is posted at Sadar Samana police station. He said the accused will be nabbed soon as the raids were on to nab him.

Last month the city police had seized 49,000 Tramadol tablets and arrested three persons.

Meanwhile, City Samana police have recovered 32 boxes of illegal liquor that were being carried in a pick-up van. Similarly, Shambu police have confiscated 24 bottles of illegal liquor; Ghagga police seized 36 bottles of illegal liquor and Patran police recovered 80 litres of lahan and six illegal liquor bottles in two separate raids.

Title: Medical & dental college fees likely to shoot up for next 3 years
Content:
Illustration used for representational purpose

HYDERABAD: Those set to pursue medical and dental courses from 2020-21 will have to pay heftier fees as Telangana State Admission and Fee Regulatory Committee ( TAFRC ) is all set to revise the fee structure for the next three years.In 2016, the state government reviewed the fee structure for all medical and dental courses, including ayurveda and nursing institutions. Last year, private medical colleges sought a five per cent hike in fees citing inflation and rise in teachers’ salaries. Although the government revised the fee structure for engineering, management and other professional courses, it did not revise the fee structure for medical and dental courses.Now, Telangana State Admission and Fee Regulatory Committee has taken up the task of reviewing and determining fee structures for all medical and dental programmes. Online applications for medical stream shall be open for college managements on January 10, 2020.“While the government revised the fee structure for undergraduate courses, it failed to do so for post graduate medical and dental courses. Now, based on the financial statements of each college, TAFRC will fix fees for all courses, including super-speciality programmes,” said Laxman Rao, president of Telangana Private Medical and Dental Colleges Association. According to experts, the fee structure is likely to be revised by five to 10 per cent depending on the audited financial statements of colleges.As per notification issued by TAFRC recently, all private unaided professional colleges have been asked to submit their audited financial statements for the last three years to fix fee structure for block period 2020-2023. The last date for submission of online application along with audited financial statements is January 31. “Colleges that do not submit fee proposals or are unresponsive and do not submit relevant data shall not be permitted to collect any fee for the block period 2020-2023,” according to the notification.There are 21 private medical colleges and 11 private dental colleges in the state. The existing fee structure for MBBS in private non-minority colleges is ?11.55 lakh for B category seats and ?23.1 lakh for C category (NRI seats).

Title: Janhvi Kapoor and Rajkummar Rao's next 'Roohi Afza' witnesses another title change? Read details
Content: Kangana Ranaut fans were in for a surprise on August 21 as the actress announced her arrival on Twitter. And within 10 days of her debut on the micro-blogging site, Kangana has clocked 1 million followers. In an exclusive interaction with ETimes, Kangana Ranaut opened up about her tryst with social media, how she deals with trolls and all things Twitter. Excerpts from the interview:

Title: Lucknow Municipal Corporation stares at Rs 14 crore fine for flouting green norms
Content:
Representative image

TimesView The annual Swachh survey is approaching but LMC is not prepared for it. City’s garbage management is in a dismal state. The issue of defunct machines in waste treatment plants is an old one and should have ideally been resolved by now. In such a situation, anybody can guess what rank the city would get in the survey. However, there is still a chance. A lot of ground can still be gained before survey begins on January 20 if the LMC and its private partner, instead of blame game, start working together on war footing to improve garbage collection and treatment.

LUCKNOW: Lucknow Municipal Corporation will have to pay a penalty of Rs 14.40 crore for environmental damage if it fails to revive the Shivri solid waste treatment plant in the next 15 days.The warning has been issued by Uttar Pradesh Pollution Control Board (UPPCB) which has served a showcause notice on the civic body.Shivri plant, located on Kanpur Road, has been lying defunct for the past two months. It has led to accumulation of 2.5 lakh metric tonne waste near the plant.In its notice, UPPCB said the accumulated untreated waste near the plant is leading to air and water pollution in the vicinity, affecting about 300 residents of local village Lokhriya Kheda. LMC also has to reply to the notice within 15 days. Officials of Eco-Green, the company hired by LMC for running Shivri plant, said two of the three machines getting regularly stopped due to technical glitches but they do not have money for repair because LMC is yet to clear a major chunk of company’s arrears. Confirming the UPPCB notice, mayor Sanyukta Bhatia said orders have already been issued to Eco-Green to start the three machines of the shivri treatment plant by January 8. An Ecogreen official said, “LMC had assured us to provide money for the repair of machines, but we have not received a single penny yet. As soon as we get money, machines will get repaired.”

Title: Gippy Grewal ft. Amanda Cerny’s ‘Where Baby Where’ is out now
Content: The much awaited song of Gippy Grewal ‘Where Baby Where’ has finally made it to the music charts. Featuring the American beauty Amanda Cerny, the song is a flirtatious number that is best to be enjoyed on high volume.Coming to the credits of the track, sung by Gippy, it has been written and composed by Jaani. Further, Sukhe Muzical Doctorz gave music to it while Baljit Singh Deo worked on the video of the song.Check out the song here:Meanwhile, on the cinematic front, Gippy Grewal will be hitting the big screens next month with ‘Ik Sandhu Hunda Si’. Starring him and Bollywood fame Neha Sharma in the lead, the movie is one of the much anticipated Punjabi films of the year. Further, directed by Rakesh Mehta, the movie also has Roshan Prince, Babbal Rai and Dheeraj Kumar in key roles.

Title: Include Kurnool, Mantralayam in Karnataka: Former TDP MLA
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

RAICHUR: A former TDP legislator on Thursday urged the Union government to include Kurnool and temple town Mantralayam, which share border with Ballari and Raichur districts, in Karnataka since a majority of its population primarily speaks Kannada.

Palakurthi Tikkareddy is from Yemmiganur in Kurnool district and lost the 2019 assembly elections from Mantralayam to Y Balanagireddy of YSRCP (Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress Party).

The former MLA told reporters in Mantralayam, abode of Raghavendraswamy Mutt that attracts thousands of devotees mainly from Karnataka, that people from Kurnool district are Kannadigas at heart and most settlers were from neighbouring Ballari, Raichur and Kalaburgai districts.

The demand comes weeks after Maharashtra chief minister Uddhav Thackery described Belagavi district as ‘Karnataka-occupied Maharashtra’, raising hackles from Karnataka. Similarly, Kasargod, a border district in Kerala, has language affinities with Karnataka, and erupts as an emotive issue every few years.

The former TDP MLA said it was “unfortunate” that Kurnool and Mantralayam were awarded to Andhra Pradesh during the reorganization of states on linguistic lines in 1956.

Palakurthi expressed apprehensions that a panel of experts formed by Andhra Pradesh chief minister YS Jagan Mohan Reddy would further alienate people of Kurnool because most of the administrative apparatus will shift farther afield to Amaravati and Visakhapatnam. “The only institution closer home will be the high court at Kurnool,” he said, justifying his demand for inclusion of Kurnool and Mantralayam in Karnataka.

Visakhapatnam and Amaravati are farther than Bengaluru in terms of distance. “Bengaluru is less than six hours by road from here, and this provides easy and faster access to administrative headquarters,” he said. He accused the Andhra Pradesh government of ignoring the development of Mantralayam.

Title: Ashok Saraf and Padmini Kolhapure starrer 'Prawaas' trailer to release on THIS date
Content: Here's a piece of good news coming in for all the fans of the Ashok Saraf and Padmini Kolhapure starrer 'Prawaas' who were eagerly waiting for the announcement of the trailer release. The actor-director Shashank Udapurkar who is all set to make his directorial debut with 'Prawaas'. The film is already in news for its teaser and poster from the film.The makers of the film have decided to release the trailer of 'Prawaas' on January 7. Recently, the filmmaker shared the new catchy poster from the film and also revealed that the trailer of his upcoming film 'Prawaas'.While speaking about his role, Ashok said, "Shashank Udapurkar came to me with the 'Prawaas' script and it's a unique story. I am not allowed to disclose anything related to the plot of the film, but, I can say, that I am playing a lead role in the film and its unique."The Shashank directorial is produced under the banner of Om Chhangani Films and features Vikram Gokhale Rajat Kapoor , Shashank Udapurkar and others. The film is slated to release on January 31st, 2020.

Title: Goods trains outnumbered passenger carriages in Chandigarh
Content:
The old, exposed platform

By: TP SinghTwo decades ago, three operational platforms of the Chandigarh railway station would see a much larger number of goods trains than passenger trains. Looking back at those days, now I wonder how we would manage the flow. Interestingly, the platforms would be crowded with businessmen, who would be there not to board the train but to receive their merchandise for further supply in the region.Those days, the platforms of the railway station would also be bustling with coolies and representatives from companies, which not only called materials for construction but also perishable products. It was gratifying as the then yardmaster to see a goods train coach packed with perishable stuff being unloaded at my station that would cater to the needs of not only the city but the entire region.I used to discuss with my colleagues how this “goods train handling terminal” was popular with iron and steel producers for iron, cement and coal supply. The station would have two freight lines, as the movement of goods trains was quite high. But, gradually it declined and at present, we have only one freight line for the goods trains.Now there are 35 passenger trains and 30 for goods, while 20 years ago, there were only five trains for passengers, and 10 goods trains in Chandigarh. The railways would book a single coach instead of full rake to deliver the products, due to which the footfall of business community was greater.For the convenience of station superintendent (SS), power cabin and panel centre were located inside the station.

Title: Jadavpur University right-wing students allege discrimination
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Kabir Suman attended a rally by Jatiya Bangla Sammelan on Thursday to protest against an alleged discriminator... Read More

KOLKATA: Students at Jadavpur University , who are either members of ABVP, a saffron students’ wing, or support BJP, have alleged discrimination by other students. They claimed they were bullied and boycotted when they went to attend classes.

Suranjan Sarkar, a firstyear student of mass communication at the university and assistant secretary of ABVP’s state unit, was allegedly boycotted by his classmates after the protest on campus during Babul Supriyo’s visit a few month’s ago and the vandalism that followed. “Whenever I tried to attend classes, they would walk out. Posters were put up, telling students not to attend any class with me. Even if I wanted to sit on the back bench, they would walk out. I was surprised at such behaviour when it came to studies. They might not agree with my political ideology, but why should they stop me from attending a lecture?” Sarkar said.

Suman Das, secretary of the ABVP’s Jadavpur unit , on Thursday claimed some of their members faced similar situations when their political ideologies came in conflict with others. Some were bullied when talking to their peer groups, while others were allegedly abused on the university campus. “They would be boycotted from classes or bullied outside. We have given a letter to the university’s vice-chancellor, Suranjan Das, with details of the problems the students have been going through,” said Das, who is pursuing PhD at the university. He alleged he had been subject to abuses owing to his political allegiance and that many of the targeted students kept quiet because they were afraid of a backlash from the students’ union.

The VC, however, denied having received any such communication from any student or students’ bodies. “I did not receive any such complaint till Thursday afternoon,” Suranjan Das said.

“We are not against any student. But if a student supports CAA and NRC and resorts to vandalism on the campus, his fellow students might not be able to accept his ways,” said Somasree Chowdhury, chairperson of Arts Faculty Students’ Union.

Rajya Sabha MP Swapan Dasgupta on Wednesday tweeted about a Jadavpur University student who was not allowed to attend classes by his classmates who called him a fascist. “He said that his fellow students would not allow him to attend class because he could not be in the same class as a ‘fascist’. His professors told him that in endorsing BJP, he was being wilfully ‘provocative’,” Dasgupta tweeted.

Members of the Jadavpur University Teachers’ Association (JUTA), however, refuted the allegation. “We will not allow a student to be barred from a class. Students can have their own ideologies and can have issues with each other, but that can never affect his academic career. Jadavpur University has always accommodated diverse political ideologies. Faculty members will not discriminate against a student owing to his political leanings,” said Partha Pratim Roy, general secretary of the JUTA.

Title: Telangana Police to tap into artificial intelligence for crowd management
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Illustration used for representational purpose

HYDERABAD: Telangana police ’s intelligence wing on Thursday tied up with a Gurugram-based start-up to provide solutions for crowd management, especially in mega events like Sammakka-Saralamma Jatara at Medaram, considered one of the biggest tribal fairs in Asia. Medaram Jatara will be held in February. The tie-up was announced by Telangana intelligence officers and representatives of start-up Awiros in the presence of information technology minister KT Rama Rao on Thursday during an event held to declare 2020 as the Year of Artificial Intelligence (AI) for Telangana. The start-up would develop an application, which by using CCTV footage, would ascertain density of crowd at different public events. The application would be developed by using AI. Based on the analysis of the population gathering, the security personnel would get alerts so that they could take right decisions to manage the crowd in a better manner and avoid stampede and other chaotic situations. “This application will help us in estimation of size of the crowd. For example, in events like Medaram Jatara, Kumbh Mela and other similar mega crowd-gathering events. It will help us know how the crowd behaves,’’ intelligence officials said. The application was tested during the recently-held India-West Indies T20 International (T20I) at Rajiv Gandhi International Cricket Stadium at Uppal.

Title: Weight Loss: Let 2020 be the year of less sugar
Content: We all feel that we are not having enough sugar, barring the last week of the year, because heck, we were celebrating. But ask yourself in all genuinity, is that actually true? There is added sugar in your everyday packaged and processed foods, which goes uncounted. Moreover, cutting down on it does not require you to deprive yourself or go to extreme diets.Not many know that excess sugar in the diet activates the ageing process. And trust us when we say, it's harmful effects can be as bad as smoking and drinking alcohol.Coming to sugar, you may argue that even fruits have fructose (which is a form of sugar), but your body can process fructose that is consumed as part of a whole fruit. This is because along with natural sugar, your body is also getting fiber, which slows down the absorption of sugar in the bloodstream.However, what you eat and drink in the form of processed foods and packaged foods has sugar that is highly processed and is devoid of dietary fiber. There is good evidence that this fructose actually leads to addiction, which is harmful in the long run.To cut down sugar from your diet, it is best to cut out sugars in all forms for a minimum of 7 days. A lot of people felt that when they quit sugar for 7 days at a stretch, they were able to resist it better than before. And if you actually crave for it too much, pick a whole fruit instead of picking a processed sugar variety. Also start reading food labels while picking packaged foods. Also, do not be fooled by terms like honey, nectar, brown sugar or beet sugar, they all are added sugars, which should be avoided.Also, this by no standards mean you are eliminating sugar from your body, instead you are now getting it from healthy sources. If you can stick to this plan, cravings will fade sooner than you will ever know... And whenever you decide to add back some amount of sugar, do it mindfully so it does not sabotage your weight loss goals.

Title: Class 5 dropout clears IQ test for Class 9, awaits UP Board’s nod for admission
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Khushboo Verma

LUCKNOW: An 11-year-old girl, who had to drop out of school in Class 5 last year, has cleared the IQ test for Class 9 conducted by the state secondary education board. If all goes well, she will get direct admission to the ninth grade in a government school in the next academic session.

Daughter of a mason, Khushboo Verma couldn’t continue her studies at a private school in Aishbagh after completing Class 4 in 2018 owing to financial constraints. But, her knack for learning kept her going. She coached at home under her uncle, Ram Kumar Verma, who teaches at a government college. Within a year, the little girl had every lesson till Class 9 on her fingertips.

“It was her keen interest in studying further that made me take out time from my busy schedule to teach her. Since she is well-versed in the ninth grade syllabus, I wrote several letters to UB Secondary Education Board (UPSEB) so that she could get admitted to Class IX at least in a government school,” said Ram Kumar.

UPSEB officials agreed to test her on her uncle’s request and it goes without saying that she came out with flying colours. District inspector of schools, Lucknow, Mukesh Kumar Singh said, “Following a directive from UPSEB, we tested her English, Hindi and science skills, among others. She scored well. Her report card has been sent to the board.”

Khushboo reminds one of child prodigy Sushma Verma, who was only five when she enrolled in Class 9. She had cleared Class XII board exams at the age of 10 and bagged a place in the Limca Book of Records for being the youngest to finish school in Lucknow.

Sushma completed BSc with zoology and botany from CMS Girls’ Degree College, under Lucknow University, and then joined an MSc course in microbiology at Babasaheb Bhimrao Ambedkar University (BBAU). She emerged the topper and was awarded a medal by the PM in 2016. She is currently pursuing her PhD in environmental microbiology at BBAU.

Title: Lucknow University paper leak: Accused woman’s voice in tapes, says STF
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Lucknow University

LUCKNOW: The female voice in the leaked audio clips that exposed the LLB paper leak in Lucknow University matched that of the woman accused in the case, UP STF stated in its probe report.

In its 35-page inquiry report submitted to the UP government on Wednesday evening, the Special Task Force said the accused woman student’s voice sample matched with the female voice in the audio clips during forensic tests. The state home department will decide on further action based on STF report.

The report further confirmed that a male voice heard in the audio clips was of then officiating LU vice-chancellor SK Shukla, but he was not heard leaking any law question in the clips. “We recorded statements of 35 persons, including the accused woman student, LU law professors, then VC, examination department officers and owner of the private college where the accused woman student appeared in the exam,” officiating SSP STF Vishal Vikram Singh told TOI.

The two accused law teachers admitted during probe that the male voices heard in the clips were theirs, but claimed they were only explaining the syllabus and not dictating questions which were supposed to come in the LLB semester III exam, said DySP, Special Task Force, PK Mishra. The accused woman student had denied that the female voice was hers, he added.

Also, as reported by TOI earlier, STF in its report stated that 50% of the questions dictated by two law teachers to the student in the clips appeared in the LU law examinations.

On December 11, six audio clips of telephonic conversations between a woman LLB student and two LU teachers and others went viral on social media. The accused woman, who is the manager of a private hospital, is a law student (semester III) in a private college in Lucknow.

In one clip, she was heard asking then LU VC (SK Shukla) to help her in law examinations, while in another clip she requested the owner of a private college, where she had to appear for the law paper, to make separate seating arrangement during examination. In other clips, she was heard taking down questions from two LU law teachers.

Title: Revenue secretary to hold meeting on streamlining GST system
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Ajay Bhushan Pandey (File photo)

NEW DELHI: Revenue secretary Ajay Bhushan Pandey will hold a day-long meeting on January 7 with tax commissioners to discuss ways for streamlining the GST system and plugging leakages due to fraud.

Besides, sources said, this meeting with commissioners of state tax and chief commissioners of central tax will also deliberate on enhancing GST compliance by plugging loopholes and discourage tax evaders, those gaming or misusing the system.

The meeting assumes significance as the GST Council in its last meeting held on December 18 wanted a detailed study on these issues before taking any call on rate hike on items.

Meanwhile, in an encouraging sign, the GST collection for December came in at around Rs 1.03 lakh crore. Sources said, this multi-faceted brainstorming meeting is being organised with the purpose of curbing fraud and evasion, checking fake or huge input tax credit claims, seeking bank account details of businesses to tally with their filings, misuse of refund and sharing best practices in revenue augmentation.

Title: Priyamani roped in for Asuran remake?
Content: The industry is abuzz with the news that Priyamani has been roped in for the Telugu remake of Asuran . She is expected to play the role Manju Warrier played in the original. Earlier, it was reported that Shriya Saran might do the role. Tollywood star Venkatesh, on the other hand, will play Dhanush 's character in the remake. The Tamil original was directed by Vetri Maaran . The film was based on the novel, Vekkai by Poomani.Asuran received rave reviews from the critics and the audience alike. The duo of Vetri Maaran and Dhanush had teamed up for the fourth time after Polladhavan, Aadukalam and Vada Chennai. Priyamani was last seen in the bilingual film, Charulatha .She recently made her debut on the digital space. Priyamani was launched in the industry by veteran director Bharathiraja in Kangalal Kaidhu Sei (2004).

Title: Showers start, temperature drop likely after Sunday in Kolkata
Content:
A thick fog cover on the Hooghly on Thursday

KOLKATA: Sporadic showers hit pockets of Kolkata on Thursday evening as the minimum temperature rose to 15.3°C. The met office forecast that the city could witness rain from Thursday night, which is likely to continue on Friday. The weathermen added that the mercury is likely to drop on Monday.The Met office has forecast light to moderate rain on Friday. Even though Kolkata is likely to remain cloudy on Saturday as well, chances of rain were slim. However, a temperature drop is imminent on Monday, according to Met officials.A cyclonic circulation moved towards Chhattisgarh from Madhya Pradesh on Thursday, generating clouds that moved into south Bengal. While Kolkata remained sunny till afternoon, clouds started gathering early in the evening. “We expect the drizzles to continue on Friday. There could be recurring spells of rain, though, the showers are unlikely to be heavy. Due to the cloud cover, the minimum temperature went over 15°C and it will remain so till the clouds recede,” said Regional Meteorological Centre (RMC) director GK Das. The maximum temperature, too, climbed to 25.5°C on Thursday. This may slide by a couple of notches on Friday, Das added.Once the cloud cover recedes, the mercury is likely to drop again, weathermen said. A drop of 2-3°C has been forecast from Monday and it could persist. Meanwhile, the circulation — that was formed by a western disturbance and fed by moisture from the Bay of Bengal — travelled closer to Bengal on Thursday. “It has started having an impact on the weather in Kolkata and south Bengal. It was evident from the rising mercury. It will trigger further rain on Friday, but will lose strength by Saturday,” said a weather scientist.The western districts of the state — Bankura, Purulia and Birbhum — are set to receive heavier showers. Thunderstorms have been forecast in some parts of south Bengal as well.

Title: Telangana: Man sets wife, daughter ablaze before killing self
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Illustration used for representational purpose

HYDERABAD: Suspecting his wife’s fidelity, a 45-year-old farmer set her ablaze along with their 17-year-old daughter before setting himself on fire in Chinnambavi mandal in Wanaparthy district on Wednesday night.

The accused and his daughter succumbed to burns while his wife is battling for her life in Mahbubnagar government hospital with 90% burns. The accused’s wife is very critical.

“We recorded her dying declaration. She said the accused has been harassing her for the last 15 years, suspecting her character,” police said.

Title: Ray’s alter ego Shonku now has his own calendar
Content: After the big screen debut with ‘Professor Shonku O El Dorado ’, we now get to see a calendar on Satyajit Ray 's iconic character Shonku. This calendar titled 'The Global Footprints of Professor Shonku ' – along with short descriptions and Satyajit Ray's own illustrations, explores Professor Shonku's adventures not only in his hometown Giridih but also around the world like the Amazon rainforests, Congo, Egypt, Tibet, Germany, Switzerland, Austria, Norway, Bolivia, Chile, the Sahara and Taklamakan deserts, and even some mysterious, imaginary islands."Trilokeshwar Shonku, popularly known as Professor Shonku, is a genius and a scientist-inventor. He lives a humble life in Giridih – a small town in Jharkhand – with his servant Prahlad, and his pet cat Newton. Shonku is a true polyglot – he is fluent in 69 languages including the ancient Egyptian hieroglyphs. Every day, he goes for a morning walk on the banks of the river Ushri and keeps a diary with his Waterman fountain pen. These are the characteristics we have tried to imbibe in the illustrations," said Sandip Ray , the director of the first Shonku film at the calendar launch event.The calendar is not only a collector's item but also has illustrations by Satyajit Ray, curated by Sandip and designed by Pinaki De. "Both Feluda and Shonku are alter egos of Satyajit Ray himself. When he was writing about Feluda's travels, he had actually been to those places. But in case of Shonku he wrote about all the places he wanted to go to, but couldn't in his lifetime," explained Sandip Ray while speaking about the travels of Shonku.

Title: 18,000 to benefit from Rs 10 meal across Maharashtra daily in first phase
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Governor B S Koshyari visited Uddhav Thackeray’s residence, Matoshree, on Thursday evening for a dinner hosted... Read More

MUMBAI: The MVA government will set up nutritious meal centres at all district headquarters and several public places to provide a total of 18,000 Shiv Bhojan Thalis to the poor at Rs 10 in the first phase. Those working in state establishments will not be entitled to the subsidised meal, according to a government resolution (GR) issued on Thursday.

The government has allotted Rs 6.4 crore for the first phase, which will be a pilot for three months. In Mumbai, 450 subsidised thalis will be served in the island city and up to 1,500 in the suburbs, according to the food and civil supplies department.

The scheme, which was promised by Shiv Sena as part of its poll manifesto, will be launched after contracts are awarded for the centres. Besides collector offices, centres will also be set up at district hospitals, bus stations, railway stations and government offices which are visited by the poor or labourers.

Eateries such as Khanaval (home-made food eateries), women self-help groups, bhojanalayas, restaurants and NGOs that run eateries will be eligible to set up the centres. They should have seating arrangement for at least 25 people and would serve 75 to 150 thalis a day. Committees to be set up under collectors at district level and under tehsildars at taluka level will select the eateries.

The government has pegged the cost of the thalis at Rs 50 in urban areas and Rs 35 cost in rural areas. So to provide meal to the poor at Rs 10, the state will reimburse contractors Rs 40 per plate in urban areas and Rs 25 in rural areas.

Title: CAT result 2019: CAT Score Card released at iimcat.ac.in; download here
Content: NEW DELHI: The Indian Institutes of Management on Saturday released the computer-based Common Admission Test 2019 (CAT 2019) Score Card.The CAT Score Card 2019 has been released on the official website — https://iimcat.ac.in/.The IIMs had conducted the CAT 2019 examination on Sunday, November 24, 2019 in two sessions. The candidates who appeared for examination can check their CAT 2019 scorecards on the official website of the CAT - iimcat.ac.in.The candidates may also be intimated individually by SMS. A notification available on the official website of the CAT states, "The CAT results are likely be declared by the second week of January, 2020. The CAT 2019 score is valid only till December 31, 2020 and will accordingly be accessible on the website. Thereafter, no queries related to the issuance of CAT 2019 scorecards will be entertained."The candidates can follow the steps provided below to check and download their CAT 2019 result and scorecard:1) Open the official website of the CAT - iimcat.ac.in2) Login using your username and password3) After login, click on download result/scorecard4) Take a print out of the same for future referenceThe candidates are advised to keep checking the official website of the CAT to get latest update on the result declaration and further details.

Title: Kabir Khan on recreating Kapil Dev's iconic knock for ''83': For the ground officials of Tunbridge Wells, it was like the return of their hero
Content: In June 2019, Kabir Khan started a marathon schedule of his upcoming directorial, '83', in England. The team recreated Kapil Dev ’s match-winning innings 175 runs innings against Zimbabwe at Tunbridge Wells which is hailed as one of the greatest ODI knocks of all time by several cricketing experts.Interestingly, there is no visual evidence of the historic innings as the telecast partner of the cricket world cup was on strike on the day of the match, a crucial one for India to qualify for the next round. During the shoot, ground officials surprised the team of the sports-drama by paying tribute to the cricketing legend. Now, an engraved plaque celebrating Kapil’s record-breaking knock hangs on the walls of the pavilion.Kabir reveals that the local team was excited to learn that the innings was being revisited at the original location. Getting Kapil Dev on the ground after 36 years was like cherry on top. “It was history in the making all over again because the entire town and country got so excited. At the end of the day, Kapil sir’s innings put Tunbridge Wells on the map of the cricketing world. It’s a beautiful ground, but not many big matches happen there. It’s destiny that the man who created a world record there got back to the ground after 36 years,” Kabir beams, adding, “For them, it was like the return of their hero.”While Kabir and the crew of the Sajid Nadiadwala, Madhu Mantena, Shibasish Sarkar and Vishnu Induri production invited Kapil Dev to witness the shoot, the former Indian Skipper wasn’t aware of the planned tribute. “We requested him to come on the set, but the plaque was a pleasant surprise for him,” Kabir shares, adding that a video capturing the moment will be unveiled by the team on Kapil’s birthday on January 6.Two of Kapil’s teammates, Balwinder Singh Sandhu (who has also coached Kabir’s reel-life team which is led by Ranveer Singh ) and Mohinder Amarnath were also present on the occasion to cheer their Captain on.

Title: 'Yuva Dancing Queen' judge Sonalee Kulkarni looks stunning in her latest pic; take a look
Content: Pavitra Rishta's Ankita Lokhande, who welcomed Lord Ganesh home, shared a video where she can be seen performing aarti with her family before she bids adieu to him. In the video, Ankita can be seen dressed in a simple Indian attire performing the aarti.

Title: SBI looks to divest 1% stake in NSE
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

(Representative image)

MUMBAI: SBI is looking to sell its 1% stake in the National Stock Exchange (NSE). The lender has sought bids from eligible entities for its holding of 50 lakh shares, estimated to be worth about Rs 500 crore.

SBI said the bids should be in lots of 10 lakh and should be submitted before January 15. The stake sale is part of the bank’s plan to divest investment in non-core assets.

The bank had earlier sold 3.9% stake in the stock exchange for Rs 1,700 crore valuing the exchange at around Rs 43,560 crore.

Title: Maharashtra Cabinet Portfolio: Bhaskar Jadhav accuses Uddhav Thackeray of breaking cabinet berth promise
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Bhaskar Jadhav

MUMBAI: Shiv Sena legislator Bhaskar Jadhav on Thursday expressed unhappiness over his non-inclusion in the cabinet. “I was expecting a cabinet berth but I have been left out. I have sought an appointment with Uddhav Thackeray to know for myself why I was denied a cabinet berth,” he said.

On the eve of the assembly election, Jadhav joined the Shiv Sena and won from Guhagar in Ratnagiri district. In 2014, Jadhav was elected an NCP legislator.

“I was in the NCP when I was told by Thackeray that I will be inducted in the state cabinet if I joined the Shiv Sena. Accordingly, on the specific assurance of Thackeray, I joined the Sena. Shockingly, I have been left out in the cabinet expansion. Since all the vacancies have been filled up, there is no scope for expansion in future,” Jadhav said.

Jadhav said he did not quit NCP and join Sena only to become a legislator. “Earlier, too, I was a legislator. I joined the Shiv Sena only on the assurance of a cabinet berth. The assurance was given by none other than Thackeray himself,” he said.

On whether his cabinet induction was opposed by NCP chief Sharad Pawar, Jadhav said Pawar would never do so. ”I have full faith in Sharad Pawar,” he said.

Title: Umbha violence: 6,600 acre illegally occupied by cooperative committees, says Sonbhadra panel
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

File photo of a protest against the Umbha violence, in which 11 villagers were massacred over a land dispute o... Read More

LUCKNOW: Around 6,602 acre of Rs 660 crore has been found to be illegally occupied in Sonbhadra and Mirzapur by largely cooperative committees.

This was revealed on Thursday in a report submitted to chief minister Yogi Adityanath by the Renuka Kumar Committee, which was set up after the Umbha violence in which 11 villagers were massacred over a land dispute on July 17 last year. It has recommended that the report be sent to the cooperative department for further action.

The committee, set up in August 2019 under the chairmanship of additional chief secretary (revenue) Renuka Kumar, to probe Krishi Sehkari Samities. A report by the forest department is yet to be submitted.

The committee investigated 39 cooperative committees in Sonbhadra and Mirzapur and did not find records for three. Records between 1952 and 2019 were looked at. Out of the seven committees that have been found to be occupying government land illegally, at least one belongs to a senior Congress leader.

Three committees are located in Sonbhadra. These are Mensvar Krishi Cooperative Committee, Perh Krishi Cooperative Committee and Baraudhi Krishi Cooperative Committee. In Mirzapur, four committees were violating rules. These are Gopalpur Krishi Cooperative Committee, Bahori Krishi Cooperative Committee, Mewari Krishi Cooperative Committee and Patehara Krishi Cooperative Committee.

A senior official in the CM office said that as per the report, 19,880 bighas of land was investigated, of which 10,569 bighas or 6,602 acres, was found to be recoverable. “Most of this land is either ceiling or belongs to gram sabhas. The government will start the process of retrieving this land at the earliest,” said the official.

The report has recommended action against two specific persons, a tehsildar and a naib tehsildar. While no district magistrate has been mentioned in the report, the matter of land allotment took place at the SDM and ADM levels and it will be up to the cooperative department to assess who all have been responsible for the illegalities, said sources.

The report has also raised questions over the conduct of revenue department officials, who either allowed the illegal transactions to take place or who did not react when anomalies came up which would have brought the matter to light much earlier.

Title: Three PFI men who instigated anti-CAA mob in Meerut identified
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

A CCTV footage shows PFI men indulging in violence in Meerut.

LUCKNOW: Three protesters, belonging to the Popular Front of India (PFI) who allegedly indulged in violence during a protest against the new citizenship law in Meerut , were identified by the police on Thursday. The police made its claim on the basis of a CCTV footage and photographs.

This comes two days after the state police chief sent a proposal to ban the PFI. On December 25, the Meerut police had claimed to have arrested four PFI members identified as Noor Hassan, Abdul Moid from Nauchandi area and Ajmal and Javed from Lisadi Gate.

So far, 25 members of PFI — an affiliated group of the banned SIMI — have been arrested from Lucknow, Shamli and Meerut.

On Thursday, additional superintendent of police (city) Meerut, Akhilesh Narayan Singh told mediapersons that three masked PFI activists, who are seen in the footage instigating the mob and indulging in violence at Meerut’s Lisadi gate on December 20, have been identified as Anees, Faisal, and Naeem.

“We got to know about these men from the four members who were arrested last week,” he added. Singh said a possibility of these three men hiding their real identities could not be ruled out.
