Title: Kolkata: 85-year-old’s decomposed body found at home, son missing
Content:
Representative image

KOLKATA: An 85-year-old man’s decomposed body was found at his home on N G Saha Road in Behala ’s Parnasree on Thursday morning. What thickens the mystery shrouding Rabindranath Ghosh’s death is that his youngest son, Ajit (40), who is mentally disabled, has gone missing.Around 11am, Ghosh’s eldest son, Ashok (45), an Eastern Railway employee, found his father’s body.Parnasree police said Ajit, who was last seen at home on Wednesday, is yet to be traced.“Ghosh, senior executive of a private firm, had retired more than one and a half decades ago. He used to live with Ajit. His elder son, Ashok, who stays a few blocks away, had left the city a few days ago and returned on Thursday morning. After returning to the city, when Ashok went to meet his father, he saw the main door of the house was open. He found that the octogenarian was lying dead in the house and his brother was missing,” said a police officer.“The preliminary postmortem report revealed that Ghosh had died at least four days ago. That means Ajit had stayed in the same room with his father’s body for more than two days. May be, he could not bear the stench and left the house. But Ajit has had a history of leaving the house and returning after some days,” said Murlidhar Sharma, joint CP (crime).Police have registered a case and started a probe to ascertain the exact cause of his death. “So far, we have not found anything missing from the house. The autopsy surgeon believes that he had been suffering from acute tuberculosis for some time,” said a police source. Cops will speak to Ashok to trace his younger brother. “Neighbours noticed Ajit till January 1. We are checking CCTV footage for leads,” said the police officer.The detective department sleuths are expected to visit the spot where Ghosh’s decomposed body was found. Cops said they would cite this case in their ‘Pronam’ meetings in Lalbazar. “There are certain lessons to be learnt from this incident and we will talk about the ways, by which we can help the elderlies living alone in the city,” said a police officer from south division.

Title: PSTET Exam Date: PSTET 2019 exam rescheduled, check revised test date here
Content: Ludhiana: The Punjab School Education Board has postponed Punjab State Teacher Eligibility Test (PSTET)-2019 to January 19 citing lack of randomisation of roll numbers for the test. The test was earlier scheduled for January 5.According to information by the secretary of the board Mohd Tayeeb on Thursday late evening, the last minute checking of roll numbers allotted for January 5 test, resulted into these being in the same sequence as form numbers at many places which gave an impression as if it could become a reason for malpractices during the exam. An enquiry has been ordered into weak rationalisation and the work has been withdrawn from director computers, PSEB.The communique disclosed that fresh roll numbers will be available to the candidates on January 15 at PSTET website for downloading.

Title: Kolkata: Man nabbed with fake notes in Park Circus
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

KOLKATA: The anti-FICN team of special task force (STF) seized fake Indian currency with a face value of Rs 7 lakh and arrested Krishna Mandal (42), a resident of Malda’s Kaliachak area, from Park Circus Maidan on Thursday.

On a tip-off cops had intercepted Mondal at the Park Circus Maidan area around 11.40am on Thursday. Later, they arrested him from the spot around 4.05pm. He will be produced in the court on Friday.

The fake currency recovered from Mandal’s possession comprised 100 notes of Rs 2,000 denomination and 1,000 notes of Rs 500 denomination. Preliminary probe has revealed that Mandal is an FICN racketeer. Officials will interrogate him further to know more about the racket’s modus operandi.

Cops noticed a rise in fake Rs 500-notes. The face value of the fake currency seized by STF last year was over Rs 1crore — almost 1.5 times that of 2018 and six times that recovered in 2017. Besides, 41 fake note racketeers were nabbed last year, which was almost double the arrests made in 2018.

Title: Sara Ali Khan set the temperature soaring with her latest sun-kissed bikini pics
Content: Sushant Singh Rajput’s death case is currently being investigated by the Central Bureau Of Investigation (CBI) and they have been questioning a lot of people connected to the late actor. According to the latest report on India Today, three officers who are a part of the probe, have stated that their team has so far not found any evidence that suggests Sushant was murdered on June 14.

Title: No domestic violence case after divorce: Gujarat high court
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Gujarat high court

AHMEDABAD: Can a woman drag a man to court under the Protection of Women from Domestic Violence Act after her divorce, and when she had already married someone else? She cannot, said the Gujarat high court on the ground that the woman cannot be termed as an aggrieved person under the concerned act in such a case.

In an important judgment, Justice Umesh Trivedi said, "Once the marital tie is severed by way of divorce between the parties the relationship between them is snapped... the wife would be aggrieved person so long as domestic relationship survives. As soon as it is snapped, it is an end to the domestic relationship and she would not be aggrieved person then."

The court further said, "After divorce between two persons, neither the domestic relationship survives nor any person would be termed as an aggrieved person for the purpose of this (DV) Act. Hence, after divorce takes place between husband and wife, the provisions under the Act cannot be invoked."

The case is from Surendranagar town. Kanji Parmar and Urmila had wed in 1984. Parmar filed for divorce in 1989. The couple settled their dispute and formally divorced in 1990. Later, Urmila wed one Premji Tundiya.

Twenty-seven years later, Urmila slapped two cases on Parmar when he was on the verge of retirement from BSNL. Parmar's advocate Ashvin Gateshaniya said that the woman sought maintenance from Parmar with an eye on his retirement benefits. She filed for maintenance in Surendranagar family court under Section 125 of CrPC as well as under the DV act by claiming herself to be an aggrieved person due to the domestic relationship that once existed.

The family court rejected Urmila's application for maintenance after Parmar showed proof of her second marriage. However, a magisterial court took cognizance of her complaint under the DV act and started proceedings after accepting her claim to be an aggrieved person in a domestic relationship.

After hearing the case, the HC said, "There is irresistible conclusion that divorced wife who has remarried cannot invoke provisions of "the Act" against her erstwhile husband."

Title: Varun Dhawan, Janhvi Kapoor, Bhumi Pednekar's 'Mr Lele' is a comic thriller
Content: Janhvi Kapoor, who wrapped up the second schedule of 'Dostana 2' last week, is gearing up for her next project. The actress is reuniting with Shashank Khaitan, who directed her debut film 'Dhadak', for 'Mr Lele', which also features Varun Dhawan and Bhumi Pednekar According to a source close to the development, the 22-year-old actress will play the protagonist alongside Varun and Bhumi. “The makers were keen to get Janhvi on board as she and Varun haven’t worked together before. The team had a narration for her last week and she instantly agreed. The film is currently in pre-production stage,” the source shared, adding that 'Mr Lele' is a comic-thriller in the commercial space.The story revolves around the three protagonists, who are involved in a mysterious incident that leads to hilarity. “The dialogue draft for the film is currently in the works and it is expected to go on the floors in the first week of March,” the source shared, adding that Shashank is scheduled to go on a recce in the city later this month as the team will also be shooting at real locations.This will be Janhvi’s fourth film with Karan Johar ’s banner after 'Dhadak' (2018) opposite Ishaan Khatter, 'Dostana 2' with Kartik Aaryan and Gunjan Saxena: 'The Kargil Girl'. Meanwhile, 'Mr Lele' also reunites Varun with his Dulhania series (' Humpty Sharma Ki Dulhania and Badrinath Ki Dulhania') director Shashank. The new film is expected to go on the floors in March in Mumbai.On Saturday, Janhvi wrapped up the Gunjan Saxena biopic, which is directed by debutant Sharan Sharma and co-stars Angad Bedi and Pankaj Tripathi . She also has 'RoohiAfza' opposite Rajkummar Rao, the second film in Dinesh Vijan ’s horror comedy series after 'Stree' (2018).

Title: Choti Sardarni update, January 2: Harleen and Meher save Sarab’s life, but still don’t get along together
Content: In the latest episode of Choti Sardarni Sarab has picked Meher in his arms and is climbing up the stairs. Meher asks Sarab to let her walk, but he does not leave her. Bittoo thinks Yuvi put chewing gum on Jitto ’s comb. Amrita defends Yuvi saying that, her son would never do this.Amrita calls Meher and she tells her the solution for Jitto to remove chewing gum stuck in her hair.Sarab reaches up, and Harleen ignores Meher’s suggestions. Harleen trips and she is about to fall off the building but Sarab holds her hand and saves her.While Sarab pulls Harleen, he slips and falls off the building but gets hold of a rod and hangs there. Harleen and Meher throw a dupatta for Sarab so he can climb up, and they save him.Rovi sees Meher’s pregnancy report file and learns that Meher is 3 months pregnant, even though she married Sarab 2 months ago.Dolly tries to ask Param if something happened between Meher and Harleen, but Param tells her nothing.Harleen, Meher and Sarab come home. Harleen tells Meher that she has only seven hours to make her decision.Bittoo scolds Yuvi and asks him if he put the chewing gum on Jitto’s comb, Yuvi keeps saying no.Bittoo and Jagga get into an argument and Kulwant enjoys seeing everyone fight in the house. She thinks that her ‘divide and rule’ plan is going well, and soon everything will be under her control.Sarab sees Meher struggling to tie her hair and helps her do it. Sarab asks Meher to promise him that they shall always stand together and support each other.

Title: PM urges young scientists to 'innovate, patent, produce and prosper'
Content: BENGALURU: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday called on young scientists of India to "Innovate, Patent, Produce and Prosper," and said these four steps would lead our country towards faster development.The Prime Minister also stressed on the need to transform the landscape of Indian science, technology and innovation."The growth story of India depends on its success in science and technology sector. There is a need to transform the landscape of Indian science, technology and innovation," Modi said.Speaking after inaugurating the 107th Session of Indian Science Congress, he said, "My motto for the young scientists in this country is -Innovate, Patent, Produce and Prosper. These four steps will lead our country towards faster development.""If we innovate we will patent and that in turn will make our production smoother and when we take these products to the people of our country, I'm sure they will prosper," he said, adding that innovation for the people and by the people is the direction of our new India .The Prime Minister also said he was happy to learn that India's ranking has improved in the Global Innovation Index to 52."Our programmes have created more technology business incubators in the last five years than in the previous 50 years.I congratulate our scientists for this achievement," he added.In Video: Innovate, patent, produce and prosper, says PM Narendra Modi at 107th Indian Science Congress

Title: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi Yojana: All you need to know
Content:
(Representative image)

What is Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi Yojana

Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-KISAN) is a central sector scheme with 100% funding from the government. It was announced in the Budget 2019-20 on February 1, 2019. Under the scheme, Rs 6,000 will be given per year to small and marginal farmer families having combined land holding/ownership of upto 2 hectares. How farmers will receive the money

The amount will be given in three installments of Rs 2,000 each. It will be transferred directly to the bank account of beneficiaries through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT). DBT will ensure transparency in the entire process and will save time for the farmers. How small and marginal farmers will benefit

It is estimated that the scheme will benefit more than 12 crore small and marginal farmers (SMFs). The PM-KISAN scheme aims to supplement the financial needs of the SMFs in procuring various inputs to ensure proper crop health and appropriate yields, commensurate with the anticipated farm income at the end of the each crop cycle. This would also protect them from falling in the clutches of moneylenders for meeting such expenses and ensure their continuance in the farming activities. PM-KISAN is effective from which date?

As per PM-KISAN website, the Scheme is effective from December 1, 2018 to eligible beneficiaries. The state governments and UT Administration will identify the farmer families which are eligible for support as per scheme guidelines. Who are not eligible for the scheme

The following categories of beneficiaries of higher economic status shall not be eligible for benefit under the scheme: (a) All institutional land holders. (b) Farmer families in which one or more of its members belong to following categories: i) Former and present holders of constitutional posts ii) Former and present ministers/state ministers and former/present members of Lok Sabha/Rajya Sabha/State Legislative Assemblies/State Legislative Councils, former and present mayors of Municipal Corporations, former and present chairpersons of District Panchayats. iii) All serving or retired officers and employees of Central/state government ministries/offices/departments and its field units Central or state PSEs and attached offices/autonomous institutions under the government as well as regular employees of the local bodies (excluding multi tasking staff/Class IV/Group D employees). vi) All superannuated/retired pensioners whose monthly pension is Rs 10,000 or more (excluding multi tasking staff/Class IV/Group D employees) of above category. v) All Persons who paid Income Tax (I-T) in last assessment year vi) Professionals like doctors, engineers, lawyers, chartered accountants, and architects registered with professional bodies and carrying out profession by undertaking practices. (Source: PM-KISAN website)

NEW DELHI: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday slammed states that haven't enrolled Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi Yojana (PM-KISAN) of doing "petty politics", saying such mindset has hurt farmers for a long time.Addressing a public gathering, PM Modi said efforts were being made to identify specific products from every block and district and add more to the scheme's value.Here's all you need to know about PM-KISAN scheme:

Title: Mumbaikars kick off the new year with fitness parties
Content:
Busting calories with dance moves is catching on as the mantra

‘Makes for an innovative way to exercise’



73080166



What they do at the fitness party

Is getting up early part of your new year plan? Don’t just head out for a morning walk or run. Go party, instead! Yes, you heard right. We don’t mean it in the traditional sense, but we’re talking of fitness-infused social gatherings that see you bust the calories in your stylish spandex . Fast gaining popularity around the globe with the health-conscious, they’re big in Mumbai, too. Says organiser Grishma Jain, “These are detox-dance-wellness parties where we merge the old-school wisdom of yoga with high-energy dance workouts. For those who find taking the first step towards fitness tough, it brings them towards that by adding fun to a completely fitness oriented concept.” The workouts are power-packed alright. The dance moves folks them into a sweat and burn calories. Adds Grishma, “It takes them through a journey of release and stress busting in a party environment. Think of it as a first step towards being fit.”The two-hour sessions take place at sunrise or sunset (post office hours) so the usual excuses of not making time to attend won’t work here. The venue could be a co-working space, a nightclub or an open-air terrace. In each one, a trainer briefs the class on what they are about to do. “Around 150 people sign up per session and it’s like a whole community coming together. Healthy foods and drinks are served post the session,” she adds. For Mumbaikars , this is making for a fun grab.RD National College student Avantika Bhosle, who is a regular at these fitness parties , says, “I am not someone who likes to go to a gym and workout. I want something unique and these parties fit right in. Everyone is so enthusiastic that the vibe just rubs off on you. It’s also a great place to make friends, as we all have similar preferences and goals.”Andheri-based diamond merchant Jinesh Jain attended a session at Lower Parel. “I love dancing, so I signed up for a class. We did a mix of workouts and after getting into a sweat, we headed to a juice bar. I think a fitness party is a great idea to start the year,” he says.• Bokwa• Pilates• Piloxing• Zumba• Bootcamp• Power, partner and flow Yoga• Dance meditation• Pound workout with light-up sticks

Title: Greater Hyderabad civic body to install 9,500 street lights to make city safer
Content:
Representational Image

HYDERABAD: A total of 1,260 dark spots were identified in the city. Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation ( GHMC ) has proposed to install new 9,500 street lights and 3,500 new electric poles in these poorly lit places.“Around 100 more locations will be added this week,” said a GHMC official.The locations were identified after Municipal Administration and Urban Development (MAUD) Minister K T Rama Rao instructed GHMC to install additional street lights soon after the vet rape case. “The date will be furnished along with the required budget to GHMC commissioner DS Lokesh Kumar and the works will be taken up at zonal level. The works will be completed by six months,” said a GHMC official.According to the records, most of the dark spots are located in GHMC peripheral areas which also include city’s IT corridor. Khajaguda Chowrasta to ORR, MIG Colony (BHEL) and Kavuri Hills are some of the places identified by the civic body in the IT corridor. As per records, other peripheral areas include parts of LB Nagar, Alwal, Rajenderanagar, Uppal and Malkagiri.“The area around the government land located in TNGOs colony falling under Gachibowli police station limits is poorly lit. The place is deserted too, police also caught some people who were drinking alcohol there ,” said Ramanjeet Singh, a techie from the city.“The street near Novotel Hotel Road, Girish Park, Kondapur is deserted after 10 pm and the illumination is poor. This stretch is dangerous for women and senior citizens,” said Harshika P, a techie living in Kondapur.Though the civic body has identified a lower number of dark spots in central part of city under GHMC Khairtabad Zone, resident welfare associations say poor maintenance has led to some areas in central part of the city becoming dark spots.“Methodist Colony in Begumpet and the by-lanes in Balanagar are poorly lit and can be tagged as a dark spot despite not being under GHMC peripheral areas. The focus should be on maintenance .While identifying dark spots or executing any project, government should involve RWAs as they know the ground reality,” said Shiv Kiran , vice president of United Federation of Residents Welfare Associations (UFERWAS).There are 4.53 lakh streetlights within GHMC limits.“The new lights will be installed by Energy Efficiency Services (EESL) and the poles will be procured from the electricity department,” said a GHMC official.

Title: Pune: Alandi may get drinking water from Bhama Askhed
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

PUNE: Should everything go according to plan, the temple town of Alandi will get drinking water in the next six months.

The Alandi Municipal Council plans to create a supply junction in the Bhama Askhed water pipeline being laid by Pune Municipal Corporation .

“This project will address the existing drinking water crisis permanently,” AMC chief officer Samir Bhumkar told TOI on Monday.

Bhumkar said AMC has floated a tender for the project. “We are in the final stages of awarding a work order to a private agency. We will complete this process in the next few weeks before starting the actual work at Kuruli,” he added.

Despite being among the prominent pilgrim towns — thousands come here every day to to visit the Sant Dnyaneshwar Maharaj temple — Alandi has been grappling with a water crisis for several years. At the moment, citizens get water drawn from Indrayani river , which is polluted nearly through the year.

This has forced most local citizens to buy water cans. A significant chunk of the population, meanwhile, most of the financially weak, drink the water from Indrayani.

A team of experts from Maharashtra Jeevan Pradhikaran has studied the project over the past few months and based on their findings, AMC prepared submitted a proposal to the urban development department, which sanctioned it, AMC officials said.

“The town currently requires 7 million litres of water (MLD) a day. Considering the growing population and the town’s expansion, PMC has agreed to provide 10 MLD to us,” Bhumkar added.

As a part of the project, water from Bhama Askhed will be treated at the filtration plant in Alandi before being supplied.

“Since we have replaced old pipelines in the past three years, we will be able to supply water at the required pressure and cover entire 2.73 sqkm network of the town,” Bhumar said.

As per the 2011 census, 28,000 people lived in Alandi. Estimates peg that number now at 33,000.

Citizens and activists said the work should be completed in a timely manner.

“Neither politicians nor the district administration paid heed to the water crisis in the past two decades. Now, they should ensure completion of this project on time,” lawyer-activist Vilas Kate said.

Title: Roadshows to promote 'Study in Gujarat' initiative
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Bhupendrasinh Chudasama

GANDHINAGAR: As part of its 'Study in Gujarat ' initiative to woo students from other parts of the country and abroad, the state government will focus on wooing students from neighbouring Bangladesh and other Islamic countries.

State education minister Bhupendrasinh Chudasama , principal secretary, higher education, Anju Sharma, and other senior officers will travel to various countries and hold roadshows to encourage students to pursue higher education in Gujarat.

Roadshows will be held in West Asia from January 15 to 22.

It will be organized in Kuwait on January 15, in Dubai on January 17 and 18, in Muscat on January 19 and 20, and in Riyadh on January 21 and 22.

Overseas roadshows will also be held in Sri Lanka, Nepal, Zimbabwe, Bangladesh, Kenya, Ethiopia, Uganda and Bhutan. Roadshows will be organized in 10 cities across India, officials said.

The domestic roadshows will be held in Ranchi on January 28, in Indore on January 21, in Kolkata on January 22, in Hyderabad on January 29, in Guwahati on January 20, and in Patna, Nashik and Srinagar on January 28.

As many as 22 government and private universities and four colleges of the state are partnering the government in the campaign.

The roadshows will provide a glimpse of the education sector in Gujarat and enable candidates interested in pursuing higher education in Gujarat to get a first-hand understanding of higher education opportunities in the state.

The delegations travelling for the international and domestic roadshows will comprise ministers, senior government officials and representatives of leading universities and colleges in Gujarat.

Title: Kumkum Bhagya update, January 2: Ranbir misunderstands Prachi’s answer
Content: In the latest episode of Kumkum Bhagya Ranbir wonders if he proposed Prachi when he was drunk. Aryan tells him he must start talking to her, and later he will get to know from her if he proposed to her or not.Aryan and Ranbir come to Prachi’s house. Pragya Shahana and Sarita are glad to see Ranbir. They offer him coffee, and treat him very well.Prachi sees Ranbir and Aryan, she wonders why are they at her house. Ranbir asks Aryan to talk to Shahana and get to know what happened last night with him and Prachi.Rhea meets Sanju and tells him that Ranbir loves Prachi.Aryan asks Shahana about Prachi and Ranbir. Shahana says that everyone in the family knows what is going on between them, Prachi need not say anything.Aryan misunderstands, thinking that Ranbir proposed Prachi in front of everyone. He tells Ranbir the same. Ranbir still does not know if Prachi said a yes or a no to his proposal.Rhea says that they need to ruin Prachi’s image, so that Ranbir stays away from him. She suggests that making an MMS of her will make her look characterless.Ranbir goes to Prachi’s room and asks her if they spoke to each other yesterday. Prachi recalls the time he called her regarding a file at office, and says yes.Ranbir thinks she is referring to the previous night when he might have proposed to her.Ranbir tells Prachi, he wants to know her answer to his question, and Prachi says yes. Ranbir thinks that Prachi said yes to his proposal, but she actually says a yes regarding the file at office.

Title: Manner in which nation celebrated science and space program will be etched in memory: PM on Chandrayaan-2 mission
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

BENGALURU: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said that he will always remember the manner in which the nation "celebrated science, the space program and the strengths of scientists" during the Chandrayaan-2 mission in September last year.

"I am very happy that one of my first programmes at the start of the New Year and new decade is linked to science, technology and innovation. This programme is happening in Bengaluru, a city associated with science and innovation," Prime Minister Modi said here while addressing the 107th session of Indian Science Congress.

"The last time I had come to Bengaluru was when the eyes of the nation were set on Chandrayaan-2. That time, the manner in which our nation celebrated science, our space program and the strengths of our scientists will always be a part of my memory," he said.

He went on to add, "When we start the year 2020 with positivity and optimism of science and technology-driven development, we take one more step in fulfilling our dream."

In September last year, Prime Minister Narendra Modi had addressed the nation from Isro control centre here, after Isro lost communication with 'Vikram' lander of Chandrayaan 2 moments before it was preparing to make a soft-landing on the south pole region of the Moon .

"Don't lose hope. Be courageous. There are ups and downs in life. What you all have done is not a small thing. You have done a great service to the country, science and mankind. I am with you. I wish you all the best," the Prime Minister had told the scientists.

Title: NGT’s Pune bench to resume regular hearings from February 1
Content: PUNE: The western zone bench of the National Green Tribunal (NGT) in Pune is all set to resume regular hearing of cases from February 1.The move brings relief to environmental litigants from Maharashtra, Gujarat , Goa, and the Union territories of Daman and Diu, and Dadra and Nagar Haveli.NGT chairperson Justice Adarsh Kumar Goel on Thursday signed an office order transferring expert member Siddhanta Das from the green tribunal’s principal bench in New Delhi to the Pune bench with effect from February 1, 2020. Following this, the NGT principal bench’s deputy registrar Sukhada Pritam issued a circular stating, “Consequent to the posting of Siddhanta Das, expert member, the NGT western zone bench in Pune will become functioning w.e.f February 1, 2020, subject to joining of a judicial member.”The office order as well as the circular have since been uploaded on the NGT’s website.“We now have a month’s time, during which one of the five judicial members, currently posted in New Delhi, is likely be transferred to Pune for the constitution of a full two-member bench for regular hearing of cases,” lawyer Saurabh Kulkarni, president of the NGT Bar Association (western zone), told TOI. On January 1, 2018, the Supreme Court issued an order restraining the NGT from constituting singlemember benches and made it mandatory for all cases to be heard by two-member benches comprising a judicial and an expert member each. The process to appoint judicial members and expert members to fill up the large number of vacant posts has since been under progress.“Between February and August 2018, only filing of cases was allowed at the Pune bench. In case of an urgent matter, the litigant was required to move the NGT principal bench in New Delhi to get the same transferred there and be heard on priority. After August 2018, the matters filed at Pune bench were being heard via video conferencing on an average two days per week and that too for a two-hour session,” Kulkarni said.“There are close to 600 cases pending before the Pune bench and post resumption of normal functioning, we expect some more matters — currently pending before the principal bench — to be referred back to the western zone bench,” he added.

Title: Hyderabad: 150 industries to get land in phase 1 of Pharma City
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representational Image

HYDERABAD: With the Centre granting the National Investment Manufacturing Zone ( NIMZ ) status to Hyderabad Pharma City , the Telangana government is now going ahead with its plans to allot land to as many as 150 firms in phase I.

The Telangana State Industrial Infrastructure Corporation ( TSIIC ) has already acquired about 8,500 acres for the Pharma City project, which is coming up at Mucherla in Rangareddy district on the outskirts of Hyderabad.

Senior officials said 350 firms had approached the government seeking land in Pharma City. “Initially, land will be allotted to 150 pharma units. Several pharma associations are queuing up for allotment of land. We will launch the application process soon and allotment will be made directly to individual companies,” principal secretary, industries, Jayesh Ranjan told TOI on Thursday.

A couple of days ago, industries minister KT Rama Rao had revealed that Pharma City would be operationalised this year. Top sources in the government said once infrastructure facilities are in place, the process of land allotment would be completed before May this year.

The government is speeding up the Pharma City project as all the required permissions, including environmental clearance, have already been granted by the Centre. Though the project was conceived in 2015, it took four years to get the clearances.

Ten days ago, Union industry minister Piyush Goyal set the ball rolling by asserting that the Centre had granted its final approval for the project by giving it NIMZ status. In fact, the Centre approved NIMZ status to Pharma City in January 2016 but kept it on hold.

Earlier, the Telangana industries department submitted a techno-economic feasibility study and development plan report for getting the final approval. Based on the reports, the final approval was granted in the second week of December.

The government had taken Rs 750 crore loan from Hudco, while KTR had written letters to the Centre seeking Rs 3,418 crore for creation of a full-fledged Pharma City in the form of a grant, besides allotment of natural gas on a preferential tariff basis for use as fuel by pharma units.

“The Telangana government asked for a grant-in-aid of Rs 1,318 crore for creation of infrastructure, besides Rs 2,100 crore, which will be half the expenditure to be incurred for creation of internal infrastructure and common effluent treatment plants,” a senior official said.

Title: Gujarat: Two held with 41 birds from Nalsarovar lake
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

36 of the birds were found at the residence of Lila Padhar, and three of them were injured. The 33 other birds... Read More

AHMEDABAD: Forest department officials on Thursday arrested a 50-year-old woman and a 13-year-old boy from their home in Darji village, for allegedly poaching migratory birds from Nalsarovar lake, Gujarat 's only Ramsar site. The department recovered 41 live birds from them.

Deputy conservator of forests Brajish Chaudhari said the two, Lila Padhar and the 13-year-old, were arrested from their village on the basis of a tip off. The boy's family were not at home.

He said 36 of the birds were found at the residence of Padhar, and three of them were injured. The 33 other birds were released at the lake. Five birds were found at the boy's home and they were also released back into the wild.

The officer said Padhar was earlier also found to be involved in poaching. In 2018, a video had gone viral showing her carrying a migratory bird. Forest department officials had been looking out for her.

During the interrogation of the duo, they said they had poached the birds for their own consumption. "The recovery of 36 birds raised questions about whether they were selling these birds to eateries," he said.

A senior forest department official said that this is the second time such birds have been found at the homes of poachers. Around Diwali time, when the birds had started arriving, the forest department had recovered some birds from the residences of two other poachers in the same village.

The officer said the modus operandi was simple, a net was tied on the banks of the Nalsarovar lake and when the birds were disturbed they would fly into the net and get trapped.

The department recovered 12 gadwalls, two wigeons, two garganey teals, six shovelers, two purple moorhens, five pintails and four common teals, among others.

Title: Gujarat second to UP in homes built under PMAY(U)
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

AHMEDABAD: Building houses in cities and towns under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojna (Urban) - PMAY (U) is getting visible traction. Gujarat now ranks second after Uttar Pradesh when it comes to completing homes under the scheme.

Construction of 3.69 lakh homes has been completed in Gujarat under PMAY (U) as on December 27, 2019. As against this, merely 1.66 lakh homes had been completed in the same period of 2018, real estate consultancy firm Anarock Property Consultants said citing data from the Union ministry of housing and urban affairs.

"Another 3.32 lakh homes are already occupied by scheme beneficiaries as on 2019-end," the consultant added. "Gujarat's progress in completing homes under PMAY (U) is far better than Uttar Pradesh when considered in terms of population and urban growth," said Jaxay Shah, chairman, CREDAI-National.

"CREDAI as a national body of real estate developers has played a crucial role in encouraging affordable housing across the country," Shah added.

Nationally, Uttar Pradesh, Gujarat and Andhra Pradesh together contributed nearly 35% of the total 32 lakh homes completed under the PMAY (U) scheme.

"Uttar Pradesh, Gujarat and Andhra Pradesh are clear winners with nearly 11.22 lakh homes completed in these three states by the end of 2019. Last year at this point, these three had just 3.62 lakh homes completed," Anarock added.

As far as UP is concerned, it saw completion of nearly 4.30 lakh homes by 2019-end as compared to just 68,660 units exactly a year ago. Andhra Pradesh ranks third with over 3.23 lakh homes completed in the state by 2019-end, as against around 1.27 lakh homes completed in the same time frame in 2018.

"In 2015, the government announced its intention of building approximately 1.12 crore homes under PMAY (U) by 2022, of which nearly 92% have already been sanctioned as on the end of 2019. Timely construction remains a challenge, but the introduction of new and effective technologies, such as prefabricated construction, can help achieve this target within the stipulated deadline," said Anuj Puri, chairman, Anarock.

Title: Mi Super sale: Up to Rs 12,000 discount on Xiaomi Poco F1, Redmi K20 Pro, Redmi Note 7 Pro and more
Content:

Smartphone brand Xiaomi has announced an eight-day long sale on Mi.com. Called the Mi Super sale , it started on January 1 and will continue till January 8. As part of the ongoing sale, buyers can avail up to Rs 12,000 discount on Xiaomi phones. Wondering what all phones are available in the sale? Read along

Xiaomi Redmi K20 Pro : Available at up to Rs 4,000 off

The base model of Redmi K20 Pro packs 6GB RAM and is available at Rs 24,999. The smartphone’s 8GB RAM variant, on the other hand can be purchased at Rs 27,999. The phone runs Qualcomm Snapdragon 855 and offers 48MP quad camera.

There are two RAM variants of Poco F1 -- 6GB and 8GB. Both these models can be purchased at Rs 14,999 and Rs 18,999 in the ongoing sale. The handset is powered by Qualcomm Snapdragon 845 and is backed by 4000mAh battery with Quick Charge 3.0.

All three variants of Redmi Note 7 Pro are selling with Rs 5,000 discount. The base model of 4GB RAM is available at Rs 9,999, while the 6+64GB variant can be purchased at Rs 12,999. The 6+128GB model, on the other hand is selling at Rs 14,999.

Xiaomi Redmi Y3 offers 32MP selfie camera. Its base variant of 3GB RAM and 32GB onboard storage is available at Rs 7,999. The handset’s 4GB model is selling at Rs 9,999.

Title: Pune: Auto driver, accomplice held for robbery
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

PUNE: A 22-year-old hotel employee’s mindfulness helped the police arrest an autorickshaw driver and his accomplice on the charge of threatening and robbing the staffer during the early hours of Wednesday in Thergaon.

The duo robbed the youth — Omkar Ghadage of Bhosari — of his valuables worth Rs 14,200 when Ghadage was on his way home.

“Ghadage, an employee of a hotel along the Katraj-Dehu Road Bypass, was working until the wee of Wednesday. Around 2.45am, he left his place of work for home. He boarded an autorickshaw which dropped him at Kalewadi,” sub-inspector of the Wakad police Shambhu Ranaware told TOI.

Ranware said Ghadage then boarded an another autorickshaw from Kalewadi Phata, being driven by Akash Kampa (23) of Pimpri. “Kampa, who has a previous criminal record, was driving his friend’s autorickshaw that night. His accomplice, Swapnil Chandanshive (21) of Kalewadi, was with him. Ghadage requested the duo to take him to Bhosari,” he said.

The officer said after driving for some distance, Kampa routed the autorickshaw to a secluded lane near a departmental store in Thergaon. “The duo then threatened Ghadage that they would hack him to death and robbed him of his cellphone, wallet, wristwatch and bagpack,” Ranaware said, adding, “They then forced Ghadage to sit inside the vehicle and resumed driving.”

Although terrified, a mindful Ghagade asked the driver to stop the vehicle, saying that he wanted to answer nature’s call. “As soon as the driver stopped, Ghadage jumped out of the vehicle and fled the scene. He managed to note down the vehicle’s registration number before that,” Ranaware said.

He said registration number helped the police to trace the autorickshaw driver and his accomplice. “The duo have been remanded to the police custody for three days,” Ranware added.
