Title: Gujarat: Schools enlisted in BJP's CAA drive, write postcards to PM
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

File photo used for representational purpose

AHMEDABAD: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has enlisted the support of schoolchildren in Ahmedabad for its 'India supports CAA' campaign, which it says aims to counter the 'misinformation' campaign carried out by the opposition against the new law.

On Thursday, students of as many as 15 schools in and around Ghatlodia participated in the party's campaign to create awareness on the Citizenship Amendment Act, (CAA), 2019.

Students from these schools wrote postcards to Prime Minister Narendra Modi . They acknowledged the good work done by the Prime Minister in enacting the law, which grants fast track Indian citizenship in five years to religious minorities from Afghanistan, Pakistan and Bangladesh, who had to flee their homeland due to persecution.

Blank postcards were distributed by BJP workers to schools earlier this week, said sources.

At Tripada School in Ghatlodia, 800 students wrote letters appreciating CAA. The school's principal, Archit Bhatt, said members of the BJP had approached them on Wednesday and sought the help of their students. "We explained to the students the benefits of CAA. The postcards were provided by BJP members," said Bhatt. The party held a meeting under Ghatlodia MLA Bhupendra Patel, where it was decided to rope in schools for the 'India supports CAA' campaign.

Title: Modi in Bangalore: 'Innovate, patent, produce and prosper,' PM Modi says at 107th Indian Science Congress
Content:
(ANI)

BENGALURU: Prime Minister Narendra Modi , inaugurating the 107th Indian Science Congress (ISC) here urged the scientific community to lead India in the path of innovation and prosperity."India's growth story will depend on science and technology sector and there's a need to transform this sector. Motto for youngsters must be to: Innovate, patent, produce and prosper," he said."...This will lead our country towards faster development. If we innovate, we will patent, and that in turn will make production smooth and when we take the products to the country, people will prosper," he added.Identifying key areas of focus, Modi said that India needs logical temperament too along with technological development."I've always believed science and technology is the way forward in bridging gaps. Look at affordable smartphones now. Even the 'aam aadmi' is now connected and he knows he is connected with the government," he said.From technology in agriculture to deep-sea explorations and from use of IT in governance to taking drinking water to homes, Modi said the role of science and technology will be enormous in the coming years."The City of gardens is now a wonderful field for startups. The world is coming here to innovate. It is the dream of every engineer and innovator to be in Bengaluru. But this dream is not just for personal gains but for the nation. When we start the year 2020 with the positivity of science, we'll be able to transform India," he said, adding that startups have a wide range of opportunities that they need to harness."India is at no.3 in peer reviewed publications. It is growing about 10% while global average is only 4%. India's innovation ranking at 52 makes me happy. I congratulate our Scientists for this achievement," he said.In Video: Innovate, patent, produce and prosper, says PM Narendra Modi at 107th Indian Science Congress

Title: Bombay high court scolds BMC for zeal to raze small platform in housing society
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

MUMBAI: The BMC goes after small things while ignoring big concerns, said the Bombay high court on Thursday as it rapped the municipal corporation for wanting to demolish a small platform on which a generator is placed in a highrise in Wadala (east).

The court heard a petition by Wadala Heights Cooperative Housing Society, which comprises two wings with 32 floors each and 240 flats. Its petition stated that on June 14, 2016, with government permission, a diesel generator was installed on a cement platform “some four to five inches from the ground” for the lifts.

On July 21, 2016, the FNorth ward office issued a stop-work notice for the construction and a week later rejected the society explanation. The society moved the high court, which stayed the notice on August 2, 2016.

Society advocate Rajeev Panday said to a bench of Justice Shahrukh Kathawalla and Justice Burgess Colabawalla that “it is just a threeinch concrete platform to keep the generator and BMC has issued notice for illegal construction”. The BMC advocate said it was not in the sanctioned plan and that the society should get it regularised.

“This is ridiculous. Small things you’ll (BMC) go after, big things you leave,” Justice Colabawalla said.

The BMC advocate said the municipal corporation would see whether the platform could be regularised. “Not see. You should regularise it,” Justice Kathawalla said.

Title: Xiaomi security camera bug: This Google device has a Xiaomi 'problem'
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

NEW DELHI: It seems that the new year has not started on a good note for Xiaomi. As per a recent report, tech giant Google has disabled the access of Xiaomi devices to its Nest Hub and Assistant. The company took this decision after a user reported that he is seeing still images from a stranger's security camera.

According to a report by Android Police, a user took to Reddit and revealed that his recently purchased Xiaomi Mijia 1080p Smart IP security camera was showing some still images from strangers' homes when he tried to stream from the camera to a Google Nest Hub. The report further added that the Reddit user saw images of an enclosed porch, a man sleeping in the chair, a baby sleeping in the cradle.

After the incident a Google Spokesperson said in a statement, "We’re aware of the issue and are in contact with Xiaomi to work on a fix. In the meantime, we’re disabling Xiaomi integrations on our devices."

Last year it was reported that Google has banned the 'Quick apps' by Xiaomi as part of company's Play Protect policy. For those unaware, Google was not allowing the Xiaomi users to update the Quick Apps by Xiaomi using the system app updater. Whenever a user tried to do that they were greeted with a popup from Play Protect saying, "This app can collect data that could be used to track you."

This was the second time when the Quick Apps from Xiaomi came under the scanner. Later Xiaomi issued a statement on the matter and said that it is in talks with the company to resolve the issue. The Chinese manufacturer also stated that its Quick Apps are completely safe to use.

Title: Pune Airport: Work on multi-level car parking facility begins
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

MP Girish Bapat (centre) presided over the Pune Airport Advisory Committee meeting

PUNE: The work on the multilevel car park at the airport has started. Authorities on Thursday stated that the facility, expected to be ready in two years, would be connected with a sky walk to the airport’s terminal building.

“The bhoomi pooja was performed on Thursday and the building will come up at parking number-1. People parking their vehicles at the facility will not have to cross the new airport road to get to the airport premises. Instead, the second floor of the facility will be connected to the terminal building through a skywalk,” said Pune MP Girish Bapat , who presided over the Pune Airport Advisory Committee meeting.

Airport director Ajay Kumar said that the land adjacent to parking number-1was being developed so that parking could be shifted to the new plot when it is ready. “For some time,therewillbesome issues as the new placefor parking is getting ready. While a section in parking number-1willbe reserved for parking during this time, some more space will be reserved at parking number-2 that is currently a pickup point for cabs and autorickshaws. Once the infrastructure on the new plot is ready, there will be no problems at all,” said Kumar.

“The length of the skywalk should be about 200 meters. So, it has been decided to install a travelator, or a moving walkway, so that passengers do not face any hassles as they walk with their luggage. The project has been delayed a bit due to land issues but now it is on track,” Kumar added.

Title: Corporate affairs min says no illegality in conversion of Tata Sons into pvt co; NCLAT reserves order
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Ratan Tata (left) and Cyrus Mistry (File photo)

NEW DELHI: The ministry of corporate affairs on Friday told the company law appellate court that it did not commit any illegality in granting permission to convert Tata Sons -- the holding company of the $110 billion salt-to-software conglomerate -- into a private company.

The submission was made before the National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) during the course of hearing on a petition filed by Registrar of Companies (RoC) that seeks modifications in the tribunal's December 18, 2019 judgment reinstating Cyrus Mistry as the executive chairman of Tata Sons.

A two-member bench of the NCLAT headed by chairman justice S J Mukhopadhaya, which reserved its order on the RoC's petition, said it will clarify that the December 18 judgement does not cast aspersions on the RoC and indicated that its order is likely to come on Monday next week.

Last month, the NCLAT set aside the RoC decision allowing conversion of Tata Sons into a private company.

During the proceedings on Friday, the ministry of corporate affairs (MCA) said it was only discharging its duty and has not committed any illegality in the conversion of Tata Sons from a public company to a private company.

Director prosecution, representing the MCA, informed the appellate tribunal that after amendment in 2015, there is no such requirement of any minimum prescribed share capital for conversion of companies from public to private ones.

"Nothing has been prescribed. There is no requirement. This has been done for ease of doing business," said the MCA official.

The MCA also said that RoC Mumbai was "duty-bound" to change the status, over such a request and there was no hurry from its part in the conversion of Tata Sons from a public to a private company.

However, on this, the bench said, "Hurry was not from your part. It was from their own part (Tata).

"Your help was in that ... hurriedly changed with the board of directors" said the NCLAT.

Further, the appellate tribunal said the RoC cannot challenge its finding observations in the judgement before it.

"You are challenging the finding observation (of December 18 judgement). You go and challenge it before the Supreme Court. Your action challenging is prejudicial," said the NCLAT.

The appellate tribunal also clearly told the MCA that it was not making any aspersions against the RoC.

"We are not making any aspersions against you. These are our findings. We are not saying anything malafide against you. Your apprehensions are unfounded," said the NCLAT, "You can't ask for a change for just seeking a change".

Going a step further, the NCLAT also observed, "Your arguments seem that you are arguing for a company ... You are arguing as a mouthpiece of a company. Don't plead like that".

NCLAT member (Judicial) Justice Bansi Lal Bhat, who was also part of the two-member bench, observed, "This is for the first time we are seeing that a director prosecution is acting like defence".

On December 18, the NCLAT directed the $110-billion Tata group to reinstate Cyrus Mistry as the executive chairman of Tata Sons.

Tata Sons and Ratan Tata have separately moved the Supreme Court against the NCLAT order.

In its order passed on December 18, NCLAT termed the appointment of N Chandrasekaran, as "illegal" following the October 2016 sacking of Mistry as Tata Sons' executive chairman. It had also directed the RoC to reverse Tata Sons' status from a 'private company' to a 'public company'.

The appellate tribunal had also quashed the conversion of Tata Sons -- the principal holding company and promoter of Tata firms -- into a private company from a public one and had termed it as "illegal".

It had said the action taken by the RoC to allow the firm to become a private company was against the provisions of the Companies Act, 2013, and 'prejudicial' and 'oppressive' to the minority member (Mistry camp).

In an urgent application, which was mentioned on December 23, RoC Mumbai had asked the appellate tribunal "to carry out requisite amendments" of its judgement "to correctly reflect the conduct of the RoC Mumbai as not being illegal and being as per the provisions of the Companies Act".

In its plea, the RoC, which functions under the MCA, sought to be impleaded as a party in the two petitions and deletion of the words "illegal" and "with the help of the RoC" used by the NCLAT in its judgement.

Besides, it also urged the tribunal "to delete the aspersions made regarding any hurried help accorded by the RoC Mumbai to Tata Sons, except what was statutorily required" in para 181 of the order.

The RoC also said it has acted in "bonafide manner" in converting the status of Tata Sons as "there was no stay granted by this appellate tribunal on the operation of the judgement dated July 9, 2018, of Mumbai, NCLT, at the time when this intimation was filed by Tata Sons Ltd".

Months after Mistry was sacked, Tata Sons received its shareholders' nod in September 2017, to convert itself into a private limited company from a public limited company, thereby absolving it of the need to take shareholder consent in taking crucial decisions, which could be passed with just the board's approval.

Tata Sons was initially a 'private company', but after insertion of Section 43A (1A) in the Companies Act, 1956, on the basis of average annual turnover, it assumed the character of a deemed 'public company' with effect from February 1, 1975, the order said.

Title: Mumbai: History-sheeter who pushed woman out of Gujarat Express arrested
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

MUMBAI: A day after a history-sheeter was detained on the suspicion that he had pushed a polio-afflicted woman in a wheelchair out of Gujarat Express train on December 13, the local crime branch of the railway police arrested him on Thursday. The accused, Aslam Umar (45), will soon undergo identification parade, said sources.

The victim, Nagma Ansari (31), a sweeper at Mumbai Central station, in her complaint, said: “There was only one man in the compartment of Gujarat Express when I boarded the train at Dadar. When the train moved, he started closing all windows and doors-...Suddenly he came towards me and asked to hand over my valuables. When I refused, he snatched my bag containing her phone and Rs 4,000. I resisted, so he assaulted me and pushed me out of the train.” One of her legs was amputated below the knee and she suffered a fracture on the other leg and an arm.

Umar was detained on Wednesday when he was found loitering near the ladies coach of a long-distance train at Dadar station. “Umar was identified as his body movements matched those of the robber caught on the CCTV cameras on December 13. During interrogation, he confessed to the robbery,” said senior inspector Uttam Sonawane, railway crime branch. Umar has five similar robbery cases registered against him and was convicted in one of the cases in 2017. He was released from jail in August 2018. Umar is also the prime suspect in the November 14 incident, when a passenger, Mansi Kelkar (62), travelling in an Ahmedabad-Mumbai train was robbed of her jewellery and phone.

Title: Sunny Wayne films: Manju Warrier kicks off Chethi Mandaram Thulasi
Content: Thiruvananthapuram was host to a glitzy event on Thursday that was attended by Manju Warrier and Sunny Wayne . The function, which was organised in a prominent mall in the city, was held to launch the title of director RS Vimal’s new venture, Chethi Mandaram Thulasi , which is helmed by three newcomers.The makers also revealed a sneak peek of the project, which is touted to be a romantic film. Music director Govind Vasantha will be composing the songs written by Rafeeque Ahmed. The movie will be shot in Kashmir and Shimla.Photo Courtesy: Satheeshan Karicheri

Title: Jeevitha apologies to Chiranjeevi after Rajasekhar creates ruckus at MAA diary launch
Content:
Whatever happened today is only between Naresh, Maa and me. Things aren't right here and I cannot stand aside quie… https://t.co/nFshvFeV71 — Dr.Rajasekhar (@ActorRajasekhar) 1577972478000

But it is high time and I had to speak about it! I have resigned from my post as Executive Vice President. I promis… https://t.co/pelL1zc88x — Dr.Rajasekhar (@ActorRajasekhar) 1577972479000

Jeevitha, w/o Dr Rajasekhar has apologised to members of Movie Artists' Association (MAA) after Rajasekhar created some high drama at MAA diary launch which was held at Park Hyatt in Hyderabad on January 02, 2020.Dr Rajasekhar wrested the mic out of Paruchuri Gopala Krishna's hands and said that he has a lot of issues at his home due to MAA. He hasn't signed any film since last year March, and he spent most his time in the association work. He added that Chiranjeevi garu delivered a vivid speech, but one cannot hide the smoke when things set on fire.Chiranjeevi got angry with the behaviour of Rajasekhar and called for disciplinary action to be taken against him. He strongly condemned his act. Jeevitha immediately took the mic and apologised for the inconvenience created on the stage. Justified her husband's behaviour, Rajasekhar is like a kid. He cannot hide his emotions and feelings. So, please don't get angry on him. She also added that they would discuss amongst themselves and work together. No one has cheated anyone there.Dr Rajasekhar has also apologised for the inconvenience caused by his irked behaviour. He took to Twitter to apologise to the members of Movie Artists' Association that were hurt by his words.He wrote," Whatever happened today is only between Naresh, Maa and me. Things aren't right here and I cannot stand aside quietly and watch. There is no misunderstanding or fight between Chiranjeevi Garu, Mohan Babu Garu and Me. I apologise for any inconvenience caused to our guests!"Take a look at his tweet:He also resigned for his post as Executive Vice President of MAA. He tweeted, "But it is high time, and I had to speak about it! I have resigned from my post as Executive Vice President. I promise to do whatever I can for the industry on my own. Plz don't, blow up this issue as a personal fight between Mohan Babu garu, Chiranjeevi garu and me."

Title: Is your child ready for potty training? Look for these 7 signs
Content: It is important to understand that when it comes to potty training your little bundle of joy, there is no right or wrong way. In fact what seemed to worked for other parents and their kids, may not be practical for you. It is all about patience, patience and more of patience, when it comes to training your tot for number two.Remember that every child is different, hence, the tricks that worked its magic on the your firstborn, may not come handy the second time around. So, how exactly would do you know if your little one is ready for potty training? Look for the below mentioned signs:1. If your child is able to walk on its own and is ready to sit down2. If your child expresses his/her dislike about wearing a soiled diaper. It can either be through a change in expressions or through words.3. If your child is able to take off clothes on his/her own.4.Your child has become vocal about the needs to pee and poop.5.Your little one's bowel movements are getting regular and no longer come as surprise.6.Your kid has begin following you to the washroom.7.The frequency of diaper change is decreased.Parents, it is important to remember that toilet training can vary developmentally. Hence, it is important that you do not compare your child to others.It is also important to understand that age milestones has nothing to do with how soon your little one starts using toilet independently. Utimately, patience is the key and no amount of planning will prepare you for pooping accidents that are bound to happen. Hence it is best to keep tissues and baby powder handy.

Title: Priyaank Sharma: Shraddha gives me granny vibes
Content: Debutant Priyaank Sharma (actress Padmini Kolhapure ’s son) is extremely close to his cousins Shraddha and Siddhanth Kapoor . Priyaank makes his foray into Bollywood with Sab Kushal Mangal , in which he plays a reporter. Shraddha made her debut with Teen Patti (2010), while Siddhanth followed her in the industry with Shootout at Wadala (2007). Talking about his equation with the two, Priyaank said, “Shraddha is such an aajibai. I often call her that to tease her. She gives me that granny vibe; she is loving and warm.” When asked what advice his cousins had doled out when he decided to join films, he said, “I am the youngest among the three of us. Siddhanth bhaiyya is six years older to me and Shraddha is about two years older. They had so much to tell me. Shraddha, in fact, had told me that acting should be spontaneous and should be enjoyed. She also warned me that the profession can drain you, make you irritable and change you as a person. She told me to enjoy what I do and do what I enjoy. When I started shooting, they would send messages to encourage me and check on me. Shraddha is an inspiration for me because she takes care of everyone despite her busy schedules. And look at me! I have just done one film and I am all over the place. I missed wishing a friend on his birthday, which never happens.” Shakti Kapoor, Priyaank’s maternal uncle, also had a word of advice for the young actor. Priyaank said, “He just told me one thing — surrender to the director and work with blinkers on.”

Title: Bigg Boss 13: Madhurima Tuli is accused of not using her brain by Sidharth Shukla
Content: The bid for captaincy will see contestants turning against each other in Bigg Boss 13 In the latest teaser of tonight's episode, Sidharth Shukla accuses Madhurima Tuli of not using her brain. The latter tells him he wasn't even happy with her as a 'sanchalak'.Sidharth tells her she was completely wrong.Even Paras Chhabra joins Sidharth. He tells Madhurima that she wasn't good as 'sanchalak' and she didn't fulfill her responsibilities properly. Mahira Sharma also says, "Aap pehle jaag jaiye, phir captain baniye."Madhurima defends herself till the end despite accusation being hurled at her from all corners.An astrologer will also enter the house. In another teaser, it is seen that he warns Paras Chhabra of the big changes that will happen in his relationship.He also has wise words to say to Sidharth, and asks Rashami to stay away from any sort of relationship commitment.Keep watching this space for more updates on Bigg Boss 13.

Title: 'Mr Lele': Here's why the makers roped in Janhvi Kapoor for Shashank Khaitan's film
Content:
FacebookTwitterPintrest

Janhvi Kapoor who is currently shooting for her film 'Dostana 2' is making news for Shashank Khaitan 's ' Mr Lele ', which also features Varun Dhawan and Bhumi Pednekar . When it was confirmed that Kiara Advani is no longer a part of Shashank Khaitan's upcoming directorial, rumours were are rife that Janhvi is replacing her.According to the recent report in Mumbai Mirror , it is confirmed that Janhvi will be reuniting with Shashank Khaitan, who directed her debut film 'Dhadak', for 'Mr Lele'. Yes, you heard that right. According to a source close to the development, the 22-year-old actress will play the protagonist alongside Varun and Bhumi. “The makers were keen to get Janhvi on board as she and Varun haven’t worked together before. The team had a narration for her last week and she instantly agreed. The film is currently in the pre-production stage,” the source shared, adding that 'Mr Lele' is a comic-thriller in the commercial space.“The dialogue draft for the film is currently in the works and it is expected to go on the floors in the first week of March,” said the source.Meanwhile, on the work front, Janhvi will star in Gunjan Saxena biopic, which is directed by debutant Sharan Sharma and co-stars Angad Bedi and Pankaj Tripathi. She also has 'RoohiAfzana' opposite Rajkummar Rao , the second film in Dinesh Vijan’s horror-comedy series after 'Stree' (2018).

Title: Anuradha Paudwal: Kerala woman claims Bollywood singer Anuradha Paudwal is her mother and demands compensation of Rs 50 crore
Content: A 45 year old Kerala woman has claimed that Bollywood singer Anuradha Paudwal is her mother and she has filed a petition before the Family District Court to legally establish the same. According to a report on Timesofindia.com, the lady named Karmala Modex informed reporters that her biological parents Arun and Anuradha Paudwal tied the knot in 1972 and she was born in 1974. She further stated that her parents gave her to Ponnachan and Agnes, as they couldn’t raise her due to their hectic schedules.Karmala stated that she was informed about this truth by Ponnachan three years ago when he was on his death bed. Ponnachan and Agnes were family friends of Anuradha Paudwal and raised Karmala as one of their fourth kids. Karmala tried to reach out to Anuradha Paudwal in the past but was denied permission every time.Karmala has reportedly sought compensation of Rs 50 crore from Anuradha and Arun Paudwal , stating that she lost out on a better upbringing because of the decision of her biological parents. She has also claimed a share in ancestral property. Karmala’s advocate M Anil Prasad has reportedly sent a notice to the singer to attend the case hearing scheduled for January 27.

Title: Mumbai: Passport office updates MEA on Medha Patkar probe
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Medha Patkar

MUMBAI: The Regional Passport Office, Mumbai, has written to the ministry of external affairs (MEA) providing an update on the status of the inquiry against Narmada Bachao Andolan activist Medha Patkar over allegations that she had not disclosed cases pending against her while applying for a passport.

On December 10, she had surrendered her passport. An official said, “We have not sought permission from MEA for initiating criminal proceedings against her. We just gave an update.”

Title: Santhanam’s Dagaalty to be released this January
Content: Rhea Chakraborty will be taking action against Sushant Singh Rajput’s family for making false statements before all the investigating authorities and the Supreme Court. Her lawyer Satish Manshinde says, “The prescription and the chats of the two sisters of the actor clearly indicates that the family was aware of the actor's mental health."

Title: Sheena Bora murder: No bail on medical grounds, Indrani Mukerjea tries ‘merits’ of case
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Indrani Mukerjea

MUMBAI: Sheena Bora murder accused Indrani Mukerjea recently moved a new bail plea after the trial court rejected her fourth application for bail on December 20.

The latest bail plea was the first in which Indrani cited “merits” of the case and said there was no evidence against her. In the four previous pleas, she had sought bail citing ill health.

Mukerjea’s handwritten 10-page plea was submitted last week and is expected to come up for hearing on Friday. Special judge J C Jagdale directed the CBI to submit its reply.

Along with former husbands, Peter Mukerjea and Sanjeev Khanna, Mukerjea is accused of conspiring and murdering her Bora (24) a daughter from a previous relationship, on April 24, 2012.

A fourth accused, Shyamvar Rai, turned approver and deposed as a prosecution witness. Mukerjea has been in jail since her arrest in 2015. So far 59 witnesses have deposed in the case.

Seeking bail, Indrani said that except for Rai’s claim and the prosecution’s allegations, there was no evidence of any content in any messages, emails or conversations or any form of communication to establish that a criminal conspiracy was hatched between the accused to abduct or kill anyone.

She claimed that false witnesses had been planted by the prosecution, details of which she said she would submit during the bail arguments. “Rai’s story does not match the Forensic-Science-Laboratory-certified call data records for the entire month of April 2012,” Indrani’s plea said.

She said different versions were given by Rai before different investigating agencies and courts of how the body was transported from Worli to Pen or how it was burnt. Mukerjea said Rai had a bout of memory loss during cross-examination by the defence. “I cannot remember, I cannot recollect was recorded over 400 times during his deposition in the court,” the plea said.

The plea also focused on the forensic evidence based on the two sets of remains recovered in the case in 2012 and 2015 respectively.

Title: Watch Video: Tiger Shroff wishes everyone 'a flying start' to the New Year
Content: After ending 2019 on a high, Tiger Shroff seems adamant to keep the momentum going in the New Year as well. Taking to social media, the young talented actor wished everyone 'a flying start' to 2020.With millions of followers on Instagram itself, Tiger enjoys a huge fan following on various other social media platform as well. Tiger took to Instagram to share a video wherein he can be seen performing a somersault in slow motion before wishing all his fans a happy new year with his team.He captioned the video as "Wishing everyone a flying start to the year❤️" The 'Student of the Year 2' was spotted at the airport a few days back with rumoured girlfriend Disha Patani has been busy with his upcoming film ' Baaghi 3 '.While Disha recently joined the cast of the upcoming high octane action flick which also stars Shraddha Kapoor . The two have never come out in the open about their relationship but their public appearances, dinner dates to movie outings and PDA on social media says a lot.'Baaghi 3' which is helmed by Ahmed Khan is currently scheduled to release on 6th March this year. The film will also be featuring Riteish Deshmukh in a pivotal role.

Title: 803 red industrial units yet to be shifted out of Hyderabad: TSIIC
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Red category units are those industries which have pollution index scores of 60 and above

HYDERABAD: Nearly seven years after a GO was issued to shift polluting industries out of Hyderabad city limits, nothing much has changed on the ground. In all, 803 red category (industries with pollution index score of 60 and above) units and 357 orange category (units with PI score of 41 to 59) industries along the ORR are yet to be shifted out.

This startling revelaton was given by the Telangana State Industrial Infrastructure Corporation Ltd ( TSIIC ) to an RTI query.

Forum for Good Governance (FGG) secretary M Padmanabha Reddy, who filed the RTI, said public health is in grave danger thanks to the polluting units not being shifted out. "Since 2012-13, there has been very little progress. Red and orange category industries let out untreated effluents which find their way into the Musi, Hussainsagar lake and other water bodies. It involves the health of citizens of Hyderabad," he said.

Out of 1,545 industries identified by the Telangana State Pollution Control Board, 385 units exist outside ORR. The remaining 1,160 industries are yet to be shifted. "The RTI reply says the feasibility study and site suitability has been given to the Environment Protection Training and Research Institute (EPTRI). Once EPTRI completes the feasibility study, shifting of industries will be taken up," Reddy said.

As per a GO issued by the industries department in 2013, 45 locations were identified outside ORR limits, which would be notified for industrial use in the HMDA master plan. But, this remained only on paper.

Chief engineer, TSIIC, in his RTI reply, said: "Steps are being taken to shift edible oil industries to Buchinelly industrial market in Zaheerabad mandal of Sangareddy district and textile industries to Indrakaran industrial park of Sangareddy and steel re-rolling units to Rakamcherla industrial park of Pudur mandal in Vikarabad district for which land has already been developed."

TSIIC also said that land required for three industrial parks had been identified for relocation and EPTRI was carrying out feasibility studies. "The environmental assessment committee had recommended environment clearance (EC) for Hyderabad Pharma City in Rangaredy district. Once EC is obtained, we will set in motion the process of shifting pharmaceutical units," TSIIC said.

Then government held discussions with representatives of the industry in 2013 when it was decided to identify polluting units in ORR and shift them. The government constituted a committee with commissioner of industries as its chairman. The committee identified pharma, chemical, tannery, bleaching, dying, tobacco, foundry, rubber paints, varnish and pesticide industries to be moved. In March that year, a GO was issued to relocate the polluting industries outside the ORR limits.

Title: Dhanush starts shooting in Thirunelveli for 'D41'
Content: Actor Dhanush who recently wrapped up the shooting for his film with director Karthik Subbaraj, has begun shooting for his next project tentatively known as ' D41 ' with director Mari Selvaraj . Produced by Kalaipuli Thanu, 'D41' is said to star Malayalam actor Rajisha Vijayan as the female lead.It has been learnt that the shooting of this upcoming film has started in Thirunelveli. Popular Malayalam actor Lal has been roped in to play an important role in the film which is reported to be titled ' Karnan '. Cinematographer turned actor Natarajan Subramanian aka Natty also play a key role in the film. An official confirmation on the title is awaited.Music composer Santhosh Narayanan had begun the song production for the film earlier in November itself. The young musician seems to have recorded with some folk artists from south Tamil Nadu.Meanwhile, Dhanush's Pattas by Durai Senthilkumar will hit the screens on January 16th, 2020.

Title: 'Vajvuya Band Baja' poster: Amol Kagne unveils the intriguing poster of the film
Content: Marathi cinema's popular filmmaker, Shivaji Patil's upcoming film 'Vajvuya Band Baja' first look poster has already created a buzz in social media. Now, the makers have unveiled the new poster from the film which is sure to pique your curiosity to watch the film.The poster features a lead star, Sameer Dharmadhikari, Mangesh Desai, Pritam Kagne, and Chinmay Udgirkar in lead roles. The audience will get to see the love story of three brothers, Sandeep (played by Sameer Dharmadhikari ) , Amit (played by Mangesh Desai), and Chinmay Udgirkar in the movie 'Vajvuya Band Baja'. Marathi actress, Pritam Kagne who shimmers and shines in the poster, looks promising in her character.The title coupled against a colourful poster gives a feeling that the film will revolve around a wedding and will be light-hearted or comical in nature. The film is being produced under Amol Kagne and Lakshman Kagne's banners, who have previously produced several hit films like Lathe Joshi, Halal and Perfume.With the release of new poster revealing their lead star cast has already created a lot of curiosity among the fans but they will have to wait a tad longer for the official release date of a trailer from the film. The poster also reveals that the film will release in the wedding season, 20th March 2020.

Title: Photo: Deepika Padukone looks bold and beautiful in her bodacious black attire
Content: Sushant Singh Rajput’s death case is currently being investigated by the Central Bureau Of Investigation (CBI) and they have been questioning a lot of people connected to the late actor. According to the latest report on India Today, three officers who are a part of the probe, have stated that their team has so far not found any evidence that suggests Sushant was murdered on June 14.

Title: Gentleman trailer to be out on January 6
Content: Recently, the CBI called Rhea Chakraborty for the third consecutive day on Sunday to question her in the case of her beau Sushant Singh Rajput's death. The 'Jalebi' actress was questioned by the investigation team for nearly seven hours on Saturday. Rhea and her brother reached the DRDO guest house at Kalina in Santacruz, where the probe team is stationed, around 10.30 am, an official said. Now, according to the Times Now report, the CBI team likely to meet Narcotics Control Bureau unit today.

Title: Telangana: 24 doctors to issue Amarnath yatra fitness certificates
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representational Image

HYDERABAD: The health department has selected a team of 24 specialist doctors to issue compulsory health certificates (CHC) for pilgrims going for Amarnath yatra later this year.

"A list of 24 specialist doctors has been sent by the state health department to Shri Amarnathji Shrine Board already. The 24 doctors from six government hospitals across the state will be issuing certificates free of cost to pilgrims and only certificates issued by the nominated doctors will be valid for taking the pilgrimage," said a highly placed source.

Permissions for issuing these certificates have been given to six government hospitals in five districts across the state. These include Gandhi Hospital and Osmania General Hospital in Hyderabad, Mahabunagar Medical College, Nizamabad Government Hospital, Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Medical Sciences Adilabad and Mahatma Gandhi Memorial Hospital in Warangal. Each hospital will have teams of pulmonary, cardiology and Orthopaedic specialists, who will check each pilgrim.

Children below 13 years of age, elderly over 75 years and pregnant women will not be issued fitness certificates as also anyone having health conditions that will make high-altitude treks and extreme weather risky.

Title: Historian of Mumbai seeks archive-museum for it
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Jim Masselos teaches in Sydney

Mumbai should have a museum of its own where an archive of the city comprising private papers, photographs and ephemera could be built, the noted historian of the metropolis Jim Masselos said on Thursday.

Masselos, whose work ‘Towards Nationalism,’ first published in 1974, is well-known for its discussion of the salient aspects of political and public work in western India in the nineteenth century with a focus on Mumbai and Pune, said when he arrived in the city to do research in the 1960s, his work was made easier by three places where he could make a deep dive into archival sources: the library of the University of Mumbai at its Fort campus, which had stuff going back to the early nineteenth century, the Asiatic Society and the government archives.

He said if an archivebuilding museum were set up, it could help preserve private papers — as distinct from business archives — and ephemera, which otherwise finds no place.

Speaking at a function where a book of “essays in honour of Jim Masselos” titled ‘Bombay Before Mumbai’ was discussed, with its editors Prashant Kidambi, Manjiri Kamat and Rachel Dwyer a part of the conversation, Masselos, who teaches at the University of Sydney , described the art and craft of the historian as being akin to a detective story, where “uncertainty” and “discovery” are important and may yield crucial clues.

On Mumbai losing its past, especially the remnants of its one-time working-class culture, he said, “To lose the past is, for any place, sad. No place retains all of its past, but the best must be preserved.” Mumbai varsity professor Manjiri Kamat cited the closure of Anantashram, an eatery in Khotachi Wadi, as an example of the city losing its past.

Title: Surgical strike failed to demoralise Pak terrorists: Shiv Sena
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

MUMBAI: The Shiv Sena on Friday targeted the Centre by questioning the "efficacy" of the 2016 surgical strike and said the perception that it would demoralise Pakistani terrorists remained an "illusion" as Indian soldiers continue to get killed in terror attacks in Kashmir.

Accusing the Modi government of boasting about how Pakistan was straightened out after the surgical strike, the Sena sought to know whether it has really happened.

It also observed that troubled borders were not good for the country's well-being.

The Sena's remarks come in the wake of the death of an Army soldier from Maharashtra , Naik Sandip Raghunath Sawant, who was killed during a counter-insurgency operation in Jammu and Kashmir on Wednesday.

"The New Year did not begin on a positive note in Kashmir. Our jawan from Satara, Sandip Sawant, attained martyrdom in Kashmir along with two other soldiers. In the last one month, seven to eight jawans from Maharashtra were killed in the line of duty. The Maha Vikas Aghadi government in Maharashtra is not responsible for this," the Sena said in an editorial in party mouthpiece ' Saamana '.

The party also questioned whether the situation in Kashmir has improved after the surgical strike and abrogation of Article 370 provisions.

The party, however, maintained that scrapping Article 370 was a good move.

India had conducted the surgical strike on September 29, 2016, across the Line of Control (LoC) as a response to a terrorist attack on an Indian Army base in Uri sector of Jammu and Kashmir earlier that month.

Without naming the Centre, the Sena alleged, "Circulating news that only the Pakistanis were getting killed in Kashmir will not change the reality as tricolour-draped bodies of Indian soldiers, like Sawant, are reaching their respective villages."

"There is a bloodshed along the Kashmir border and mounting anger among the families of martyred jawans. The perception that surgical strike will demoralise Pakistani terrorists has turned out to be an illusion. In fact, the (terror) attacks have increased," it added.

The Uddhav Thackeray-led party accused the ruling BJP of boasting about straightening out Pakistan after the surgical strike.

"But has Pakistan been really straightened out? Rather Pakistan has been indulging in ceasefire violations along the LoC every day," it added.

The Shiv Sena also questioned the government's claim that the situation in Kashmir was under control after the nullification of Article 370.

"It is good that Article 370 was scrapped. Before that, surgical strike was carried out in Pakistan. But has the situation in Kashmir improved? The terror attacks continue. It's only that there is a control in reporting (these incidents)," it said.

The Sena also alleged that there was no clarity as to what was transpiring in Kashmir after the scrapping of Article 370 and only the media reports of soldiers sacrificing their lives have been coming out from that state

In a veiled attack on the BJP, its erstwhile ally, the Sena, also accused it of exploiting the surgical strike for political gains.

Title: No one called ex-J&K CMs 'anti-national', decision on their release by UT admin: Amit Shah
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

NEW DELHI: No one in the government has ever called the three detained former chief ministers of the erstwhile state of Jammu and Kashmir "anti-national", home minister Amit Shah has said, adding that a decision on their release will be taken by the administration of the union territory.

Farooq Abdullah, Omar Abdullah and Mehbooba Mufti had to be detained for "some time" after they made provocative statements, the home minister said on Thursday night while addressing an event organised by media outlet ABP News.

"Please see the statements made by them, like the entire country will be on fire if Article 370 was touched... In the backdrop of these statements, a professional decision was taken to keep them under detention for sometime," Shah said at the news summit.

Many political leaders in Jammu and Kashmir, including the three former chief ministers, were detained on August 5, the day the Centre announced abrogation of Article 370 provisions and bifurcation of the state into the union territories of Jammu and Kashmir, and Ladakh.

While Farooq Abdullah has been booked under the stringent Public Safety Act and confined to his Gupkar Road residence in Srinagar, which has been declared a sub-jail, his son Omar Abdullah has been detained at Hari Niwas. PDP chief Mufti was lodged at Chesmashahi hut initially but later shifted to a government accommodation.

To a question pointing out that Abdullahs' National Conference and Mufti's PDP were alliance partners of the BJP at some point of time and the leaders were now being labelled "anti-national", the home minister made it clear that neither he nor anyone from the government had called them so.

"As far as the decision to release them is concerned, this decision will be taken by the local administration and not me," he said, adding that the administration will release them whenever it deems suitable.

Shah said the situation in the Kashmir Valley was under control and day-to-day life was going on smoothly.

"Not a single inch in Kashmir is under curfew today," he added.

Title: ‘Make Aarey Metro car shed report public’
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Kirit Somaiya

MUMBAI: BJP leader Kirit Somaiya has alleged that the panel appointed to suggest an alternative site for Metro 3 car shed had suggested that Aarey Colony was the most suitable location. He demanded that the state publish the report immediately.

“Without considering the ground realities, the Uddhav Thackeray-led government has stayed the construction of the car shed. What is the objective behind the stay?” he asked. Somaiya alleged that the land owned by Royal Palms, as recommended by NGO Vanashakti, was being considered as an alternative. “The government will have to give the developer FSI/TDR worth Rs 4,000 crore for a disputed site,” he alleged. But D Stalin, director of Vanashakti said the site was suggested as an option.

A senior bureaucrat said the report is likely to be submitted to the government within a fortnight.

Title: 40% drop in Maoist violence in 2019 in Bastar: Police
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Bastar IG P Sundarraj briefs media in Jagdalpur on Thursday.

RAIPUR: Incidents of Maoist violence have declined by 40% in the Naxal-affected areas of Chattisgarh, including Bastar, and there has been a significant dip in damages to security forces and reduction in loss of lives in the last one year, claims Chhattisgarh police.

According to police, it is because of the three-pronged strategy adopted by the government that this feat has been achieved. Inspector general of police, Bastar range, P Sundarraj, said that in 2019, government's 'Vishwas-Vikas-Suraksha' scheme was highly effective along with the contribution of state police, CRPF, STF, and other forces that led to a decline of 40% in Maoist incidents, 55% decrease in loss of security personnel and 45 per cent drop in civilian deaths in Maoist violence.

In the last one year, seven additional security camps were set up at vacuum locations in the interiors of Chindnar in Dantewada, Chikpal and Potali in Narayanpur, Pusnar and Bodli in Bijapur and Sureli in Kanker.

The top cop said in 2019, 65 bodies of Maoists were recovered during various anti-Maoist operations, including 13 Maoists who were on the level of area committee members or top cadres while 12 of them were from PLGA formation cadres.

In the encounters that took place between security forces and ultras, police recovered arms and ammunition including two SLR, five INSAS, nine .303 rifles and 128 other weapons. Sundarraj said that 475 Maoists were arrested last year, including 45 women cadres and 22 ultras of divisional committee members, area committee members etc.

Over 304 Maoists surrendered in Bastar and were rehabilitated under the state rehabilitation scheme.

IG also shared the figures of other crimes in the division, stating that Bastar has witnessed 30 per cent dip in overall crime and that police will majorly focus on women and child protection in 2020 and would also work towards bringing down the graph of fatal accidents on road.

Title: Kangana Ranaut's sister Rangoli Chandel takes a dig at Ranveer Singh: People with rich parents who have access to connections and opportunities don’t qualify as outsiders
Content:
People with rich parents who have access to connections and opportunities don’t qualify as outsiders, people coming… https://t.co/Z4jXe0dpw7 — Rangoli Chandel (@Rangoli_A) 1578029767000

(Contd)... because of these three factors even though they have huge talent and competence are the ones who need sp… https://t.co/cdBTxFz3Dg — Rangoli Chandel (@Rangoli_A) 1578029806000

Kangana Ranaut’s sister Rangoli Chandel is known to speak her mind on social media and today she raised the topic of nepotism in Bollywood . When a user shared a picture of Ranveer Singh Ranbir Kapoor and Sonam Kapoor attending a birthday party as kids, Rangoli commented that Ranveer is no outsider in the industry. “People with rich parents who have access to connections and opportunities don’t qualify as outsiders, people coming from small villages who can’t speak English and studied in small schools, have no money to buy fancy clothes and treated badly. Because of these three factors even though they have huge talent and competence are the ones who need special attention and our compassion, let’s empower the underprivileged,” shared Rangoli.Several Twitter users pointed out that it was common knowledge that Ranveer was no outsider in Bollywood but was indeed a cousin of Sonam Kapoor. The ‘Neerja’ actress’ maternal grandmother and Ranveer’s paternal grandfather are siblings; hence the two Bollywood celebrities are second cousins.

Title: HC to Telangana govt: Where's plan & design for new Secretariat
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Various departments had shifted out of Secretariat in August 2018

HYDERABAD: Wondering whether the state government, which has been claiming that its hands have become tight due to lack of funds, will now be able to take up and complete its new secretariat complex as was planned earlier, the Telangana high court on Thursday directed the state R&B department's principal secretary to inform the court the plan and design of the proposed new secretariat complex, the money required for it and the time within which it would be completed within five days

The bench of chief justice Raghavendra Singh Chauhan and Justice A Abhishek Reddy gave this direction while hearing a batch of PILs that challenged the state cabinet's decision to demolish the current secretariat and build a new secretariat complex in its place.

The bench referred to a report published in TOI where in the state was seen asking its officials and employees to spend as less as possible in view of the tight financial position. The bench also referred to the incomplete stage of the cabinet decision taken on February 18 that proposed to eithe++r to modify the existing secretariat or to raise a new construction altogether. It also referred to the shifting of secretariat departments to various other places.

Additional advocate general J Ramachandra Rao informed the bench that the state had appointed a cabinet sub committee and an experts committee to study the issue and make suggestions. The experts committee favoured the demolition of the existing structure and build a new structure in the same place.

"We could not move forward since the high court ordered a stay on the process," he said. The bench reminded him that the stay was only on the demolition of the existing structure and not on the decision making process.

Upon being informed that the departments in the secretariat have already been moved out and that they have been reinstalled in various parts of the city, the bench wondered whether that would not compromise the confidentiality of certain sensitive files. The state counsel informed the bench that 70% of the departments were accommodated in the adjacent BRK Bhavan and the remaining departments, heads of departments and even the concerned ministers were accommodated in Tarnaka and few other parts of the city.

The bench reminded the state that huge structures will take decades to be completed and running the departments till then may affect file movements and that there is a danger of some of them landing in the wrong hands and some confidential files being intercepted. The case was posted to January 7 for further hearing.

Title: amit panghal: How sparring with international boxers helped Olympic medal contender Amit Panghal
Content:
Amit Panghal.

Mai apne deshwasion ko Olymics mein niraash nahi karunga. Medal leke jarur aunga

NEW DELHI: Star Indian boxer Amit Panghal ended 2019 on a high. A gold medal at the Asian Championships, Silver at the World Championships and then captaining the Gujarat Giants franchise to a title win in the inaugural Indian Boxing League at the Indira Gandhi Stadium in New Delhi. After the likes of Akhil Kumar, Vijender Singh , Vikas Krishan, Shiva Thapa and others, 24-year-old Panghal from Rohtak has emerged as India's big boxing star and is being tagged as a top medal contender for the Tokyo Olympics later this year.(I won’t let the people of my country down at the Olympics. Will surely bring an Olympic medal back home)” Panghal told Timesofindia.com in an exclusive interview after guiding Gujarat Giants to a title victory in the recently concluded Indian Boxing League.Gujarat Giants, led by captain Panghal, pulled off a thrilling 4-3 victory over Punjab Panthers in a nail-biting final."I am really happy that I contributed for my team and guided them to victory. The title win is a confidence booster for me ahead of the major tournaments and the Olympics as well,” Panghal said."I have learnt a lot from the league. It was a different experience altogether. Interacting with foreign coaches and sparring with boxers from all around the world helped me a lot. Sparring with international boxers taught me a lot. It was the biggest take away for me from the league," Panghal, who became the first male boxer from India to win a silver medal at the World Championships at Ekaterinburg in Russia in September 2019, said."Every boxer has a different technique and approach when he enters the ring. When other boxers share those experiences and thoughts with you, it helps you to improve your game as well. That’s what this league has taught all of us," he said."I would say this (Indian Boxing League) is a big platform for all boxers, especially youngsters. They can come and learn. Winning and losing is secondary," he added.Panghal's biggest target now to try and qualify for the Tokyo Olympics."My focus is now on the Asia-Oceania tournament (in Wuhan, China from February 3 to February 14). The tournament is also the qualifying tournament (boxing) for the 2020 Olympics in Tokyo,""The best part is that my elder brother was also a boxer. He has helped me a lot in my career. Whatever I am today, it is because of his sacrifice. The only thing on my mind right now is the Olympics," Panghal told TimesofIndia.com."I am prepared for every challenge. I have trained hard and had a good year (2019) too. I am sure I will do well at the Asia-Oceania (tournament). All I want is to win an Olympic medal for my country," Panghal signed off.

Title: Photos: Varun Dhawan goes blonde for 'Street Dancer 3D'
Content: As the release date for Remo D'Souza 's dance drama nears, the star cast of the film is on a promotional spree. The film that stars Varun Dhawan Nora Fatehi and Prabhudeva in leads is a sequel to 'ABCD' franchise.From promoting the film on various platforms, from small screens to media houses, the makers are not leaving any stone unturned to make the film's release a big hit. Of late, one of the songs from the film, 'Garmi' was released and fans just can't get enough of the song and Nora's hot moves.As in the movie, Varun, Shraddha, Nora portray professional dancers, they went through a make-over to get into the skin of the character and accordingly, Varun had donned a new look to suit his character. He shared a few glimpses of his look where he is flaunting his new blonde hair-do.He shared a series of pictures with blonde hair, which he had done for the film. In one of the pictures, we can see the number '24' carved behind his ear, which is the release date of the film. In another picture, we can see a few more tattoos made behind his neck.Produced by Bhushan Kumar Divya Khosla Kumar , Krishan Kumar and Lizelle D'Souza, the film releases on 24th of January, 2020.

Title: Speeding car crushes two in Bijnor
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

BIJNOR: Two persons, including a 12-year-old boy, died on Thursday morning after a speeding car hit them in Bijnor.

The accident took place in Sahaspur Dehat area under the Seohara police station limits on Wednesday night when the duo was crossing a road. A few passers-by, who witnessed the accident, caught the driver of the car and handed him over to the police.

The duo was then admitted at a hospital in Moradabad where they succumbed to their injuries.

The deceased were identified as Kadir Ahmed (60) and Umair (12) of Sahaspur Dehat under Seohara police station area. Umair was the only child. His father is settled in Saudi Arab. Station house officer of Seohara police station Uday Pratap Singh told TOI "We have caught the driver. He has been booked under relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code."

Title: Four Haryana men behind Manpreet Singh Manna's murder: SIT
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

BATHINDA: The special investigation team (SIT) working on the case of Malout resident and history-sheeter Manpreet Singh Manna's murder on December 2, 2019, has named four Haryana residents as the accused in the crime. Working on leads provided by gangsters Lawrence Bishnoi and Rohit Godara, Muktsar police has named Rajan of Jhanjheri village near in Kurukshetra, Kapil of Dabla village in Jhajjar , Rajesh alias Kanda of Dhani Khera village in Bhiwani and Rahul, also from Haryana, in the case.

SIT has claimed that Lawrence was the main conspirator in the killing of Manna, 37, while Rohit arranged weapons and the other four executed the killing. All four killers have cases pending against them in Haryana, Rajasthan and Delhi.

Lawrence was brought on production warrants from Bharatpur jail in Rajasthan and Rohit from Churu jail, also in Rajasthan. Both will be produced in court on Friday on expiry of their police remand.

Muktsar senior superintendent of police (SSP) Raj Bachan Singh Sandhu and SIT head SP (investigations) Gurmail Singh said Lawrence had told his interrogators that he suspected Manna of providing information to police about his friend Ankit Bhadu, who was at large in some cases, which led to Bhadu's killing in an encounter at Zirakpur.

Title: Amol Palekar performs in the city
Content: The CBI has been investigating in Bollywood actor's Sushant Singh Rajput's mysterious demise since the day they got a green signal from the Supreme Court. While several revelations have been made in the case, Sandeep Ssingh's connection with Sushant has become a mystery of its own.

Title: US accident victim Charitha Reddy's organs harvested, to save 9 lives
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Charitha Reddy

HYDERABAD: Nine viable organs for transplantation have been harvested from the body of Hyderabad girl Charitha Reddy who died in a road accident in Michigan, US.

"She is a real hero and will be with us forever in different places. I am really proud of my sister. Nine viable organs have been retrieved successfully. All your prayers and support and Charitha's helping nature is about to save nine lives. Thank you all for your continuous support," said Jayanthi Ganugupathi, a cousin of 25-year-old Charitha.

Charitha, who worked for a software company in the US, died on December 28 in a car accident. Jayanthi, who lives in Dallas, Texas, informed on the GoFundMe page, which was kicked off to collect donations for Charitha's body to be sent to India, said on Thursday that autopsy had been completed.

"The autopsy has been completed and the human remains have been moved to Chicago. We are going to collect all the paperwork from Muskegon county and will be going to Indian consulate in Chicago," Jayanthi said.

The organs for transplantation were harvested at the 'Gift of Life' centre in Michigan. According to its website, about 3,000 very sick Michigan residents are waiting for organ transplants and a new shot at life.

Gift of Life Michigan, headquartered in Ann Arbor, is the state's federally designated organ and tissue recovery program.

Title: Our successes in space exploration should be mirrored in new frontier of deep sea: PM Modi
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

PM Narendra Modi (Credits:ANI)

BENGALURU: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday stated that India's success in space exploration should now be "mirrored in the new frontier of the deep sea."

"Our successes in space exploration should now be mirrored in the new frontier of the deep sea. We need to explore, map and responsibly harness the vast oceanic resources of water, energy, food and minerals," Prime Minister Modi said here while addressing the 107th session of Indian Science Congress.

He added, "We know from science that the potential energy , the silent form of energy, can move mountains by its conversion to the kinetic energy of motion. Can we build a science in motion?"

The Prime Minister also mentioned that India "must also develop a long term roadmap for sustainable and environment-friendly transportation."

"Another important point I wish to make is the significance of 'Make in India' in medical devices to bring the fruits of advances in diagnostics to our people. Mahatma Gandhi once said, 'It is health that is the real wealth and not pieces of gold and silver'," the Prime Minister said.

In order to promote well being, we should not only practice some of the tested traditional wisdom but also continuously enlarge its scope by introducing the modern tools and concepts of contemporary biomedical research, he said.

"Our vision should be to protect people from the threats of dangerous communicable diseases like Nipah and Ebola. We must work overtime to fulfill the promise to eradicate TB by 2025. Globally, India is the leader in the supply of vaccines. We aim to develop India as a world-class 100 billion dollar bio manufacturing hub by 2024. This will happen with the right policy initiatives and support to innovative research, human resource development, and enterprise," Modi said.

In a message to young scientists, Prime Minister Modi said, "My motto for the young scientists in this country has been - 'Innovate, Patent, Produce and Prosper'. These four steps will lead our country towards faster development."

Title: Samsung Galaxy Book Flex α 2-in-1 with 10th generation Intel Core Processor announced
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

NEW DELHI: South Korean tech giant Samsung has announced its latest Galaxy Book Flex α (alpha), a new variant of Galaxy Book Flex ahead of CES 2020 . The company claims that the device offers long-lasting battery and immersive OLED display.

The Samsung Galaxy Book Flex α features a 13.3-inch OLED display with ultra-thin bezels. The 2-in-1 device also offers support for Active Pen which will help the user in multitasking. The company also claims that the laptop will offer a battery backup of 17.5 hours and it comes with a fast charging facility.

Weighing 1.19kg, the device features sharp, diamond-cut edges and a crisp, durable aluminum frame. It is powered by a 10th generation Intel Core processor and comes with built-in biometric credentialing. The laptop comes with 8GB/12GB of RAM and 256GB/512GB of internal storage. The company has priced the device at $829.99 and it will go on sale in the first half of 2020 in the US.

Apart from this, Samsung will also be making some interesting announcements at the upcoming tech trade show CES 2020. The company has scheduled an event for January 6, 2020, where H.S. Kim, president and CEO of Consumer Electronics Division at Samsung Electronics will deliver a keynote. The event will focus on How will seamlessly connected devices enabled by AI, cutting-edge semiconductor chipsets and 5G present new experiences and change our lives?

Apart from this, it is also expected that the company might showcase its first ever 8K OLED TV at the event. It is also expected that these new TVs from Samsung will flaunt a bezel less design.

Title: Start-up idea on your mind? Read these books to make your business successful
Content:
Zero to One: Note on Startups, or How to Build the Future by Peter Thiel and Blake Masters This book is popular almost all over the world and is considered a good guide for those who are yet to begin setting up their start-up. It highlights the importance of not copying the big names in their respective fields but learning the skills of business from them which will make your start-up grow from scratch. It is a thought-provoking book that will help you in developing the right approach as an entrepreneur.

Before You Start Up: How to Prepare to Make Your Startup Dream a Reality by Pankaj Goyal Here is another good book that you can pick up if you have not yet laid the foundation of your start-up but it has been on your mind for a long time. It is ideal for those who want to do something big in their lives on their own but have no knowledge of how to do business. It will guide you on how to look for a right team and train them towards the common goal, talking to your family to get the right mental support, taking care of your finances when your business is yet to return profits and other important things that you need to know before your business idea flourishes.

The Lean Startup: How Constant Innovation Creates Radically Successful Businesses by Eric Ries This is another good book that one must read to get better in leadership skills and succeed in business. It highlights the importance of innovation in business that will help you in gaining an edge over your competitors. This book lists down various reasons that will tell you that always sticking to the conventional business practices might not be good for you in the long run if you want your start-up idea to succeed. Also, it will help you in developing the right approach and keep yourself ready with backup plans as you might have to change your strategy at any moment.

Startup Easy - Part 1: The Essentials by Shishir Gupta This is another popular guide for entrepreneurs that you can buy online. The simple language and relatable examples is the highlight of this book. Besides businessmen, this book is even considered beneficial for those who are in a job to get the right mindset for growth and get a promotion at work. The author of this book is an Investment Banker for start-ups, so he has a wide experience in the problems and issues faced by start-up owners while setting up and during the initial stages of a start-up.

The $100 Startup: Fire Your Boss, Do What You Love and Work Better To Live More by Chris Guillebeau The title and the sub-title of this book is capable enough to catch the attention of almost every one who is planning to quit the job and set up a start-up. This book will help you in breaking the traditional concept of doing a job to pay your bills. This book has inputs from 50 ordinary people who set up their start-ups under just $100 and have been successful in running their business to inspire you that you do not need to use a huge fund if you want to get your start-up into a functional situation.

Entrepreneur 5 P.M. to 9 A.M.: Launching a Profitable Start-Up without Quitting Your Job by Kanth Miriyala and Reethika Sunder This book on start-ups is suitable for those who are in no mood of quitting their regular jobs yet want to set up an additional mode of income through their new business venture. This book has flowcharts, illustrations and facts that have been listed down clearly to make sure that you are easily able to understand the mechanism of running a new business. The book highlights that it is possible to set up a start-up without leaving your job if you plan everything well and execute it perfectly. It is even for those who had ever had an idea to start a small business but did not do that because of his/ her full-time jobs.

Almost everyone these days thinks of setting up a start-up. The reason can be anything ranging from getting an additional source of income with a regular job, creating a financial backup for running income or having a business mindset. It is a wise choice to do some study about start-ups so that you do not end up failing badly.If you are planning to set up a start-up, here is a list of some of the most popular books that are considered ideal for start-up owners:-DISCLAIMER: The Times of India's journalists were not involved in the production of this article.

Title: Infographic: Russian oil production hits post-Soviet high
Content: Russia’s crude oil and condensate output hits a post-Soviet high last year even as it curbed production under an agreement with OPEC. Russia produced 560.2 million tons of oil in 2019, up 0.8% from the previous year, preliminary data from the energy ministry showed. Under the OPEC+ deal, Russia pledged to cut output by 228,000 barrels a day from the October 2018 baseline of 11.4 million barrels a day. That allocation will change this month after OPEC and its allies agreed in December to deepen their cut. Saudi Arabian energy minister Prince Abdulaziz bin Salman has urged the laggards in the deal to carry their share of the burden. The kingdom is making the deepest cuts in the group. Russia has agreed to deepen its reductions by 70,000 barrels a day to about 300,000 a day in the first quarter. Here's a look.

Title: Delhi to get Captain Vikram Batra square
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

DHARAMSHALA/DELHI: Delhi's Mukarba square and the flyover adjacent to it will be named after Kargil martyr Captain Vikram Batra.

It will be known as as Shaheed Captain Vikram Batra Chowk.

This was a long-pending demand of the martyr's septuagenarian father, Girdhari Lal Batra, who is a resident of Palampur area of Himachal Pradesh . He also wanted the story of the braveheart to be included in the school curriculum.

"Delhi chief minister's office conveyed the decision of renaming the square to me on Wednesday. I am flying to Delhi on Friday to take part in the ceremony scheduled for 11 am on Saturday," said the martyr's father, who is a retired teacher. Capt Batra died during the operation to capture Point 5140 (know known as Batra Top) on the morning of July 7, 1999, at the age of 25.

Mukarba Chowk is one of the most important junctions in the country. Naming the chowk as well as the flyover after Captain Vikram Batra who was martyred during the Kargil War in 1999, could inspire people of Delhi and those who come to Delhi," Deputy chief minister Manish Sisodia had said on Tuesday.

That's Salman Khan keeping it casual at a photoshoot. He turns 54 today. Generations have gone by loving him and hating him. Title: Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah update January 2: Bhide has a surprise for Gokuldham residents
Content: In the latest episode of Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah Jethalal wishes Gopal bhai a happy new year over the phone. Bapu Ji comes there and wishes him, too. Jethalal tells Bapu Ji he has received many messages on his phone for the new year due to free service, and he won't be able to reply to them. Bapu Ji asks him not to take stress, and blesses him. Jethalal tells Bapu Ji to bless him specially for money as last year his business didn't do so well.Bapu Ji asks the latter to now focus on doing 'kasrat', and go for a walk. But Jethalal tells him that he is dressed up for work and won't be able to start right now. Bapu Ji asks him not to cook up an excuse and leave for his shop. Just when Jethalal is about to go, Bapu ji stops him for breakfast. He asks Jethalal to call Abdul and get ketchup for their sandwiches. When Abdul doesn't pick up, Jethalal offers to get it himself.The scene shifts to Mehta's house, where Anjali finds him busy writing poetry. She complains that he doesn't write anything for her. Mehta praises her through his poetry. She gets so impressed that she decides to frame the paper in which he has written the poem. She finds it blank. Mehta tells her that it is written on his heart. An impressed Anjali decides to make Rajwadi chai and masaledar Punjabi food for him.Elsewhere, Bhide is elated as Madhavi has also cooked a delicacy for him. The two wish each other a new year, and then Madhavi gets ladoo for him. She asks him to close his eyes and offers to feed it herself. She pranks him by making him eat a mirchi instead of ladoo. Bhide tells her that even the mirchi served by her is sweet for him. He then gets to eat ladoo. Bhide tries to get romantic with Madhavi but she runs away.Bhide then spots something in the newspaper. He decides to give a surprise to Gokuldham residents with the help of Popat. He goes to the compound and accidentally bumps into Jethalal. He tells him about the surprise vaguely and then writes the thought of the day on the board. Jethalal asks the meaning of what he has written on the board. Bhide explains it to him. In his house, Popat is seen placing a calendar on the wall with the help of a stool. Bhide calls him out, which makes him lose his balance. Bhide runs to catch him.
