Title: President Gotabaya Rajapaksa inaugurates Sri Lanka Parliament
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

COLOMBO: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Friday emphasised on stronger ties with all countries and outlined his government's vision as he inaugurated the fourth sessions of the Parliament, a month after he prorogued the House following his victory in the presidential elections. The parliament was to meet on December 3, but President Rajapaksa prorogued it for one month and fixed January 3 for the commencement of the next session.

He attended the parliament for the first time as he had never been a member of parliament. The president chose to be attired in European suit, a deviation from all five of his male predecessors who always wore the traditional national dress.

In his ceremonial address, the president recalled his family's long association with the assembly and explained that although he was not wearing the family trademark maroon coloured shawl with national dress which claimed to represent the peasants from the deep southern region of Giruwapattuwa, he still had their interests as a priority of his administration.

The president outlined his government's vision for efficiency, eradication of corruption and crime with accelerated infrastructure development to revive the local economy.

He told the assembly that electoral and constitutional reform would be needed to make Sri Lanka a progressive state. "The executive presidency must be strengthened to leave no room for extremist politics", he said.

He said that he wants stronger relations with all countries as the foreign policy of his government. "We will not fall on our knees before any foreign nation," he said.

Gotabaya Rajapaksa, 70, a former military officer, was sworn in as Sri Lanka's seventh President on November 18 after he defeated the ruling party candidate Sajith Premadasa by more than 13 lakh votes, marking the return of the powerful Rajapaksa dynasty.

He named his elder brother and former strongman Mahinda Rajapaksa as the new prime minister after Ranil Wickremesinghe of the United National Party resigned from the post following the election debacle.

The 74-year-old leader will function as the prime minister of the caretaker cabinet until the general election in 2020.

Gotabaya Rajapaksa is widely expected to dissolve the current assembly by early March to set dates for a fresh parliamentary election end of April or early May.

Title: Mandsaur: SUV-truck collision kills 1, injures 8 on foggy morning
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

SUV met with an accident on Friday morning.

INDORE: A woman was killed and eight persons sustained critical injuries when an SUV they were travelling in collided with a truck head-on in Mandsaur district on Friday morning.

"The accident took place due to low visibility caused by intense fog on the Daloda-Afalpur road," police said.

Nandi Bai Patidar, 60, a resident of Bhavgarh, was killed on the spot, police said adding that eight others –- Radha Bai, 65, Ramu, 45, Manisha, 30, Ganga Bai, 40, Mangilal Rameshwar, 65, Sanjay, 40, Mangilal Shyamlal, 30 and Gayatri, 30 –- sustained critical injuries and were rushed to a nearby hospital.

Police have registered a case against the truck driver who fled after the accident.

Title: PM Narendra Modi praises Ambikapur students' anti-plastic campaign
Content:
Students of Holy Cross Convent Senior Secondary School collect chocolate and chips wrappers and turn them into... Read More

Great work by our young students. Such efforts will increase awareness on reducing single use plastic. https://t.co/poBdxPUkXI — Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) 1577882476000

RAIPUR: In the town that gave India the novel concept of 'Garbage Cafe' - food in exchange of plastic waste - it's children who are powering the Swachh campaign. Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday tweeted his praise for an initiative by students of a school in Ambikapur, Chhattisgarh, to curb single-use plastic.A city of less than 2 lakh, Ambikapur had jumped 15 positions in the 2018 Swachh Survey to become the second cleanest city in the country. One of the reasons for its success, evidently, is that it catches them young.Students of Holy Cross Convent Senior Secondary School collect chocolate and chips wrappers and turn them into artwork or stuff them in carboard boxes and send them back to the manufacturers along with a letter of appeal to stop using plastic.Modi lauded the kids and tweeted: "Great work by our young students. Such efforts will increase awareness on reducing single-use plastic."Sister Gerald, the school principal, told TOI that they have an inhouse eco-club, which takes up environment-friendly activities. "The initiative against plastic was taken up under the same club, with teachers helping students. They have been at it for a year and never give up, no matter what the odds. They have got recognition now. The children are extremely excited after PM Modi's tweet and they are all over the news. Our students will continue the campaign."The initiative began with students going around their neighbourhood to collect plastic wrappers and single-use items, which they turned into Christmas and New Year decorations. They also used it for classroom craftwork and creative activities. At the same time, they started sending empty packets of eatables to the companies, urging them to move to eco-friendly packaging.PM Modi's tweet sparked euphoria at the school. One of the students told local mediapersons: "Sometimes, it was a thankless pursuit. Few people appreciated us. But we persisted. Now, Prime Minister Modi's praise has injected new energy to our campaign as the whole country knows about us."Explaining how the thought that started the campaign, he said: "After munching on chips, we wondered what to with the plastic. Manufacturers should either recycle plastic wrappers or not use them at all."Ambikapur is one of the flag-bearers of the Swachh drive, modernizing garbage collection and disposal and incentivizing better disposal of garbage, especially plastic waste. It has the country's first digital garbage management system and the first to open a Garbage Cafe, where you can get a full meal in exchange of 1kg of plastic waste. This small town has a plant that turns plastic waste into granules, which are used in various construction works. A 1.5-km-long road has been made entirely of plastic granules.

Title: Climate change and deforestation may eliminate Madagascar's rainforest habitat: Study
Content:
Madagascar forest cover.

NEW YORK: The combined effects of climate change and deforestation could decimate Madagascar 's eastern rainforest habitat by 2070, impacting thousands of plants, mammals, reptiles, and amphibians endemic to the island nation, according to a study.The research, published in the journal Nature Climate Change , also found that protected areas will help to mitigate this devastation while environmentalists work towards long-term solutions for ending runaway greenhouse gas emissions.Madagascar - a biodiversity hotspot where 80 to 90 per cent of animal and plant species are exclusive to the area - has been devasted by decades of deforestation and over-harvesting, according to the researchers from the City University of New York (CUNY) in the US.The activities have destroyed much of the land cover that provides habitat for a variety of unique animals, including currently endangered varieties of lemurs, they said.The researchers noted that two species of ruffed lemurs, in particular, are now critically endangered.These animals play a central role in dispersing the seeds of a number of plant species that provide food and shelter for other animals across the rainforest."Because of their essential role as seed dispersers and their sensitivity to habitat degradation, ruffed lemurs serve as a critical indicator of the health of Madagascar's entire eastern rainforest," said Andrea Baden, a professor at CUNY."When we projected the impact of deforestation and climate change, we found that deforestation alone and climate change alone could reduce ruffed lemur habitat by over 50 per cent."Even more alarming, these two factors together are projected to essentially decimate suitable rainforest habitat by the end of the century," Baden said.The researchers suggest that the speed and intensity of destruction to Madagascar's eastern rainforest will be greatly determined by whether the country institutes strict protections against deforestation or a relaxed set of policies.Protecting forested areas that provide shelter to ruffed lemurs and serve as corridor links to their strongholds is particularly important to survival, the researchers said.This is due to their role as a keystone species that enables the survival of a large number of animal and plant species in one of the world's most biodiverse regions, they said."The results from our study will be useful to nonprofit organisations, park management, and the broader conservation community," Baden said."Our results indicate potential conservation opportunities for ruffed lemurs and any of the rainforest-dwellers that rely on forest cover and connectivity. Protected areas are vital to species persistence," he said.

Title: Donald Trump Tweets in 2019: Donald Trump sent out these many tweets in 2019
Content:
US president Donald Trump tweeted a whopping 7,700 times, which averages to about 21 tweets a day. ​December 1... Read More

So sorry to hear the news about Jeff Bozo being taken down by a competitor whose reporting, I understand, is far mo… https://t.co/ihKoPOyQZZ — Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) 1547430310000

I believe that if people stoped using or subscribing to @ATT, they would be forced to make big changes at @CNN, whi… https://t.co/dPeDxve94G — Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) 1559559033000

If there was ever any doubt that US president Donald Trump loves Twitter , then these numbers will absolutely quell them. According to a report by The New York Post, Trump tweeted a whopping 7,700 times, which averages to about 21 tweets a day.December 12, however, was a special day even by Trump’s prolific standards on Twitter. On that particular day, the US president sent out as many as a whopping 123 tweets in 24 hours. Trump, according to the report, sent out twice the number of tweets he had in 2018. In 2018, he had tweeted about 3,600 times.Some of his notable tweets, including the time when he called the world’s richest man a “bozo”. Trump tweeted in reference to a newspaper reporting negative stuff about Amazon founder Jeff Bezos. Trump had tweeted, “So sorry to hear the news about Jeff Bozo being taken down by a competitor whose reporting, I understand, is far more accurate than the reporting in his lobbyist newspaper, the Amazon Washington Post. Hopefully the paper will soon be placed in better & more responsible hands!”In March, he also called on all Americans to boycott one of the biggest telecom service provider in the country.“I believe that if people stoped [sic] using or subscribing to @ATT, they would be forced to make big changes at @CNN, which is dying in the ratings anyway,” Trump had tweeted on March 6.And then there was also a tweet about not ‘6G’. “I want 5G, and even 6G, technology in the United States as soon as possible. It is far more powerful, faster, and smarter than the current standard. American companies must step up their efforts, or get left behind. There is no reason that we should be lagging behind on………”Not on Twitter but 2019 was also the year when Trump referred to Apple CEO Tim Cook as “Tim Apple”.

Title: Tamil Nadu rural local body election results: Panchayat president chosen by lot
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

MADURAI: A panchayat president was chosen by drawing lots in a village in Ramanathapuram district on Friday, following a tie between two candidates after the elections results were declared.

Both Saraswathi and Panchavalli who had contested for the post of president of the Mayankulam panchayat in Tirupulani union got 664 votes at the end of counting.

Following this, lots were drawn, and Saraswathi was declared elected.

Title: From Deepika Padukone to Kareena Kapoor: Stylish winter coats and jackets Bollywood celebs are wearing this season
Content: Who says winter wear can't be stylish? With quirky fits and bold colours, there's a lot to experiment with winter fashion. With the on-going sale and online offers, it's time to brush up your winter style for 2020. With so many options available, we know it can be quite challenging to pick the perfect piece. From puffer coats to comfy jackets, here's how you can make your winter wardrobe as stylish as the B-town ladies.Kareena Kapoor Khan is currently in Switzerland with her family. She was spotted wearing a bomber jacket with colourful floral print, which gave us major vintage vibes.Oversized jackets work well on petite and lean bodies. Title: No money to maintain Mamallapuram, says Tamil Nadu government
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

The issue pertains to a PIL to ensure proper maintenance of monuments in Mamallapuram, which were renovated re... Read More

CHENNAI: The Tamil Nadu government on Thursday informed the Madras high court that Mamallapuram administration lacks funds to carry out appropriate work to maintain monuments at the heritage site.

“ASI is collecting major revenue at the rate of ₹40 per Indian tourist and ₹600 per foreign visitor and therefore, if they can do some funding to the town panchayat, they would be in a better position for undertaking such maintenance work in the tourist places of Mamallapuram," advocate general Vijay Narayan said.

The issue pertains to a suo motu PIL initiated by the court based on a note made by Justice N Kirubakaran to ensure proper maintenance of monuments and other places in Mamallapuram which were renovated recently for the informal Indo-China summit.

When the plea came up for hearing on Thursday before a division bench of Justice Vineet Kothari and Justice R Suresh Kumar, the DGP filed a status report informing the court that a separate wing comprising of a sub- inspector of police and four constables well versed in English has been formed and is functioning in Mamallapuram police station exclusively to deal with complaints from foreigners. In a separate counter, the district administration submitted that an average of 2,000 tourists on normal days and an average 10,000 during the weekends, and on holidays and an average of 50,000 tourists throng Mamallapuram during the special holidays and festival days. Admitting that hawkers have resurfaced in the area and on path to beach even after mass drive in coordination with revenue and police officials, the authorities said that they have strong patronage of tourists.

Recording the submissions, the bench directed the authorities to give the list of the recognized NGO’s , recognized guides working in the area besides other recognized volunteers, who can undertake peer review system for maintaining cleanliness and upkeep of the monuments and other places in Mamallapuram and posted the plea to January 21 for further hearing.

Title: Malaika Arora stuns in a sparkly sequin dress with a deep plunging neckline; view pics
Content:
Malaika Arora stuns in a sparkly sequin dress with a deep plunging neckline; view pics

Malaika Arora is one fashionista to look ou for and she never marks to make our heads turn with her stylish outings. Be it her casual day out look, gym outfits or red carpet appearances, the actress knows how to make her followers drool. The star is an avid social media user and enjoys a massive fan following. Whenever she shares any pictures, they go viral in no time and her fans go gaga over them!Recently, the diva took to her Instagram handle to share a series of photos of herself and we are all hearts. In this photo, the actress opted for a beige dress replete with sequin work. Her dress had a steep neckline with bishop sleeves and an inverted-V hem. More than her outfit, what caught our attention is the way she styled it. Her hair was styled in loose beach waves with a matching headband. Her social media is filled with pictures and videos of her regular yoga practices and gym sessions that motivate her followers.Apart from her stylish fashion outings, the actress has been making headlines for her relationship with 'Panipat' actor Arjun Kapoor. On New Year, the star shared an adorable photo with her beau on Instagram. She was seen planting a peck on Arjun's cheek. Picture Courtesy: Malaika Arora Instagram

Title: Tamil Nadu rural body elections: DMK complains over result delay
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

DMK president MK Stalin (File Photo)

CHENNAI: The DMK on Friday continued to present complaints against state election officials for not releasing results of rural local body polls.

DMK president M K Stalin met state election commissioner R Palaniswami twice on Thursday and on Friday. DMK's parliamentary party leader TR Baalu called on chief minister Edappaddi K Palaniswami and asked him to release the results in several panchayats in Karur, Tiruvallur and Ramanathapuram districts.

“We have been asking the SEC to work without showing any support to the AIADMK but it is not happening. I don’t want to criticise the SEC but cannot remain silent,” Baalu told reporters.

Baalu said in several wards in these districts, candidates of DMK and its alliance parties have won.

“The counting in all these places was completed last night. But the officials are not ready to announce the results as the winner belongs to DMK or its alliance parties. Our party cadres are present in the counting hall since last night and in some places they are protesting,” said Baalu.

The DMK MP said the party will approach the Madras high court to issue an order asking the SEC to act.

Title: Vadinamma update, January 2: Bharat decides to fulfill Siri’s dream
Content: In the latest episode of Vadinamma Bharat pulls Siri ’s leg for boasting about her driving talent before the family members. She breaks into tears complaining that he hasn’t supported her. He quickly apologises and promises to teach her bike riding.Next morning, Bharat meets Siri at the ground and teaches her the basics of bike riding. During the practice session, she falls down from the bike and gets hurt. But she lies to Bharat about the same fearing that he wouldn’t teach her anymore. Meanwhile, Nani captures Bharat coaching Siri and reveals it to Raghu and Sita . They are surprised realizing why the two were lying to them and going out of late. They decide to pretend to be ignorant of this fact and tease the couple.As Bharat and Siri return to the house, Raghu along with Sita and Nani pull their leg. Bharat and Siri initially try to bluff but later the former admits that he has been coaching her all the while. Raghu and Sita appreciate Bharat.At night, Bharat finds Siri sleep talking about her bike riding experience. He wakes her up and she tells him that driving a bike alone has been her unfulfilled dream. Bharat realises that she needs a bike right away. Meanwhile, Raghu also convinces Sita into buying a new bike so that everyone at home can use it.Bharat later finds Siri’s hand to be wounded. He understands that she lied to him.

Title: Controversy at Ranji: Shubman Gill argues with umpire after being given 'out', match vs Delhi halted for 10 minutes
Content:
Play halted after Shubman Gill's controvercial dismissal. (TOI photo)

MOHALI: Rising star of Indian cricket Shubman Gill was embroiled in a controversy when his dismissal was overturned after an argument with the on-field umpire during Punjab's Ranji Trophy encounter against Delhi on Friday, leading to stoppage of play for around 10 minutes.The current white-ball captain of the India A team refused to leave the crease after he was adjudged caught-behind by slow medium bowler Subodh Bhati. An argument with the umpire followed and the batsman was reinstated after a discussion between the on-field officials.Showing dissent to the umpire's decision is a breach of the 'Code of Conduct' and there is a possibility that match referee P Ranganathan will have a word with the player. He could either be let off with a warning or charged with a Level 1 offence.Gill was batting on 10 then. He didn't last long as he edged one off Simarjeet Singh to Anuj Rawat for 23 off 41 balls with the team's score on 60."The straight umpire (Mohammed Rafi) had adjudged Shubman caught behind and the batsman then walked up to the umpire and was seen having an argument asking him to reverse his decision. The straight umpire then consulted the square-leg umpire (Paschim Pathak) and reversed his decision," Delhi team manager Vivek Khurana told PTI.Asked if there was any plan for a walk-out by the visiting side, Khurana denied any such move."Our vice-captain (Nitish) Rana just asked the umpires as to why they overturned the initial decision. We never walked out. The match referee (Ranganathan) came in and play resumed as usual," Khurana added.DDCA general secretary Vinod Tihara said: "The match was halted for seven to eight minutes. There was nothing untoward. Our boys felt that Gill was out and that's why they asked the umpires why the decision was reversed. We are not filing any official complaint as the matter is closed for us."Senior Punjab Cricket Association official GS Walia said Gill didn't use any cuss words during his argument with the umpire."He just told the umpire that he had not nicked the ball. All of us have seen Shubman, he is a very polite and calm boy," Walia said.Any decision on a sanction by the match referee will only be announced after the fourth day's play.

Title: Naagin 4: Nia Sharma looks sensuous as she dons the 'naagin' avatar; see pictures
Content: Pavitra Rishta's Ankita Lokhande, who welcomed Lord Ganesh home, shared a video where she can be seen performing aarti with her family before she bids adieu to him. In the video, Ankita can be seen dressed in a simple Indian attire performing the aarti.

Title: No heating arrangements, Dharamshala jail inmates facing harsh winters
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

There are total 303 prisoners, 295 male and 8 female prisoners in this jail

DHARAMSHALA: Without any heaters, fire arrangements and any other comforter, more than 300 jail inmates at Lala Lajpat Rai Jail here are facing harsh winters with blankets only. Authorities are providing around eight blankets to each prisoner to cope up with the declining temperatures.

As per rules, for security reasons jail inmates can’t be given heaters or angeethis to keep them warm. The authorities, therefore, have made special arrangements of blankets for the jail inmates. Inquires revealed that each inmate is being given more than five blankets each.

When contacted, Vinod Kumar, jail superintendent here said that they have three kinds of blankets. “Each inmate is being given maximum eight blankets. We have three kinds of blankets including mink and woven” he added.

At present there are total 303 prisoners, 295 male and 8 female prisoners in this jail. The capacity of this jail is said to around 310 prisoners.

Kangra district is one of the largest districts of Himachal Pradesh with fifteen assembly segments. This jail caters to all segments. It was learnt that special arrangements have also been made in the police lock-ups at each police station.

Jail has been named after Indian freedom fighter Lala Lajpat Rai, in September this year, as he had also served a term here under British raj from April 21, 1922 to January 9, 1923.

Title: Good News Full Movie BO Collection: Good Newwz box office collection Week 1: Akshay Kumar-Kareena Kapoor Khan and Diljit Dosanjh-Kiara Advani's film mints Rs 126 crore in the domestic circuit
Content: Akshay Kumar's latest release 'Good Newwz' which also stars Kareena Kapoor Khan, Kiara Advani and Diljit Dosanjh in the leading role has been on a roll since its release. The film had a good start and it continued the momentum through the week as well.With the New Year holiday helping the film rise in the domestic circuit, the Raj Mehta directorial has gone on to earn Rs 10.25 crore on its first Thursday. The film which raked in Rs 17.50 crore on the first day itself has entered the coveted 100 crore club and has ended its first week in the domestic circuit with Rs 126 crore, as per the latest report on Box Office India.The plot of 'Good Newwz' revolves around two married couples, who try to conceive babies through in-vitro fertilisations (IVF) but a goof-up by the doctor starts off a hilarious joy ride for the audience. The film has received a good response from the critics as well as the audience and a good word of mouth has also been helping it excel at the ticket counters. The camaraderie between the leading actors has been the talking point and with the makers managing to bring a gala of powerhouses together, they have managed to hit the bull's eye with 'Good Newwz'.In an exclusive interview with ETimes, Kiara opened up about her experience of working with the likes of Akshay and Kiara. "It was amazing, I got to learn a lot from them. I have been a fan of Kareena since I was young. I have watched all of her films several times. I know her dialogues at the back of my head. Like most of my generation, I and my friends would be doing Kabhi Khushi Kabhi Gham dialogues and enacting Pooh and all her films. Akshay sir has launched me in the industry so working with him there's so much to learn from him. Diljit is such a fantastic actor, so amazing in comedy, I just felt like I have learned so much just being on sets and getting this opportunity to work with these three legends."

Title: ‘Chhapaak’ new song: The title track of the Deepika Padukone starrer is sure to tug at your heartstrings
Content: After impressing one and all with a strong storyline and some brilliant performances in the trailer, the makers of Meghna Gulzar ’s next ‘ Chhapaak ’ have now unveiled the much-awaited title track of the movie. The heart-touching song of the film gives us a glimpse into the pain and struggle of Deepika Padukone ’s character ‘Malti’ in the movie. The song is all about how in a moment, in a splash, life changes forever.The song has been crooned by Arijit Singh and has lyrics penned by none other than Gulzar. The song has music by Shankar Ehsaan and Loy.Speaking about creating such a soulful song that had the capacity to make your hair stand at its end, filmmaker Meghna Gulzar said at the song launch, “It was difficult to imagine songs in a film based on such sensitive subject but this song is the soul of our film.”Acid attack survivour Laxmi Agarwal , who was also present at the song launch said, “I couldn't stop crying and have been thinking about my father since I have heard the title song.”The movie also stars Vikrant Massey in a pivotal role. It is slated to hit the theatres on January 10, 2020.

Title: Chhattisgarh: Seven hurt in Bhilai Steel Plant gas leak
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

RAIPUR: Seven staff of Bhilai Steel Plant (BSP), a public sector unit, were affected by a gas leak from one of its blast furnaces on the intervening night of January 2.

A BSP spokesman said that the gas leak took place around 2am and three owing to material slippage inside Bhilai Steel Plant’s blast furnace No 8 lead to an increase in pressure inside the furnace. Subsequently, gas got released through the drain pot of hydraulic U seal.

One loco operator and two shunting staff, who were inside the locomotive that was positioned below the U seal, got affected by the gas leak. Gas monitors installed in the area also signalled the presence of gas. All the affected persons were immediately taken to the medical post inside the plant for medical treatment and later shifted to a plant’s JLN Hospital. Two employees, who were engaged in the process of shifting the gas affected people, also suffered minor exposure.

The gas leakage was later arrested and situation normalised. The supervisor of the energy management department, who was engaged to attend to the gas leakage, was also admitted to JLN Hospital as he complained of headache.

The spokesman said that Abhishekh Anand, K Nagraj, Balkrishna, Santosh Kumar and Kalidas– all RITES personnel and Rajesh Kumar, DGM, Bhilai Steel Plant were exposed to gas and all of them are out of danger.

Title: Rajaji Bhavan security officer dies as bike falls into culvert
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

R Saravanaraj's official CISF identity card

CHENNAI: A 53-year-old Central Industrial Security Force assistant commandant was found dead in a drain in a culvert in Puzhal on Thursday morning. Police said R Saravanaraj, who was attached to Rajaji Bhavan in Besant Nagar, was on his motorbike and appeared to have fallen by accident.

A resident of Gandhi Main Road in Vigneshwara Nagar at Surrapet finished duty at 2am and headed for home on his two-wheeler. Around 8am, some passersby noticed a two-wheeler and man wearing a helmet floating in the drain.

Police said he appeared to have lost control of the bike when he was near the service lane close to the Surrapet Toll Gate . “The ground was slippery from overnight rain,” said a policeman. “It appears to be an accident.” Police said the 6ft deep open drain had 3ft of water. Since it had rained over the past few days, there was a considerable flow of water.

“We don’t know if he fell on his own or was knocked down by a vehicle. He appered to have suffered injuries during the fall and had fallen in unconscious,” said an investigating officer. His bike was also in the water.

The Madhavaram traffic investigation police registered a case and sent the body for postmortem to Stanley Medical College Hospital. Preliminary post mortem report suggested drowning could be the cause of death.

Saravanaraj joined CISF in 1987 and moved to Rajaji Bhavan in 2017. A native of Chengalpet district, he is survived by his wife and children. Police have registered a case of unnatural death. Since there was no CCTV camera in the vicinity, police are looking for footage from the nearest cameras.

Title: Telangana: Fifteen bikes gutted as fire breaks out in shop
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representational Image

HYDERABAD: A fire broke out at a motorbike showroom in Bandlaguda in Nagole in the early hours of Thursday. As many as 15 new bikes were destroyed.

The fire control room received an alert at 2.55 am about the fire in Diamond Motors and Service Centre. "Fifteen new bikes and nearly seven bikes which were kept for repair or servicing purpose were gutted. There was no security guard at the showroom. Only when the fire started spreading, locals saw it and alerted us," said station fire officer, P Durga Prasad.

Officials suspect an electric short-circuit triggered the fire.

Two fire tenders from Moula Ali and Hayathnagar were rushed to the spot.

Firefighters had to break open the locked shutter to gain access to the showroom."It took us almost one hour to douse the fire," said Prasad.

Property loss was put at 15 lakh.

Title: Kaushik Sen in Kaushik Ganguly’s next
Content: When Kaushik Ganguly ’s film ‘ Ardhangini ’ was announced with two acting powerhouses Jaya Ahsan and Chrni Ganguly as the female lead, it came down to one question. Who will play the male lead? After months of speculations, it was confirmed Kaushik Sen will be the star attraction.“I was part of Kaushik Ganguly’s Sunyo E Buke, which was way ahead of its time. After that, I didn’t do a big role in any of his films. There was a cameo in Drishtikone. But, in between, he made a lot of films. I too worked with Aparna Sen, Srijit Mukherji and others, but not with him after he became famous. This time around, he called me to say when writes a role, he subconsciously thinks of a person. So, he thought of me while writing it and asked if I would be available to do the part. I told him I had a lot of travelling to do at this time, but he said he would work out the dates. In fact, I was in Seattle for a show when he sent me the shooting dates,” said the popular actor.Earlier, sources close to the development had revealed Kaushik Ganguly might play the lead. In the film, which also stars Ambarish Bhattacharya and Purab Seal Acharya, Churni and Jaya will play the ex and current wives of a man, who at a certain point come face to face after a crisis. What happens next forms the crux of the film.

Title: Aviation turbine fuel price hike could force airlines to avoid refuelling in Chennai
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Chennai International airport. Fuel price varies from one airport to the other because state governments charg... Read More

CHENNAI: An increase in price of aviation turbine fuel (ATF) has made Chennai the second most expensive city to buy jet fuel , which can force airlines to avoid refuelling in the city airport. This will also lead to a hike in air fares.

ATF fuel prices were increased by 2.6% on January

1. This makes the one kilo litre of ATF to cost ₹65, 619 in Chennai airport while it costs ₹70,588 in Kolkata, the highest in a metro airport. Prices are lower in Mumbai and Delhi.

The price was ₹63,830 per kilo litre in Chennai as of December 1, 2018. Now, airlines will have to pay ₹1,789 more. An A320 type plane uses around six tonnes of fuel for a short domestic flight.

This is expected to encourage airlines to lift fuel from other airports and not from Chennai. The process called tankering or carrying more fuel than needed for a trip will go up, said a pilot.

"If an aircraft needs only six tonnes of fuel, the pilot will try to carry 12tonnes depending on the passenger and cargo load so that the next sector can also be flown without refueling in Chennai," he added.

This practice is expected to increase in the coming days as most of the domestic carriers fly multiple routes using the same plane. Since, Mumbai and Delhi is the hub for airlines to park their planes as the airports have more parking bays than in Chennai, there is a chance that pilots will carry fuel from Mumbai.

"This is likely to impact the load of the plane and quantity of cargo may have to be reduced to carry fuel. However, flights flying from Chennai to Delhi may have to carry extra fuel than they usually carry because air congestion caused by fog is leading to delays and diversions. This will be a loss," said an airline official.

The fuel price varies from one airport to the other because state governments charge a tax. The tax is higher in Tamil Nadu . There was a call to make prices or taxes uniform across all airports.

An official of the Airports Authority of India (AAI) said that "The state government has reduced the tax for fuel at small airports like Coimbatore. But, in Chennai they charge high because refueling is high and there is scope for earning more money."

Air Passengers Association of Indi national president D Sudhakara Reddy said "Air fares are bound to go up. Already airlines are incurring loss because of the mess caused by air congestion in Delhi. The congestion is having a cascading effect of delays at all airports. This will add to it. Its surprising that they are increasing the jet fuel price though price of crude has reduced from $68 per barrel to $66."

Title: SHRC directs Tamil Nadu govt to pay Rs 50,000 to man attacked by cops
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

CHENNAI: The State Human Rights Commission ( SHRC ) has directed the Tamil Nadu government to pay a compensation of Rs 50,000 to a man who was assaulted in custody by the Virudhunagar district police in 2018.

In his complaint, C Subburaj stated that he and his relative had been on their way to a hospital when a sub-inspector attached to Ammapatti police station had intercepted them.

Subburaj stated that he had been taken to the police station and assaulted. He stated that the police had foisted a false case that he had been involved in sand theft. This case was foisted at a time when he was selected for a job with the police department. He didn’t get the job because of the case, which is still pending before a trial court.

In response, police denied the allegations. After perusing the submissions, the commission held that there was a human rights violation and directed the government to pay Rs 50,000 to the complainant and recommended disciplinary action against the police.

Title: Clear Friday morning in Delhi, air quality very poor
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

The air quality in Delhi was recorded in the very poor category on Friday. (Photo: Reuters)

NEW DELHI: It was a clear Friday morning in the national capital with the minimum temperature settling at 7.6 degrees Celsius, normal for this time of the year.

Humidity was recorded at 100 per cent.

Track the pollution level in your city

The air quality in the city was recorded in the very poor category on Friday after being in the severe zone for the past two days.

The air quality index (AQI) read 390 for the national capital at 8.43 am, according to the Central Pollution Control Board.

The air quality in the neighbouring areas of Faridabad (387), Ghaziabad (343), Greater Noida (370), Gurugram (364) and Noida (391) was also recorded in the very poor category.

The visibility at Palam was 400 metres while the visibility at Safdarjung was 600 metres at 8.30 am.

The weatherman has forecast mainly clear skies for the day with the possibility of moderate fog on Saturday morning.

The maximum temperature on Friday is likely to hover around 23 degrees Celsius while the minimum on Saturday is likely to be around 7 degrees Celsius.

The national capital had recorded an above normal maximum temperature for the second consecutive day on Thursday after remaining in the grip of a prolonged cold spell, the longest since 1992.

The city had recorded a high of 23 degrees Celsius, three notches above normal, and a low of 4.6 degrees Celsius, three degrees below normal, on Thursday.

Title: Road to Dehra MLA’s property triggers controversy
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

DHARAMSHALA: A controversy had triggered following a construction of concrete path by forest department to the land owned by family of an independent MLA from Dehra, Hoshiar Singh.

Member of Panchayat Samiti, Kharian from Dehra area, Jasbir Singh Guleria and a few other villagers that accompanied him addressed a press conference on Thursday alleged that many villages in Pong wildlife sanctuary area were without paths or roads due to strict rules but forest department showed special privilege to MLA and constructed a concrete path to his private property.

“Almost all paths in Kharian village were kucha due to restrictions of forest land. However, the forest department has chosen to concretize road that led to private land of the MLA” alleged Guleria.

He further said that the power lines passing through their village were hanging low and were threat to life. Power department did not act on this due to lack of NOC from forest department. “But the power department has given 14 electricity poles to the private land of the MLA”, he alleged.

The entire Pong Dam area falls under the Pong Dam Wild Life Sanctuary area. About 100 metre area from the edge of wildlife sanctuary was classified as eco-sensitive zone and no activity was allowed there.

They claimed that the woad which was constructed on the private property of MLA sans NOC from the forest and wildlife department.

The DFO wildlife Hamirpur, Rahul Kumar incharge of Pong Dam wildlife sanctuary area when contacted said that the wildlife department had not given any NOC for the construct of path on Kharian village area. DFO said that he would check the fact if the road constructed to private property of MLA fell in wildlife sanctuary area.

DFO Dehra, Raj Dogra said that the forest department had constructed about 150 metre road in Kharian village. But in papers this road is for cremation ground, he added.

MLA Hoshiar Singh when contacted denied allegations stating that road is already in revenue papers since 1960’s. “This road is going to benefit hundreds of family not only me” he said.

Title: Now, devotees from India stopped from taking langar material to Darbar Sahib
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Pilgrims usually carry raw vegetables and uncooked rice for langar

AMRITSAR: Following the refusal of the Pakistan Sikh Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee (PSGPC) to accept donation of ‘langar’ (community kitchen) material from Indian devotees going to Gurdwara Darbar Sahib, Kartarpur Sahib in Pakistan, the customs officials at Integrated Check Post, Dera Baba Nanak, have also begun advising the pilgrims to not carry any such material to the historic Sikh shrine in the neighbouring country.

“We have been told by many pilgrims upon return from Kartarpur Sahib that they were harassed by the Pakistan Rangers (Pakistan’s border guarding force) for carrying langar material,” said sources. Recently, Pakistan Rangers troops started not allowing Indian devotees to carry langar material to the gurdwara. The pilgrims were directed to leave the packets at border terminal and pick them back on their return to India.

It happened a few days after PSGPC president Satwant Singh announced to not accept any langar material from Indian devotees, saying that they had sufficient arrangements for any number of pilgrims.

A large number of Indians have been carrying potatoes, tomatoes, pulses, flour, dairy products, tea leaves and cooked chapatis among other things for the langar of Gurdwara Darbar Sahib. Following inputs from Indian pilgrims returning from Kartarpur, now customs officials too are not allowing any langar material to be carried to Pakistan via Kartarpur corridor.

Sources also said customs officials at DBN were allowing pilgrims to carry home only ‘pinni parsad’ received from Gurdwara Darbar Sahib. The PSGPC president said management of Gurdwara Darbar Sahib had sufficient langar material as well as cooks to prepare langar as per Sikh traditions.

Meanwhile, the Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee (SGPC) president Gobind Singh Longowal condemned Pakistan’s decision of not allowing langar material. “We will take up the issue with both Indian and Pakistan governments to lift the ban and let the pilgrims carry whatever material they wish to carry for ‘Guru ka langar’,” Longowal said.

Title: PSGPC to mark 10th Guru's birth anniversary on Sunday
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

A view of Golden Temple in Amritsar on the occasion of birth anniversary of Guru Gobind Singh

AMRITSAR: In violation of the Akal Takht directions, the Pakistan Sikh Gurdwara Management Committee (PSGPC) will celebrate the birth anniversary of the 10th Sikh master Guru Gobind Singh on January 5. The Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee (SGPC) celebrated the event, according to the approved Nanakshahi Calendar (NC), on Thursday.

"PSGPC will begin three-day celebrations to mark Guru Gobind Singh's birth anniversary from Friday at Gurdwara Darbar Sahib, Kartarpur Sahib and main function will be held on Sunday," PSGPC president Satwant Singh told TOI on Thursday. 'Akhand path' will begin on Friday and 'bhog' would be performed on January 5.

PSGPC follows Pal Singh Purewal-authored NC and observes all Sikh religious days accordingly. It does not abide by the calendar approved and released by the Akal Takht. Satwant said that a large number of Sikh devotees were likely to converge at Kartarpur Sahib.

Pakistan's Evacuee Trust Property Board (ETPB) spokesperson Amir Hashmi said they had made elaborate arrangements for the stay of the Sikh devotees at Kartarpur Sahib.

On the reports of not allowing Pakistani non-Sikhs to enter the gurdwara complex, Hashmi claimed that the decision was taken owing to security constraints.

"A large number of Sikhs from outside Pakistan as well as India would be visiting. So, keeping in view their security, the government has decided to not allow Pakistani non-Sikhs to enter the gurdwara complex," he said.

Meanwhile, intelligence sources here feared that the Pakistan government could also impose a ban on Indian non-Sikhs going to pay obeisance via Kartarpur corridor. "The present decision could be the foundation for the future decision of the Pakistan government to ban non-Sikhs from India to enter the gurdwara complex," a source claimed.

Title: GV Prakash Kumar joins Vetri Maaran-Suriya film as composer
Content:
#GV75 Yes my 75th film as a composer is with my most successful director combination @Vetrimaaran ... with… https://t.co/AadveOTHgE — G.V.Prakash Kumar (@gvprakash) 1577961245000

Musician-turned-actor GV Prakash Kumar announced on Twitter that he would be composing music for Vetri Maaran 's upcoming film with Suriya . "#GV75 Yes my 75th film as a composer is with my most successful director combination @Vetrimaaran ... with @Suriya_offl sir as lead ... produced by Thanu sir," his tweet read.Produced by Kalaippuli S Thanu of V Creations, the film will mark the first collaboration between Vetri Maaran and Suriya. Vetri Maaran, who recently made Dhanush and Manju Warrier's Asuran, also has a film with comedian Soori in the pipeline. GV Prakash was the music behind Asuran as well.Suriya, who is currently awaiting the release of Sudha Kongara's Soorarai Pottru, was last seen in Selvaraghavan's NGK.

Title: Pakistan link charge baseless: Anti-CAA kolam protester
Content:
Gayatri Khandhadai

Gayatri Khandhadai, a human rights lawyer who organized a kolam protest against the Citizenship Amendment Act in Chennai, said she has become a target of the troll army on social media after Chennai city police commissioner A K Viswanathan said she had a ‘Pakistan connection’.The commissioner had said Gayatri is a researcher with Pakistan-based Bytes for All (B4A) organization and that her level of Pakistani connection and kind of connection will be inquired.Addressing a press conference organized by People’s Watch in Madurai on Thursday, Gayatri said the commissioner is responsible for her safety and security, as her privacy has been compromised by the Chennai police by making her Facebook details public. “The commissioner in a callous way published my social media credentials, essentially violating my privacy and totally compromising my security. He has sought to paint a picture whereby he has completely omitted the other organization I worked with, information on which is also present in the public domain,” she said.Bytes for All is a human rights organization based in Pakistan that focuses on information and communication technologies and digital rights. It is part of the Association of All Pakistan Citizen Journalists. She has written a research work titled ‘Desecrating Expression: An account of freedom of expression and religion in Asia’, on how one’s freedom of expression is violated on religious lines in nine countries, including Pakistan, Bangladesh and Myanmar, she said.There is one full chapter on Pakistan, where she has written about harassment meted out to religious minorities, atheists and sexual minorities.“Chennai police have said permission for a kolam protest was denied, but the truth is that we did not seek permission at all. Police said they reached the protest site only after a resident made a complaint. The truth is there were more than 40 police personnel by the time they reached Besant Nagar, where protesters later drew kolam,” she said.“We did not draw kolam in front of the house of the man who was seen in a video released by the police,” Gayatri said. Some BJP office-bearers have targeted Gayathri by using the ‘Pakistani link’ to the anti-CAA protests.When TOI spoke to BJP spokesperson S G Suryah about her paper which detailed persecution of religious minorities in Pakistan, he agreed that this was similar to the party’s stance vis-àvis persecution of religious minorities in Pakistan. “I saw the link and checked the synopsis. If she has written about religious persecution of minorities in Pakistan, why is she opposing the CAA,” Suryah asked. The BJP’s contention was that the blog Bytes for All was filled with anti-India articles with a clear intention to spread hate against India, Suryah said. “That is why we are suspicious,” he added.Police commissioner Viswanathan told TOI that they had not been aware about her research and that the investigation against her has only started. “I never alluded to her Pakistani links. It was a question raised by a media person to which I responded,” he said.

Title: Will reach out to 3 crore people to spread awareness over CAA: Piyush Goyal
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Union minister Piyush Goyal addresses media on Why India Needs Citizen Amendment Act in Mumbai. (Credits:ANI)

MUMBAI: Union minister Piyush Goyal on Friday said that the percentage of minorities in Pakistan has reduced to mere three per cent from earlier 23 per cent, which is a testimony of hardships being faced by them in the neighbouring country.

Goyal attended an event in Mumbai on Friday which was organised in favor of the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA).

"Pakistan is an Islamic country. Congress is responsible for the division of India. Thousands of people came to India and we know in what condition they came here. The trains had only dead bodies. Earlier, Pakistan had 23 percent minorities and now it has reduced to just three percent," said Goyal.

The Union minister further added that in India, the percentage of minorities has increased and not decreased like in Pakistan, because India has protected them and it is a secular country.

"The opposition is confused or maybe they are doing all this with proper planning. In the next 10 days, we will reach to three crore people and spread awareness about CAA," said Goyal.

BJP is planning a countrywide outreach program to clarify facts about the Citizenship Act and make its provisions clear among the masses.

Title: Saudi Arabia hands over Qandeel Baloch's absconding brother suspected in her murder to Pakistan
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Pakistani model Qandeel Baloch was a victim of alleged honour killing.

ISLAMABAD: Saudi Arabia has handed over social media celebrity Qandeel Baloch 's brother, an absconding suspect in her gruesome murder, to Pakistan, days after he was arrested in the Gulf kingdom, according to a media report.

Fouzia Azeem, better known as Qandeel, was strangled to death by her brother Waseem Khan at her home in Multan in the Punjab province on July 15, 2016, in a chilling murder that sent shock waves across Pakistan, triggering an outpouring of grief on social media and igniting fierce debate over the prevalence of "honour killings" of women.

Waseem had confessed to the murder of his 26-year-old sister and said she had brought "disrepute" to the "family's honour" with her risque videos and statements posted on social media.

The International Criminal Police Organization's (Interpol) cell in Saudi Arabia arrested Muzaffar Iqbal, brother and suspect in Qandeel's murder, on Wednesday as part of their job to tackle international crime, Pakistani media reported.

The arrest was made on the Pakistani government's 2016 request to Saudi Arabia as Iqbal was residing in the country at the time. Iqbal has been accused of aiding and abetting in Qandeel's murder, the report said.

Following Qandeel's murder, her father Muhammad Azeem Baloch had lodged a murder case against his son, accomplice Haq Nawaz and others.

An affidavit submitted by the parents in 2016 had also named two of their other sons, Aslam Shaheen and Arif.

In October last year, Arif, another absconding suspect and brother, was arrested with the help of Interpol from Saudi Arabia and transferred to Multan.

In September, a model court had sentenced Waseem to life in prison for murdering his sister after he admitted to drugging and killing his sister.

Six others, including Mufti Abdul Qavi and Qandeel's two brothers Shaheen and Arif — were acquitted in the case.

On August 22, the court had rejected the August 21 appeal of late model's parents to acquit their sons as they had forgiven them.

Prior to that, however, her parents had refused to pardon their sons and had called for capital punishment in the case.

Qandeel had become famous for her bold social media pictures, videos and comments. But those posts in which she spoke of trying to change "the typical orthodox mindset" of people in Pakistan were considered outrageous by the largely conservative Pakistani community.

Described as Pakistan's Kim Kardashian, Qandeel built a modelling career on the back of her social media fame. She faced frequent backlash and death threats, but continued to post her pictures and videos.

The 2016 killing sparked fierce debate in Pakistan over the prevalence of "honour killings" of women.

Every year over 1,000 women are murdered in Pakistan in so called 'honour killings' committed by their male relatives.

Qandeel's murder restarted the debate in the Muslim-majority country that led to the passing of an amendment to Pakistan's Penal Code in October 2016, allowing the police to take over from the victim's family as the main complainant in the case of an "honour killing".

The amendment made it impossible for Qandeel's family to use the country's laws that allow close relatives of murder victims to pardon the killers.

Financial Independence Retire Early,’

Rule 1: Focus on your spending and not on your earning

Rule 2: Invest, Invest, Invest

Rule 3: Prepare for inflation

(Source: ET)

Consider this table to understand how a 6% rise in prices can affect your monthly expenses:

(Source: ET)

Rule 4: Never stop working

The way ahead

Women are moving towards financial liberation but not insurance. Here’s why term insurance is crucial for women

Disclaimer: This article has been produced on behalf of HDFC Life by Times Internet's Spotlight Team.

If you thought that retiring early is possible only if you win the lottery or inherit a windfall, Siddhant and Anjani Adkar’s story will prove you otherwise. This Bangalore-based couple laid the groundwork of an early retirement strategy in their late twenties when both of them were earning in five-figures as IT engineers. Now, at 51, and one year into their retirement, they think that it was the best decision they had ever taken. Incremental raises and an intelligent investment methodology, they say, is their recipe for success.The couple began pursuing financial independence at 29 when Siddhant expressed his desire to run a homestay post-retirement. When he sat with Anjali and analysed the methods in which they had been saving money, Siddhant realized that at the current pace, they might have to spend their whole life slogging in an office cubicle. This was the moment of revelation that made the couple introspect their financial instruments and the way they were spending and saving money. Thus, with a vision to amass enough money by their late 40s, the couple embarked on their early retirement journey. This was the time when Siddhant had just landed a job at an engineering consulting firm and Anjali was juggling her time between a job at Infosys and a part-time MTech degree. Their combined annual income along with the savings they had accumulated over the years was good, if not impressive, and they invested some of these assets in a bevy of insurance policies.However, one of the most substantial steps they took for early retirement was the adoption of the FIRE philosophy. An acronym for ‘the FIRE movement has gained immense popularity among millennials and it has been largely successful in letting people retire by their late forties or even earlier. As a textbook definition, the FIRE movement is founded on the premise that socking away 40-70% of one’s earnings for 10-15 years can accumulate a nest egg large enough to generate a passive income that’ll enable people to retire early and comfortably fund the basic living expenses.While the main engine of the FIRE approach is built on drastic lifestyle downgrades to maximize your savings rate, Siddhant and Anjali decided to take on board some of its ideas in moderation. They realised early that an aggressive plan is unsustainable in the long run and hence took up certain proponents of the philosophy like cutting down on mindless spending, intelligent budgeting, and of course investing in the right financial funds to grow their monetary portfolio. Come today, the couple runs an eco-friendly homestay on the buffer forests of Kanha National Park after having comfortably retired last year. And both Siddhant and Anjali are sure that they are financially stable and won’t have to return to the old life.So, what should be your strategy if you wish to be retirement-ready like Siddhant and Anjali Adkar? According to the couple, following these four essential rules can work wonders if early retirement is on your mind.Many people believe that early retirement is possible only for people with high-paying salaries. However unlikely it might seem, this idea is highly flawed. Financial independence for early retirement, in fact, becomes difficult for people with higher incomes as they have a spendy lifestyle. This is why one should control one’s spending to amass the nest egg required to quit the cubicle at an earlier age. The couple divides this thought in two ways. When they embarked on their retirement journey, they mapped cutting expenses and daily spending as a short-term solution, whereas increasing their income through a positive cash flow was a long term solution. They also set a believable retirement budget and ensured that it was not completely set in stone. Over the last 20 years, they revisited their investment portfolio and retirement strategy to ensure that it was up-to-date with the fluctuations in the market.A UN Population Fund report states that life expectancy at birth in India has risen from 60 years in 1994 to 69 years in 2019. In the urban areas, this rate is even higher with improved medical facilities and the access to avail them. This means that anyone planning for early retirement in India has fewer years to accumulate their nest egg and more years to spend it. This is why one of the pivotal pillars of an early retirement plan is having assets generating income that exceed your standard of living. And this is possible only with a mixed investment strategy . How, you ask.Siddhant and Anjali had a three-way approach- fixed-income investments, moderately risky investments, and diverse bucket investments. Through the use of conservative annuity plans, the couple was able to make risk-free investments where returns are always assured. But because these annuity incomes do not have fixed interest rates and don’t take inflation into account, they further invested in market-linked and fixed income options that come with part equity. Their idea behind this category of investment was because they are tax-efficient and have the potential for higher returns if the equity portion is left untouched. But it is important to ensure that these equities are bought at the right time. The third investment methodology they adopted was a three-bucket approach where the bulk amount is divided into three corpus-based on immediate use, medium-term use and long term use. While the immediate bucket, relies on liquid funds, the second and the third bucket rely on equity funds. Further implementing a FIRE methodology to this savings philosophy, they also choose to max out their returns by putting restrictions on the withdrawal amount.The couple opines that one of the foremost pillars of an early retirement strategy is inflation planning. The rising inflation shoots up expenditure in ways one cannot even imagine. In fact, financial research suggests that whatever you can purchase from the annuity of your investment strategy now can barely purchase one-third of it 25 years down the line.This is why it is important to consider inflation in your early retirement planning road map and buy financial tools that cover inflation. Taking an early retirement or financially securing your post-retirement years means investing in the right funds so that your money works for you and helps you meet your desired goals. Helping millennial couples plan towards this goal is HDFC Life Click 2 Wealth, a Unit Linked Life Insurance Plan that offers market linked returns, charges minimally and provides valuable financial protection for you and your family. Through the Golden Years Benefit Option by HDFC Life Click 2 Wealth it is aiming to provide the right blend of Retirement planning that not only builds a corpus for your golden years, but also make sure you leave a legacy behind for your loved ones. This plan option offers you the solution to build your fund value while also having life cover for your whole life (till 99 years of age).For Siddhant and Anjali, early retirement as a life goal only meant that they would retire early but work forever- on something they love. And in their case, it was a homestay. Over the years, they carefully considered the various things that they had to do to give wings to their dreams and made their financial choices accordingly. This is why they are of the opinion that an early retirement plan can never be ‘one size fits all.’ Every couple planning for the same should consider how they are envisioning their lives post-retirement- based on whether they want to work on a passion or would simply reap the benefits and lead a hustle-free life of leisure. Personally, they are of the opinion that anyone aiming to retire early should not retire on nothing but pursue a passion that they had always wanted to.Siddhant and Anjali’s journey into early retirement gives sound financial advice to a lot of people envisioning the same dream. Apart from the four major pillars through which they structured their post-retirement roof, they are of the opinion that couples today have a host of financial tools to build their nest egg- something that wasn’t there 20 years back.Most financial experts suggest that retirement planning should begin the day you start earning. And if it is an early retirement that you are planning on, it requires twice the thought. With a meticulous financial strategy and intelligent investment , you can make a dramatic impact on how you live and make your post-retirement years a cakewalk.Also on term insurance:
