Title: Corporates join hands to promote diversity and inclusivity
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

In a radical move, The Federation of Indian Chambers of Commerce and Industry (FICCI) has appointed a progressive task force for the purpose of diversity and inclusion. For the first time ever, FICCI has opened its doors to two openly queer people as Chairs. Keshav Suri and Radhika Piramal will join mentor, Jyotsna Suri and 18 others in a task force of the federation.

The primary agenda on the task force’s docket is to work towards the implementation of diverse and inclusive policies across India Inc. It was with the launch of Keshav Suri Foundation in October, 2018 – Queering the Pitch – when FICCI partnered for the first time in 92 years with an inclusive event that spoke about LGBTQ+ issues. Breaking tradition, the LGBTQIA+ inclusion in this task force is an attempt to inspire the 7000+ body members of FICCI to enable these policies. These are corporate houses that offer employment to millions and have the potential to change the landscape of their workforce to include all.

The task force has a threefold agenda– gender diversity, inclusion of people with disabilities, and notable representation from the LGBTQIA+ community. Three people from this esteemed task force will take responsibility to undertake one priority area each. Nipun Malhotra of PWD will oversee the inclusion of specially-abled people, while Zainab Patel will concentrate on the LGBTQIA+ community. The gender parity responsibility will be helmed by Preeti Demelo.

Title: Bank Holidays in January 2020: Here’s the complete list
Content:
Bank Holidays in January 2020

Day Date Holiday Saturday 11.01.2020 Second Saturday Saturday 25.01.2020 Fourth Saturday Sunday 26.01.2020 Republic Day

NEW DELHI: In India, banks remain closed on holidays. The bank holidays usually vary from one to another depending on the region and its festivals.According to the Reserve Bank of India, there is only one national bank holiday in January 2020 — Republic day which is on January 26, 2020. It may be noted that the Republic day falls on Sunday and thus the holiday doesn’t make any difference to customers.Addition to this, all public and government banks in the country will be closed on the second and fourth Saturdays of January, which are government-approved bank holidays. Banks will be closed on January 11, 2020 — second Saturday. And banks will remain shut on January 25, 2020 — fourth Saturday.In some regions, banks are closed on New Year, January 1, 2020. The other regional holidays are as follows — Guru Gobind Singh Jayanti, Mannam Jayanthi, Bhogi/Pongal/MakarSankranti /Bhogali Bihu/Tus Puja/Lohri/Hadaga, Kanuma/Thiruvalluvar Day, Uzhavar Tirunal, Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose Jayanti, Gothar Bathou Sun, Vasant Panchami, Sir Chhotu Ram Jayanti and Me-dam-me-phi.

Title: A heady cocktail of fun and laughter
Content: Kalāyan Theatre is staging its well-received comedy,, in Bengaluru again. The 110-minute Hindi play is written and directed by Mathura Kalauny will be staged at Jagriti Theatre on January 10, at 8 pm.The play is centered on Manu , a well-fed and sincere young man, who is also a bit forgetful. He lives with his country cousin, Gabru, and is plagued by his friends Dhanajay, Bunty and Daku. To top it all, Raghu comes to stay with him, with his estranged wife who has fallen to the charms of Bunty.Manu’s fiancée, Lata, discovers that there are too many young girls around Manu. Events, apparently, go beyond her control. She can only cry. Then, there is Daku with his king-size ego, which was deflated by a young lyrical female, called Jayamala.Dhananjay is in love with Dr Sugandha a fire-breathing young female. She breaks his heart along with his head and arms. Dhananjay wants to commit suicide.Then there is a big party thrown by Manu for Gabru. Frustrated Raghu hijacks the party.is a heady cocktail of fun and laughter

Title: Parkash Purb celebrations in Patna to be an annual affair, says Nitish Kumar
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Nitish Kumar offers prayers at Patna Sahib gurdwara to mark birth anniversary of Guru Gobind Singh on Thursday... Read More

JALANDHAR: Birth anniversaries of founder of Sikhism Guru Nanak Dev and 10th master guru Gobind Singh would be celebrated every year at grand scale in Bihar. The state government would make all supporting arrangements for both pious occasions, Bihar chief minister Nitish Kumar announced on Thursday.

He made the announcement while addressing a religious function at Takht Patna Sahib to mark the 353rd birth anniversary of Guru Gobind Singh. Nitish said that his government would extend all support for celebrating Guru Nanak's birth anniversary at the historic gurdwara in Rajgir, which marks the memory of the Guru's visit and has already been given a major facelift in the past one year. This year, Guru Nanak's anniversary was celebrated at a grand scale for three days from December 27 to 29. Tens of thousands partook langar every day during the celebrations.

The Bihar CM, however, made an appeal to the Takht Patna Sahib management committee that if they celebrate Guru Nanak and Guru Gobind Singh's birth anniversaries at a short gap of 4-5 days every year then it will make things easier for visiting devotees.

In his address at Takht Patna Sahib, Nitish Kumar said that after the 2017 celebrations, the number of devotees visiting Takht Patna Sahib had increased manifold. While the tent city was raised for 5,000 persons, around 7,000 persons had already stayed there. While other speakers praised the Bihar CM for making flawless arrangements in 2017 as well as this year, Nitish played humble saying that his government did just its duty. SAD general secretary and former MP Prem Singh Chandumajra in his address said that Nitish had set benchmark for other state governments for making arrangements to celebrate anniversaries and other such pious occasions.

"If we compare the turn out before 2017 and now, the increase is manifold," said Takht Patna Sahib managing committee member Kamikkar Singh. "This year also Bihar government made impressive and flawless arrangements. In fact, not just the Bihar government, administration and police have been very cooperative and cordial, local people have been very courteous and supportive to all the visiting devotees. The bonhomie between Sikhs and people of Bihar started in 2017, and is now going further. One can easily gauge the element of mutual respect,' said managing committee president Avtar Singh Hit.

The Takht Patna Sahib Managing Committee presented a set of sword, with gold plating, and a shield to Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, who announced that both gifts would be kept at the Bihar international museum, which is showcased the heritage of the land.

Title: Raveena Tandon is ‘Laughing Out Loud’ on THIS hilarious meme on her eyes
Content: Sushant Singh Rajput’s death case is currently being investigated by the Central Bureau Of Investigation (CBI) and they have been questioning a lot of people connected to the late actor. According to the latest report on India Today, three officers who are a part of the probe, have stated that their team has so far not found any evidence that suggests Sushant was murdered on June 14.

Title: Telangana says three cheers as excise revenue scales new high
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representational Image

HYDERABAD: The Disha gangrape and murder incident in November last year triggered an outrage across the country and demands for ban on liquor kept growing louder. But, Telangana said three cheers to liquor in the very first year after it was carved out of united Andhra Pradesh in 2014.

In the financial year of 2014-15, then youngest state of India netted an excise revenue of ?10,813 crore. This was ?1,000 crore higher than what all the 23 districts in the undivided AP had earned (?9,813 crore) in 2013-14.

This was just the beginning. Four years later (2018-19), Telangana’s excise income reached a high of 65%. Compare this to the undivided AP when the growth rate in the revenue was just 26% in 2013-14. This was revealed by TPCC functionary Indira Shoban who received a reply to an RTC query she filed on the excise revenues earned by Telangana ever since it was formed as a state.

The fact that in the April 2019 parliament elections alone, liquor worth ?1,884 crore was sold in Telangana, confirming the worst fears of women activists and civic groups who believe that the increased liquor sales are leading to a spurt in attacks on women.

Though the RTI reply said there were no belt shops in Telangana, it gave a chronology of cases booked under the belt shops category. In all, 17,952 cases were booked in 22 districts. Vikarabad recorded the highest number (8,233) of cases, while Medchal stood last with least number (284) of cases. A total of 1,022 cases were booked in the backward Mahbubnagar district alone.

Also, the RTC reply revealed that the year-on-year excise growth was always more than 25%. In the first year, after Telangana came into being, liquor prices did not see any hike. But later, the prices were hiked twice.

Market analysts said the excise revenue growth this year (2019-20) in the wake of the recent hike in the prices would be known later this year. “It could be anywhere between 72-75%,” they said.

Meanwhile, Indira Shoban said liquor consumption was the main reason for growing violence on women. “In Gujarat, there is total prohibition. Prime Minister Narendra Modi should bring total prohibition in the entire country. The state government should see to it that no permission is given for liquor shops on national and state highways,” she added.

Title: Mazya Navryachi Bayko update, January 2: Shanaya plans to teach Gurunath a lesson
Content: In the recent episode of Mazya Navryachi Bayko Radhika informs Saumitra about Atharva's habits and routine. Suddenly, Revati returns to Radhika’s house and gives her best wishes to the latter for her honeymoon night. Radhika feels uncomfortable and shares her worries with Saumitra.On the other hand, Gurunath is upset about being ousted from Saumitra’s father's office. He shares his plight with KD. He tells KD that he is feeling low because Saumitra and Radhika are married and Shanaya does not understand him at all. While discussing his problems with KD, Gurunath rejects Shanaya’s call. She feels insulted and plans to teach Gurunath a lesson.Later, Gurunath returns to Shanaya’s house in an inebriated state. Shanaya gets angry with Gurunath and cross-questions him. Gurunath shouts at her adding that she has destroyed his life completely and took away his parents and Atharva from him. Shanaya replies that he is a loser and lost everything because of his weird behavior. Shanaya’s mom tries to calm Gurunath and Shanaya.On the other side, Anand decorates Saumitra’s room for their honeymoon night. Saumitra and Radhika enter the room. She gets anxious seeing the decoration. Saumitra holds Radhika’s hand but she feels awkward. Noticing Radhika anxious, Saumitra comforts her and sleeps on the couch.The next day, Shanaya’s mom and Shanaya go on shopping ordering Gurunath to do all household work.

Title: Deepika Padukone consoles Laxmi Agarwal as she breaks down at 'Chhapaak' title track launch
Content:
.@TheLaxmiAgarwal gets emotional at the song launch of #ChhapaakTitleTrack . @deepikapadukone https://t.co/jrvXmtIhLg — BombayTimes (@bombaytimes) 1578035909000

Today, early in the morning, Deepika Padukone treated her fans with a very heart touching glimpse from her forthcoming film, 'Chhapaak'. The actress also announced that, the makers shall release the film's title track today. Accordingly, the major star cast of the film gathered for the song launch. However, the song launch turned into an emotional event as both Laxmi and Deepika got sentimental.Apart from Deepika, Meghna Gulzar , Shankar Mahadevan, and Gulzar , the launch also saw Laxmi Agarwal gracing the event. As soon as the song was launched, Shankar Mahadevan crooned a few lines from the song and Laxmi got emotional after listening to this heart touching song and broke down on Deepika's shoulder. On the other hand, a supportive Deepika consoled an emotional Laxmi which was a sight to behold for everyone present at the song launch.Watch the video here:Furthermore, Deepika too got emotional over seeing Laxmi breaking down on her shoulders, the 'Padmaavat' actress got teary eyed and it was Laxmi's turn to console the beautiful actress, who stepped into her shoes to play the acid attack survivor Malti in the film.Helmed by Meghna Gulzar, 'Chhapaak' revolves around the struggles and triumph that Laxmi Agarwal went through. The film is slated to release on the 10th of January, 2020 and will see a box office clash with Ajay Devgn and Kajol's historical drama, 'Tanhaji-The unsung warrior'.

Title: Forget CAA stir, colleges tell students on reopening day in Tamil Nadu
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Colleges across Tamil Nadu reopened on Thursday after a 10-day break in the wake of protests against Citizensh... Read More

CHENNAI: Colleges across Tamil Nadu reopened on Thursday after a 10-day break in the wake of protests against Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) and National Register of Citizens (NRC). The first day passed of peacefully, with many college managements asking their students to drop the protest and focus on studies.

The campuses had remained closed since December 21 because of the protests, though the government cited the rural local body polls and festivals as the reason. To subdue the protest, University of Madras had advanced Christmas holidays from December 18.

“The situation was volatile and the university took the right decision. After the holidays, the situation has changed,” a professor from the university said. Presidency College principal E Padmini said the college council, which met on Thursday, decided to urge students to concentrate on studies. “We are planning to invite many companies for campus placement. Our council has decided to instruct all our students to focus on studies and not get diverted by protests,” she said.

Mohamed Sathak College of Arts and Science gave a similar call its students. “By seeing other college students, our students protested only one day, that too on the campus. We have asked them to get back to books,” said a professor of the college. Some others said the decision to declare holidays has affected their academic schedule.

“We need 90 days to complete the syllabus. Due to the unexpected holidays, now we have to extend the classes till April 16 and compensate holidays by conducting classes on Saturdays,” said M G Ragunathan, principal of Guru Nanak College.

Title: Lena: Dhyan Sreenivasan and Lena collaborates for 'Adukkala'
Content: Actor-director Dhyan Sreenivasan has collaborated with Lena for his next. The duo has signed up to play the lead characters in 'Adukkala'. Directed by debutant Maxwell Jose, the movie’s title poster was launched on New Year’s eve. M-Town celebs, including Vineeth Sreenivasan, Tovino Thomas, Asif Ali, Joju George, Unni Mukundan, Anoop Menon, Antony Varghese, Priya Prakash Varrier, Anusithara, and Prayaga Martin unveiled the title poster on their respective social media handles.Titled 'Adukkala' (Kitchen), the tagline of the movie reads 'The Manifesto'. The movie is said to be based on the bond between a mother and son as the subtitle of the tagline reads 'A personal account of a mother'.'Adukkala' is backed by AD Sreekumar, Devison CJ and Shankar Das under the banner of Movies nest creation. Santhosh Anima will crank the lens for 'Adukkala'.On the work front, Dhyan Sreenivasan recently stepped into filmmaking with 'Love Action Drama'. The movie featured Nivin Pauly and Nayanthara in lead and earned well at the box office.Lena is one of the most talented actresses of Mollywood , known for her performance in 'Traffic', 'Kanyana Talkies', 'Iyobinte Pusthakam', and 'Ennu Ninte Moideen'. Lena is currently filming 'Sajan Bakery Since 1962'.

Title: Bigg Boss Kannada Rashmi: Ex-Bigg Boss contestant Rapid Rashmi enjoys a vacation in Srilanka
Content: Former Bigg Boss Kannada season 6 finalist, Rashmi is on a vacay. Rashmi, who is often held up with a busy schedule, took a small break and flew to Sri Lanka with her husband Davis and friends.Rashmi is enjoying her vacation to the fullest. To keep her fans updated, the former BB Kannada contestant has been posting photos and videos on her social media handle too.From enjoying local cuisines to visiting the wildlife sanctuary, Rashmi is enjoying every bit of her holiday with her near and dear ones.Sharing the pictures on her social media handle, Rashmi celebrated the new year in Sri Lanka and mentioned that it is her last trip for the year.On the career front, Rashmi aka Rapid Rashmi is known for her voice. She hosts a popular radio show. Though Rashmi had participated in a dance reality show earlier, she claimed that her presence in Bigg Boss helped her to gain more fame.

Title: Bar wards of power defaulters from taking competitive exams: Ranjit Chautala
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Ranjit Chautala

CHANDIGARH: Haryana power minister Ranjit Chautala on Thursday triggered a controversy while referring to measures for recovery of electricity bill arrears from defaulters in rural and urban areas of the state. Chautala had advocated that children of those defaulting electricity bill payment should be barred from appearing in the competitive examinations without the no-objection certificate (NOC) from the electricity department.

Chautala had said this during his interaction with villagers as well in a press conference organised in Sirsa district. His statement had attracted the criticism from the opposition.

Congress leader and former chief minister Bhupinder Singh Hooda was the first to react. He said, "How can you link electricity bill arrears with studies? Why should a student pay for parents' fault? This is something unjustified and uncalled for."

According to the Comptroller and Auditor General of India (CAG) report, arrears of the distribution company (discom) Dakshin Haryana Bijli Vitran Nigam (DHBVN) had touched Rs 7,332 crore. Similar is the case of another discom Uttar Haryana Bijli Vitran Nigam (UHBVN), which manages power network in north Haryana. Both discoms had been reeling under severe financial crisis.

The arrears are largely due to unpaid electricity bills and line losses. Government had been running various schemes from time to time to bring down the aggregate technical and commercial loses (AT&C) losses.

The officials of the electricity department refrained from commenting. But Chautala, having been trolled through the day, clarified that he did not have any immediate plans.

"What he meant to say was that just as candidates contesting the panchayat and civic body elections are required to have the NOC from discoms, there should also be such provision for the recovery of arrears from defaulters. His statement has been misrepresented. There is no such plan," an spokesperson of the power minister said.

Title: Will expose TRS, MIM and Congress nexus: Telangana BJP chief
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Telangana BJP chief K Laxman

HYDERABAD: BJP state president K Laxman on Thursday alleged that the TRS , AIMIM and the Congress have joined hands for municipal elections.

Interacting with the media during 'Meet the Press' programme, he said, "TRS sees Congress as friend, this is evident from KTR's comments, did you see any BJP leader going to TRS, why can't Congress retain its leaders?"

Laxman said AIMIM, TRS and Congress have joined hands to stop BJP's growth. He alleged it was AIMIM which threatened Bangladeshi author Taslima Nasreen not to enter Hyderabad again when she had visited the city some years ago. He also asked CM K Chandrasekhar Rao and MIM to clarify if they were speaking in support of Muslims of Bangladesh or Pakistan.

Title: This footwear maker's stock surged over 1,600% in a decade
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Highlights On a yearly basis, the Kolkata-based company's share price, which stood at Rs 1127.35, as of January 1, 2019, has gained around 55.32 per cent

Bata's rival brand, Relaxo Footwears has also performed exceptionally well, having delivered 68.77 per cent return in a year

(Representative image: Bata India website)

NEW DELHI: As equity indices witnessed a record run in the past, it has emerged that the some footwear makers are one of the consistent performers by giving high returns on a longer run as well as on year-on-year basis. One such stock is of Bata India which has zoomed over 1,600 per cent in a decade.

The stock, which traded at Rs 98.08 in 2010 (January 4 to be precise), has risen to Rs 1,751 on January 2, 2020, a growth of 1,685.27 per cent in 10 years, a search on the BSE website showed. Over the last five years, it has surged 163.73 per cent.

On a yearly basis, the Kolkata-based company's share price, which stood at Rs 1127.35, as of January 1, 2019, has gained around 55.32 per cent.

On the other hand, its rival Relaxo Footwears has also performed exceptionally well, having delivered 68.77 per cent return in a year, 272.39 per cent in five years and 6,182.54 per cent in the last 10 years.

However, Khadim India lost around 74.43 per cent during this period; Liberty Shoes posted 32.03 per cent gains in 10 years.

India is the second largest global producer of footwear after China, accounting for 13 per cent of global footwear production at 16 billion pairs, according to ministry of micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs).

Bata India, which is the largest retailer of footwear in India and a part of the Bata Shoe Organization, has a retail network of over 1,200 stores with a turnover estimated at Rs 50,000 crore, including Rs 32,000 crore domestic revenue and Rs 18,000 crore export revenue.

Bata (BN) BV of Netherlands, the parent company, currently holds 52.96 per cent stake in Bata India, data available with BSE showed.

Shares of Bata India settled 0.58 per cent lower at Rs 1,740.80 on Friday.

Title: Chiranjeevi versus Rajasekhar at MAA Event: How it all started
Content:
Read Also:Jeevitha apologies to Chiranjeevi after Rajasekhar creates ruckus at MAA diary launch

On Thursday morning, high drama took place at the launch of the annual diary of the Movie Artistes Association . The event witnessed a war of words between Megastar Chiranjeevi and MAA Vice President Rajasekhar over problems that exist within the association. After the former concluded his speech by stating that all members in the association must work together as one family, Rajasekhar interrupted the proceedings to take the stage and speak about his ongoing tussle with Senior Naresh, the current president of the MAA. The 57-year-old actor also blamed the association for losing out on films and personal losses incurred by him. Though Mohan Babu and Jayasudha tried to stop, their efforts went in vain.As soon as Rajasekhar left the stage, Chiranjeevi condemned the former’s speech and opined that a strong disciplinary action should be taken against Rajasekhar. After this high-tension drama, the Garuda Vega actor has resigned from his post of executive vice president from MAA and tendered an apology for the inconvenience caused to the guests.This latest altercation once again proved that all is not well between the senior heroes. They have always been at loggerheads with each other and here is how it all started.According to reports, the first controversy involving the duo took place way back in 2003. Rajasekhar wanted to remake the 2002 Tamil blockbuster ‘Ramana’ in Telugu and went ahead with the negotiations. However, Chiranjeevi’s team approached the producers with a fancy offer and closed the deal. Titled as Tagore in Telugu, the VV Vinayak directorial went on to become a superhit at the ticket counters. The whole scenario irked the ‘Kalki’ actor a great deal.When Chiranjeevi decided to plunge into politics in 2008, Rajasekhar stated that the former lacks political experience and so, he would not join his party. The comments triggered angry reactions from Mega fans who went berserk and attacked the car of Rajasekhar at Punjagutta. They pelted stones and attacked his car with iron rods causing minor injuries to the actor and his daughter, while his actress-wife Jeevitha was unharmed. After the unsavoury incident, Chiranjeevi drove to Rajasekhar's residence, consoled his family and in a dramatic gesture, tendered apology in the presence of the media. “We are contemporaries in the film industry. Rajasekhar has his own opinions and I respect them,” Chiru said, asking his fans to restrain themselves.However, in the following years, the Rajasekhar Jeevitha couple have made some strong allegations on Praja Rajyam Party and Chiru’s blood bank. The episode was put to rest after the ‘Sye Raa’ actor merged his party with the Congress.From the past few years, it looked like Chiranjeevi and Rajasekhar have buried the hatchet as the latter invited the former to watch his film ‘PSV Garuda Vega’ in 2017. But, with the latest altercation, things have once again turned pretty ugly.

Title: Despite ban, thermocol plates used in gurdwara langar in Ambala
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Home minister Anil Vij serves food to the congregation on Thursday

AMBALA: Despite a ban on the usage of single-use hazardous plastic and thermocol plates in Ambala district, the management committee of Punjabi Gurdwara in Ambala Cantonment used thermocol plates for serving langar the devotees on Thursday. Sikhs and other devotees had converged at the gurdwara to celebrate the birth anniversary of 10th Sikh master Guru Gobind Singh .

The gurdwara management committee defied the anti-plastic and thermocol instructions of the district administration to use the hazardous material. Punjabi Gurdwara management committee president B S Bindra was contacted several times, but he did not answer calls and text messages.

Haryana cabinet minister Anil Vij also visited the gurdwara on Thursday to pay obeisance. Vij also served food to the congregation at the gurdwara. Ambala Cantonment sub-divisional magistrate (SDM) Subhash Sihag was also present in the gurdwara on the occasion.

Vij could not be contacted about langar being served in single-use thermocol plates at the gurdwara despite several attempts. "Single-use plastic is completely banned in Ambala district. We will send a team and check if the Punjabi Gurdwara management committee has defied the orders and a penalty will be imposed accordingly," Ambala Sadar municipal corporation executive officer Vinod Nehra said.

Ambala Cantonment SDM Sihag said, "During the visit it was noticed that thermocol plates were used in the community kitchen and instructions were issued to the gurdwara management committee to not to use those in future. They have assured that they will take care in future. It was a religious event, therefore, it was not appropriate to obstruct the ongoing event."

Title: TTD head priests differ over year-ending temple rituals
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

TTD head priest AV Ramana Deekshitulu

TIRUPATI: The schism among priests at Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams came out in open when honorary chief priest AV Ramana Deekshitulu and chief priest A Venugopala Deekshitulu disagreed over temple rituals on December 31. A group of priests led by Venugopala said Ramana tried to deviate from the norms by trying to use tulasi malas and other flowers brought from his home.

Ramana said as a honorary priest he had the right to adorn garlands to the presiding deity inside the sanctum sanctorum. According to sources, Ramana, who was reinstated as honorary chief priest on December 28, reached the sanctum sanctorum on December 31 after Koil Alwar Tirumanjanam and tried to pour ghee into a set of ghee-lit lamps and adorn tulasi garlands as well as other flowers brought from his home.

But Venugopala pointed out to Ramana, who is his paternal uncle and the honorary chief priest, that it was not proper to bring articles from his home to be used at the temple. He told Ramana that pouring ghee into lamps was the job entrusted to the Jeeyar mutt and that the chief priest and other priests had completed the Alankara procedures.

Ramana said he was pouring ghee into the lamps for the well being of Andhra Pradesh chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy and the well being of the state. Ramana said he had the right to adorn flowers to the deity and pour ghee into the lamps as a honorary chief priest. Senior officials at TTD tried to pacify the priests.

Former TTD trust board member and TDP functionary AV Ramana accused the state government for the division among the priests. ''The government is using Ramana as a pawn to defame the temple. The government should answer how it will safeguard the sanctity of the temple when priests quarrel in front of devotees'', he questioned.

Former TTD trust board member and BJP functionary G Bhanuprakash Reddy said Ramana was functioning in a unilateral manner by deviating from the guidelines. ''Why did TTD bring Ramana back despite him leveling false accusations against the temple administration in the past,'' he asked.

Title: An exhibition to celebrate the indigenous craft of Kutch
Content: Khamir presents Desi Oon, a four-day exhibition a Bikaner House, will be a platform for preserving and facilitating crafts, heritage, and cultural ecology of the Kutch region of Gujarat . It was instituted in the aftermath of the 2001 earthquake with the objective of engagement and development of Kutch's rich creative industries.The exhibition takes one on an extraordinarily intriguing journey of sheep pastoralism, and seeks to familiarise people with the local craft of spinning, weaving and dyeing wool. It will be a rare opportunity to interact with some of Kutch’s most respected artisans and herders, from whom you can learn about the intricacies of wool craft and herding. Khamir has collaborated with weavers, spinners, dyers and designers to organise this exhibition, a first step in a series of events planned to put spotlight on the utility of indigenous wool to urban consumer markets. Some of Kutch’s most respected artisans and herders will also be in attendance at the exhibition and visitors will have an opportunity to interact with them on the intricacies of craft and herding.

Title: Pakistan's centrally contracted players to undergo fitness tests next week
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Babar Azam and Sarfaraz Ahmed. (Getty Images)

Title: Sangeet Natak Akademy organises a series of Susanskriti
Content: Sangeet Natak Akademy organised another successful series of Susanskriti recently at Meghdoot Theatre presenting Kathak exponent Rekha Mehra along with her disciples.Rekha Mehra who is a trained classical dancer has acquired a unique style of her own. An exponent of Kathak Dance, a choreographer, and a social activist, she has skilfully blended Indian mythology with traditional dance style alongside Jaipur and Lucknow Gharana. During Susanskriti, Rekha Mehra accompanied by another senior artist and Kathak exponent Heena Wasen along with Richa Joshi and Abhishek Khichi presented three items in Kathak ensemble.She started her performance with Suryashtakam in Dhamaar Taal. This act was dedicated to Lord Surya – The God of Light who shines upon us every day. This was followed by the second item on Varsha which is about the endearing nature and the beauty of rain.Susanskriti started by Sangeet Natak Akademy in the year 2017, is a monthly event where they promote major Indian traditions in the capital. Various artists from different dance forms have performed on this platform. In the previous series, artists like Guru Rani Khanam, Jayashree Acharya, Rujuta Soman to name a few had already graced the stage with their presence.

Title: Colorful celebration at Sukhadev Campus
Content: Students dressed up in different colors brought the college alive, at the celebrations that took place at Sukhadev College . The college had group day where students tried to match their attire. With students seen decking up in traditional attire and clicking photos and selfies. Students enjoyed the day and various programmes and competitions on the occasion.

Title: Going nowhere, say protesters at Shaheen Bagh
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

On Thursday morning, there were some reports that the protesters had decided to call off their agitation.

NEW DELHI: Amid reports that the 18-day-long protest at Shaheen Bagh against the Citizenship Amendment Act had been called off, the organisers on Thursday said that the agitation would continue.

In the morning, there were reports that the protesters had decided to call off their agitation as "it had been hijacked by politicians". But as the day wore on, it became clear that the protesters, mostly women, were going nowhere.

It was Sharjeel Imam, one of the organisers, who posted on the social media that the protest had been called off. "The protest is being ended to avoid the impending violence from party goons and avoid politicisation of the stage by parties. Police were probably asked not to intervene because BJP intends to intervene themselves. If that happens, our peaceful protest will be tarnished and it will break the morale of the people (sic)," Imam wrote. Later, speaking to TOI , Imam confirmed: "With consensus, we decided to call off the protest."

Immediately after the post, several voices emerged that the protest would continue.

It was later revealed that Brahm Singh, a BJP functionary, had written a letter to Delhi Police that the protesters be removed in 48 hours to end the resultant traffic congestion and problems to citizens. Singh, a resident of Sarita Vihar, told TOI: "We also protested on Thursday (against the jams). We wanted to march to DCP office, but were stopped midway and they (police) took our memorandum. They promised us action."

Protesters called this a veiled threat. "The letter demands violent police intervention and promises politically motivated disruption of a peaceful citizens' protest, mainly led by women residents," said one of them.

Police confirmed that they had received the letter and also that one of the protesting groups had informed them about calling of the agitation. "We are in talks with the protesting groups to shift the agitation elsewhere. However, there has been no breakthrough so far," a senior police officer sa id.

Meanwhile. a march will be held from Jamia Millia Islamia to Shaheen Bagh on Friday.

Title: Pongal gift distribution to start in Tamil Nadu on Jan 9
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

File photo of people waiting to receive Pongal gifts in Tamil Nadu

CHENNAI: The Tamil Nadu government will disburse Rs 1,000 and a hamper -- containing one kg of rice, jaggery and other ingredients used for making sweet delicacy Pongal – as a Pongal gift to each of the 1.67 crore ration cardholders from January 9 to 12.

The government has deposited Rs 1,677 crore as first instalment to distribute the gift. The left-out cardholders would receive the Pongal gift from January 13.

According to a circular, the government has deposited Rs 1,677 crore, out of Rs 1,867 crore, in the Tamil Nadu State Apex Cooperative Bank. The amount would be diverted to district cooperative banks.

Title: Stick to one version over Andhra Pradesh capital: MoS
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

G Kishan Reddy

HYDERABAD: Union minister of state for home G Kishan Reddy on Thursday warned his fellow BJP MPs to not speak different versions over the three capital proposal for Andhra Pradesh . Interacting with media, he said that it was not appropriate for Sujana Chowdary and GVL Narasimha Rao to have different versions on the issue.

"AP has to specify on whether it will be two or three capitals. After that the home ministry will take a view" he said. He made it clear that Centre had no role in deciding the capital. He also said that justice should be done to farmers who had given their land.

TRS & MIM main rivals for civic polls: Kishan Reddy said that in the civic elections, the battle will be mostly between them, AIMIM and TRS. "Failures of the (TRS) government will be big weapon for BJP in the campaign," he said.

Title: Sidharth Malhotra and Kiara Advani make it official as they holiday together on an African safari
Content: Rumoured Bollywood couple, Sidharth Malhotra and Kiara Advani seemed to have taken their relationship to the next level by ringing in the New Year together.The couple, who was spotted arriving in the city together early this morning, is only now sharing some dreamy photos and videos from their exciting holiday in Africa. Interestingly, their social media posts seem to have a lot more in common than we expected.Taking to their Instagram handles, both Sid and Kiara shared some of the best photos from their safari visit. While the hunk shared some photos of himself lying in bed and enjoying the breathtaking view along with another scenery picture, Kiara shared a handful of photos of herself posing in the grasslands and even enjoying the view from a hot air balloon.As if these pics weren't dropping enough hints, it was their similar posts from their take off in a small aircraft that confrimed everything we needed to know.The actors, who have long been rumoured to be in a relationship, reportedly hit it off on the sets of their next ‘Shershaah’. They have also been spotted several times on romantic dates at plush restaurants around the city if not spending time together under the radar. However, when asked about their relationship status, both opted to deny the rumours.

Title: Deepika Padukone was asked if Ranveer Singh too has invested in production of ‘Chhapaak’ and her reply will leave you in splits
Content: Kangana Ranaut fans were in for a surprise on August 21 as the actress announced her arrival on Twitter. And within 10 days of her debut on the micro-blogging site, Kangana has clocked 1 million followers. Title: Only three duty doctors in Assandh civil hospital
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

By: Amit Kumar

KARNAL: The sub-divisional civil hospital in Assandh town of the district is facing a shortage of doctors, staff and infrastructure. It has just three doctors out of a sanctioned strength of 11 medical officers (MO). Posts of several paramedical staff and Class IV employees are also yet to be filled due to which the hospital is unable to deliver to the satisfaction of a large number of patients in the region.

The 50-bed hospital has been reduced to a referral hospital with matters related to emergency care. Due to the shortage to doctors, there is no health service at night. The authorities prefer to refer critical patients and accident victims to Kalpana Chawla Medical College and Hospital in Karnal .

The ultrasound facility also is not available here, forcing the patients, mostly pregnant women, to go to private centres. The hospital also does not have any obstetrician, despite about 100 deliveries reported every month. Reportedly, staff nurses handle delivery cases in the hospital.

The sub-divisional civil hospital sees around 1,000 outpatient department visits on a daily basis, but the shortage of doctors has crippled healthcare services and most of the patients end up going to private hospitals. Against sanctioned post of two, the hospital has only one senior medical officer (SMO), while of 11 sanctioned posts of medical officer (MO), only three are filled. Two posts of staff nurses are vacant, out of 12 sectioned . Two posts of nursing sister, three of lab technicians, two posts of clerk/storekeeper/ cashier, one each of pharmacist, dental hygienist, radiographer, ECG technician, accountant/assistant, steno-typist, OTA, radiographer and 13 of class-IV employees, including sweepers, dresser, ward servant, cook, gardener, washerman, and watchman are also vacant.

Senior medical officer Dr Sandeep Abrol said, “We have sent the request to the higher authorities to depute doctors. The government is going to recruit doctors, hopefully, some will be deputed here as well.”

He claimed that due to the lack of infrastructure, the doctors suggest the patients to get major tests done from Karnal civil hospital or Kalpana Chawla Medical College. He admitted that trained staff nurses handle delivery cases in the absence of an obstetrician.

Title: ‘Malang’: Varun Dhawan, Alia Bhatt, Katrina Kaif and others are all praises for Aditya Roy Kapur’s first look
Content: Rahul Dev and Mugdha Godse have been together since 7 years and their love has only grown with the passing of each day. There's a very secured sense of calmness, well-being and happiness when you talk to them.

Title: Deepika Padukone on '83': Would love to do more realistic films with Ranveer Singh
Content: Actor Deepika Padukone is set to reunite with frequent co-star and husband Ranveer Singh for sports drama '83' and she said it was a 'refreshing' change for the couple who have previously collaborated on Sanjay Leela Bhansali's spectacle films.The 33-year-old star will play Romi Dev, wife to cricketing legend Kapil Dev , to be played by Ranveer.Directed by Kabir Khan, '83' will chronicle India's win under Kapil's captainship, when the team defeated West Indies in the final to clinch their first-ever World Cup trophy in 1983.Deepika, in the past, has worked with Ranveer on larger-than-life movies such as ' Goliyon Ki Raasleela Ram-Leela ', 'Bajirao Mastani' and ' Padmaavat '."It was nice to work with Ranveer in a slightly more realistic setting. Not having to mouth such intense dialogue with that kind of language like we did on three films. It was refreshing. In fact, we had to remind ourselves that 'this is the same actor that I've worked with'."The characters are completely different, the era is completely different. The costume, the sets are so, so different and even refreshing. We both looked at each other and said, 'wow, we should do stuff like this more often together'," she told in a telephonic interview from Mumbai.The actor revealed she doesn't have many scenes in '83' and she took up the project as the role gave her an opportunity to explore the personal side of public figures like Kapil and Romi Dev."The reason I wanted to do this film is because I've seen what an important support system my mother has been in my father's life as an athlete and her contribution to his success. I saw many similarities when it came to Romi and Kapil Dev."While '83' is really the three week journey from the time they left India to the time they won the World Cup, there are smaller moments of their personal side of their personality as well which I thought was very exciting," Deepika, daughter of former Indian ace badminton player Prakash Padukone and homemaker Ujjala Padukone, added.The actor will next start working on a romantic thriller, directed by Shakun Batra. A Dharma Productions project, the movie will also star Siddhant Chaturvedi and Ananya Panday."There is going to be another actor. It's basically about two couples and domestic noir is the genre. We start filming in March," Deepika added.She is also set to play the central role of Draupadi in a retelling of the epic story of Mahabharata from the female perspective.Deepika said, when it comes to Mahabharata, the audience has always been 'fed' a unidimensional point-of-view."There's a lot of excitement within the audience to see this film as it is not a narrative that we're very familiar with..."I think we've always been fed a certain perspective on Mahabharata and it'd be interesting for us to see a different perspective. Same narrative, different perspective," the actor, who will co-produce the film with Madhu Mantena, said.The actor is looking forward to the release of 'Chhapaak', which also marks her production debut. The Meghna Gulzar-directed film will hit the screens on January 10.

Title: Thinner men have less SEX than fat men, says study
Content: There are many disadvantages and health hazards of being overweight but it seems a man’s sex life is an exception to this. According to a recent study, overweight men or those with higher BMI have more sex than those who are on the lighter side of the weighing scale.Scientists and researchers from the Anglia Ruskin University in the UK arrived at this interesting conclusion—that fat men have more sex than thin men—after analysing almost 5,000 sexually active British people. The study was published in the journal PLOS One. Surprisingly, men with more flabs had lesser body image issues than thin men and that gave them the confidence to have sex, stated the report. The researchers also found that overweight women were also 16 per cent more likely to have more sex than their thinner counterpart.The researchers, who carried out the study which is believed to be the first to draw a link between the weight of a person and his frequency of intercourse, also made this observation that overweight people are more likely to be in a happier and satisfying relationship. “I believe the observed association is owing to spouses in satisfying relationships relaxing their efforts to maintain their weight because they are no longer motivated to attract a mate. Therefore, those who are overweight are more likely to be in a happy and satisfying relationship and…more likely to engage in frequent sexual activity,” lead researcher Dr Lee Smith told the journal PLOS One.This news might come as a relief to a lot of people who are struggling to lose weight, however, they should take this with a pinch of salt. According to other studies, overweight people or people with higher BMI suffers from sexual problems. According to a report published in WebMD, “Up to 30% of obese people seeking help controlling their weight indicate problems with sex drive, desire, performance, or all three. Often, the latest research shows, these problems can be traced to physical conditions that co-exist with obesity.”What people should aim for is to have the perfect BMI rather than trying to lose weight unnecessarily just to look good and magazine-cover-worthy. Because health is wealth and only a person with a healthy body and mind can have a happy and fulfilling sex life, right?

Title: Fun Fiesta Camp organised in Noida society
Content:
tambola

With an aim to inculcate creative education among children, a ‘ Fun Fiesta Camp ’ was held in Spring Meadows Society of Greater Noida west. Nearly 85 children took part in the camp which was organised by JM International School. Various competitions and activities were held at the camp which included race,, talent hunt, colouring competition and more. The kids were given certificates and gifts in order to keep them motivated.“In today’s day when children are getting addicted to gadgets and phones, it is important that they take part in such activities as it promotes creativity and healthy competition . We hope more such activities are organised here in the future,” said Vikas Katiyar , a resident.

Title: Chennai: Outdated tech, staff crunch put flights over city at risk
Content:
Chennai airport

Use of decade-old

air traffic control

system has led to increasing air misses over Chennai. Overhaul is the only solution

1 No upgrade in tech, only software updates

2 No radar in small airport

s

3

S

low recruitment and training

4 Confusing airspace

Chennai airport will be ready to handle more flights by the end of 2020 as new terminal, rapid exit taxiways and a parallel taxiway for the main runway, all built at a cost of a little more than ₹2,000 crore, will become operational. But the development of air traffic control infrastructure is not in sync with the development of amenities for passengers and the number of new flights and frequency additions allowed. The last attempt to improve air traffic control (ATC) was done almost a decade ago when automation was commissioned in 2011. Grappling with slow machines, controllers have been making mistakes that caused a spike in air misses in 2018 in Chennai airspace. There were 13 such incidents in 2018.AAI took temporary measures such as training and corrections in procedures to bring it down to nine in 2019. But controllers say unless systems are changed or upgraded, safety is at risk. The Air Traffic Controllers Guild had sounded a warning after controllers struggled with slow machines in Mumbai to handle the spurt in overflying flights in 2019 when Pakistan closed its airspace.Here’s what ails our airport:With major intercontinental air routes passing over the city, the air traffic controllers who sit in Chennai airport manage more than 2,000 planes in areas spread over the southern peninsula. However, the attempts to modernise the control systems have slowed down since 2011. “Air traffic control automation was the last improvement that was done in Chennai. It’s like using 2011 laptops in 2020 with only software updates. Controllers battle slow machines that affect accuracy of signals about location of planes and their speed,” said an Airports Authority of India (AAI) official.Sources say the government process is so slow that annual maintenance contracts for most of the machines are given almost after their shelf life is over. “Machines with high configuration are needed. Air traffic control has moved to artificial intelligence in Euro Control. They keep updating the hardware and software every couple of years,” an official said. There were two attempts to use satellite tech to guide planes to take off and land at airports. A pilot project was done using flights. But it has not taken off after the ground equipment got destroyed in the 2015 floods.ATC teams have been split into those controlling flights in the upper air, those handling flights in different sectors like teams for planes flying over the Bay of Bengal and those that handle low-flying planes at different airports. But potential for human error continues to be high because many procedures are still manual.AAI has an archaic rule that surveillance radars can only be installed at airports that handle at least 30 flights a day. With the ministry of civil aviation pushing for regional connectivity, the number of flights in the southern airspace has increased. This, coupled with the presence of small airports in Tamil Nadu, Kerala and restricted airspace controlled by air force, makes better surveillance crucial to minimise mistakes.Airports such as Madurai and Trichy need surveillance radar that can monitor flights at 200 nautical miles. In its absence, controllers often struggle with blind spots near Madurai on the Chennai-Thiruvananthapuram route. Small airports such as Tuticorin see around 16 flights a day. Salem airport has started to receive flights. This means, there are too many planes, especially lowflying ones. “These planes while descending and ascending often come in the way of other flights. It causes delay and flights waste fuel. The controller who monitors the airspace from Chennai needs to keep a watch over too many intersections. This increases the load,” said an official.The need is for new radars at more airports, improvement of existing equipment. Sources say that updating and adding new radar will not cost as much as building a terminalt.Air traffic controllers are crucial to air safety, but their recruitment and training has been slow. The number of flights has been increasing steadily but AAI has not ensured adequate controllers at airports.It takes at least a year to train and deploy fresh controllers. As recruitment is often stuck in government delays, the available people are deployed and used in an irrational manner. Chennai has around 250 air traffic controllers while the requirement is 350 as DGCA is looking at implementing duty time controllers soon.“Several controllers are deployed at small stations with not much work. As the choice of controllers is limited, senior controllers are deployed to handle planes instead of using them to train and monitor as is done abroad,” said an official. The average age of controllers is around 50 and it’s a job that requires good reflexes. Poor reflexes will have an impact,” he said. This was evident in the unusually high number of air-miss incidents in 2018. There was almost a near-miss every other day in some of the months. “New flights are being allowed without checking whether traffic control can handle them. This is forcing inexperienced people to handle planes and move up to senior posts leading to errors,” said former pilot and air safety expert Mohan Ranganathan.Airspace is not designed well for pilots to plan flights in an efficient and fuel-saving manner. Old routes based on conventional navigation aids and new ones based on RNAV (area navigation), which allow pilots to take the shortest route, coexist. The path followed by planes to land and the ones used by overflying often intersect causing confusion among controllers. A small mistake by pilots leads to a near air-miss. The flexi-use airspace by merging defence airspace and civil airspace is yet to be implemented smoothly.

Title: Railway services resume in Kangra after six months
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

DHARAMSHALA: After almost six months, narrow gauge train connecting parts of Punjab and Himachal are back in business. Rail service was suspended following landslide in Kangra district in July this year.

Out of 14 trains that run between Pathankot of Punjab and Jogindernagar of Himachal Pradesh , 10 has been resumed while four are still off the track. The service resumed on Tuesday evening.

Divisional railway manager Rajesh Agrrawal said four trains will remain suspended till next orders. New time table has been issued, he added.

The railway service was started during British era in 1926. Trains run from Pathankot Junction to Jogindernagar. It comes under Ferozpur division of Northern railway. The track is 164km long.

Many villages in Kangra district that are still deprived of roads are connected through rail service with rest of the area. With no rail service, old people and school-going children were the worst sufferers. The landslide had taken place near Lunsu village of Kangra district. Trains were running between Pathankot and Jawalamukhi road and from Baijanth to Koparlahd area.

Title: Alia Batt to resume Gangubai Kathiawadi shoot from THIS day
Content: After Inshallah ( Salman Khan co-starrer) got stalled, Alia Bhatt and Sanjay Leela Bhansali teamed up once again for Gangubai Kathiawadi . Alia who plays the titular character in the film, will soon begin shooting for the next schedule. Sharing the development on the film, a source associated with the project informs, “The team was on New Year’s break. They will get back in the next week to begin the next schedule of the film.” As per the source, come Jan 5, Alia along with the cast and crew will resume the shoot. The film is being shot in Mumbai, where a set of the Kamathipura (red light area) of the 40s has been recreated. The team is apparently looking at wrapping up the shoot by May this year, with the release being slated for Sept 11. For the unawares, Gangubai was the matriarch of Kamathipura in Mumbai. She was a young woman who was pushed into prostitution. However, she turned into one of its biggest supporters. The film is based on a chapter from S Hussain Zaidi ’s book, Mafia Queens of Mumbai.

Title: Shraddha Kapoor speaks about biggest takeaways from 2019, says 'will explore new sides of myself as an actor'
Content: When it comes to varied, versatile and entertaining performances by women, 2019 is a hard year to beat. Names like Bhumi Pednekar, Vidya Balan Shraddha Kapoor are a few who done an excelling job when it came to acting. Talking about Shraddha Kapoor , the actress captured our imagination and our hearts with a series of a whirlwind and remarkable performances in 'Saaho' and 'Chhichhore' proving that she is a powerhouse of talent.Shraddha's portrayal of varied roles made a powerful statement in 2019. The actress is in the best phase of her career and looking back at what according to her was her biggest take away from 2019, Shraddha says, "It has to be juggling between the shoots and then having two back-to-back releases. It’s my professional contentment that became the biggest highlight for me. Also, the two different characters and beautiful scripts are my biggest takeaways from 2019. That makes me do new things and work with fresh energy and different people, and explore new sides of myself as an actor."In spite of her beauty and charm that Shraddha has exhibited on-screen, her roles always had a shade of pretense in them. Shraddha's talent for creating a memorable character is unmatched. Her energy and work will take 2020 a notch higher for her and we can't wait to watch her on the big screen again.On the work front, Shraddha will be seen in "Street Dancer 3D" co-starring Varun Dhawan and helmed by Remo D'Souza and in Baaghi franchise "Baaghi 3" directed by Ahmed Khan, opposite Tiger shroff . Both of these movies are slated to hit the screen early this year.

Title: Two peddlers held with heroin in Chandigarh
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

CHANDIGARH: The police arrested two drug peddlers after heroin was recovered from them in the city on Wednesday night.

Sarangpur police said a checkpoint was set up at EWS Colony, Dhanas. "On seeing the cops, a man tried to flee. But he was chased and nabbed. He identified himself as Mukesh Kumar, a resident of Dhanas. During checking, 5gram heroin was found on him. He has been arrested under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act," said a cop.

This is the first FIR under the NDPS Act in the city in 2020.

The second such case was reported from Sector 25. A Sector 24 police post team was patrolling near the rally ground. They frisked a man - Sandeep, a resident of Khuda Lahora - on suspicion. After 5gram heroin was recovered from him, the cops arrested him under the NDPS Act.

Police said both Mukesh and Sandeep were addicts and took to drug trade to fund their addiction. On Thursday, a local court sent the two to 14-day police custody.

Title: ‘Contract not renewed, devices left unattended’
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

JODHPUR: Debunking the argument of health minister Raghu Sharma that BJP has been raising the issue of infants’ deaths in Kota with a view to divert attention from CAA, deputy leader of opposition Rajendra Singh Rathore said here on Thursday that the saffron party, on the contrary, has been constantly addressing the confusion over the Act.

Rathore, who reached Jodhpur on Thursday ahead of the “jan-jagran” rally of the Union home minister Amit Shah , said there were many broken medical devices in the Kota hospital because the annual rate contract has not been revised.

“The devices, which were broken down, have not been repaired because the annual rate contract was not worked out,” he said and claimed that even the meeting of the death review committee has not taken place for the past six months.

Title: Chandigarh: Murder suspect has suspicious turn of mind, say police
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

CHANDIGARH: Ten years ago, Maninder Singh - the suspect in the murder of 29-year-old nurse Sarabjit Kaur - had allegedly killed his first girlfriend on finding the number of another man in her cellphone.

During investigation into the nurse murder case, police found that in 2010, Maninder had stabbed to death his girlfriend, who lived as a tenant at his house in Sector 30. The victim had gone to Karnal for a month-long training in 2010 and Maninder used to call her on her cellphone. On finding her phone busy on several occasions, he started suspecting that she was having an affair with another man. One day, Maninder checked her phone and found the number of a man. On this, he went to meet her at a park near Karna lake and allegedly stabbed her to death. Karnal police had registered a murder case and arrested him. He was convicted by a court and sentenced to life imprisonment. Maninder challenged the verdict in the Punjab and Haryana high court. After he had spent around five years in jail, the HC granted him bail and the case is pending.

Sector 31 police said cellphone of Sarabjit was also missing and switched off since her murder. Cops suspect Maninder fled with her phone after killing her. Police said the accused had switched off his phone, too, and his last location was Industrial Area, Phase II. Cops said he locked the door from outside and took away the key after murdering Sarabjit in room number 301 of Hotel Sky in Industrial Area, Phase II. Hotel staff had opened the room with a master key on not getting any response from inside on January 1.

Police said family members of the suspect were also interrogated, but they said they had not seen him since December 30 and submitted a missing complaint at Industrial Area, Phase-I, police station. Police, on Thursday, handed over Sarabjit's body to her family after post-mortem. They have returned to Sangrur to perform her cremation.

Title: Adam Sandler's Twitter account hacked
Content: The 'Uncut Gems' actor became the latest victim of hacking when a series of racist and offensive posts were made from his Twitter account this Thursday.This came just days after Mariah Carrey's Twitter account was taken over in a similar manner.According to the Hollywood Reporter, Adam Sandler 's Twitter page went haywire starting from 5:34 PM (local time) when derogatory remarks started to appear that targeted racial groups and famous people.While one Tweet made an offensive remark about Mariah Carey another had an abusive post that targeted the American president, Donald Trump . The hackers also re-tweeted a post that made racist remarks about Barack Obama A representative of Sandler intimated the media that the hijacked account was locked instantly when the issue came to their notice.Just like in Carey's case, the Tweets on Sandler's page referred to the Chuckling Squad hacker group that was responsible for breaching through Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey 's Twitter account back in August 2019.

Title: Manas runs test shoot for film on Dinesh Gupta
Content: Manas Mukul Pal’s long-awaited project on freedom fighter Dinesh Gupta is finally going to hit the floors in February. Before that, the director and his team ran a test shoot at Baranagar on Monday. “It is to finalise the look and feel of the film. It was a full-on shoot with the actors, including Samiul Alam. I am told that such test shoots are not so common in Tollywood. That is understandable because pf the cost it incurs. However, it is also very helpful,” said the director.Besides Samiul, who also played one of the protagonists in Manas’s debut feature Sahaj Pather Goppo, the film features Mithun Chakraborty . The veteran actor has agreed to work with Manas on this project. He signed on the dotted line earlier this year. According to the director, Mithun will be portraying a very important character. “His character is not a well-known name. There are several unsung heroes in our freedom movement. We found this character after much research. Mithun was thrilled when I read the script to him. The shooting will be done this winter,” the director said.Elaborating on the shooting schedule, Manas explained that it is going to be a long affair. “We are covering a long period of time. There are three schedules so far. Since the time span is long, we have decided to break it into several seasons. While the February leg is finalised, the other bits will also be confirmed soon,” Manas signed off.

Title: Fourth arrest in Sector 15 double murder
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Representative image

CHANDIGARH: The UT police crime branch on Thursday arrested the fourth accused in the December 18 murder of two college students in Sector 15.

Following a tip-off, the crime branch laid a trap in Sector 22 and nabbed Amit, 23, a resident of Nayagaon, Mohali. Two country-made pistols and five live cartridges were recovered from him.

Police have also impounded a Volkswagen Polo car that the accused used in the murder of college students - Vineet, who was in his early 20s, and Ajay Sharma, 22. While four arrests have been made in the case, cops are on the look out for the fifth accused.

Title: What are Iman’s New Year resolutions?
Content: Sushant Singh Rajput’s death case is currently being investigated by the Central Bureau Of Investigation (CBI) and they have been questioning a lot of people connected to the late actor. According to the latest report on India Today, three officers who are a part of the probe, have stated that their team has so far not found any evidence that suggests Sushant was murdered on June 14.

Title: Among those rescued, this fireman had cheated death a decade ago too
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

Smoke billows from a battery factory where firefighters were dousing fire at Peeragarhi on Thursday.

NEW DELHI: Mahavir, one of the firefighters who was rescued from under the debris, is nicknamed “Daredevil” as he had a miraculous escape in a similar way during the Nai Sadak fire in 2010. He was buried under a pile of debris and had to be pulled out to safety. His colleagues said he is one of the first responders to any major fire in the city.

Firemen Manjeet Rana and Mahavir were rescued within the first hour of the fire breaking out. Mahavir suffered severe injuries on his leg, hip and ankle.

Vijay Dahiya, who was also trapped in the debris, had a lucky escape suffering only minor injuries. He recalled that while they were spraying water on the blaze in the early hours, there was a sudden explosion that literally made the ground sink under their feet. Because of this, the men standing on the boundary wall were sucked into the debris. Dahiya jumped in to save his fellow firemen, but got injured when a second portion of the building collapsed.

Most of the firemen escaped with minor injuries as they fell between concrete slabs because of which they were shielded from the falling debris.

“Baal baal bach gaya (I escaped by a hair’s breadth),” these were the words uttered by Dahiya after he was discharged from hospital later in the day.

Inducted in Delhi Fire Service in 2009, Dahiya was posted at the Rohini fire station. He sustained injuries on his shoulder and knee while trying to rescue Rana, who is currently admitted in the ICU with a leg and pelvic fracture and breathing difficulty.

“We received a call about the fire around 7.40am. First, we rescued Vijender Kashyap, a worker at the factory. When we started moving the tin, cardboard packing boxes and slabs, a part of the building near the lift collapsed and the debris landed on us,” said Dahiya.

Fireman Dalbir, who had a close shave from falling debris and suffered injuries on his shoulder, said that the basement had turned into a pool of fire. Because of this, the structure started swaying before it collapsed.

“I could hear my colleagues calling out our names, but we couldn’t respond because of the toxic smoke and smell. It was only after they spotted one of our hands that rescue operations began. There was no space between the collapsed portion of the building and the adjacent wall,” Dalbir said.

Title: Meghwal fourth minister to seek law on population control
Content:
This story is from January 3, 2020

JAIPUR: Rajasthan ’s social justice and empowerment minister Bhanwar Lal Meghwal on Thursday expressed concern over rapid population growth in the country and stressed on the need for bringing a law on population control saying, “The new slogan of the government should be 'hum do, humare ek' (one family, one child) instead of 'hum do, humare do' (one family, two children).”

Earlier, on December 31, three ministers of the Gehlot government, including health minister Raghu Sharma, transport minister Pratap Singh Khachariyawas and minister of state (MoS), information and public relation, Subhash Garg, had collectively advocated that a law on population control was the need of the hour. They also stressed on the need for giving birth to "one child, instead of two".

Meghwal said this while addressing the reporters on Thursday after the 'Jan Sunvai' held at Pradesh Congress office here. "I believe that the government of India should bring a law on population control mandating that parents should not give birth to more than one child, be it a girl or a boy.

There should not be any discrimination between a boy and a girl. Therefore, instead of "Hum do, humare do", the slogan should be slogan should be "Hum do, humare ek". China is the only state which has been able to take tough steps in controlling rapid population growth in their country." "Poor people were so terrified because of the errors committed by the officials in implementing Sanjay Gandhi 's idea of sterilization for population control that it led to the defeat of our government in the 1977 general elections. But no law should be brought to intimidate the people of the country," he added. He added, both ministers and secretaries incharge of districts must visit districts together.
